11532.content:
So there's lots of Jean Greys in the multiverse out there.

There's the Original Jean Grey, who's something of a hot commodity thanks to her possession of the Phoenix Force. She's a founding member of the X-Men, a lover of Scott Summers (Cyclops) and a very powerful psychic! Has something of a bad side though. Depending on whether or not she's in control of the Phoenix Force, some stories involving her get a little planet explodey. Has something of a bad reputation for cheating death.

Or there's the Time Displaced Jean Grey (teen Jean...Jeen?) from the pages of All-New X-Men. She and the other founding X-Men (Scott, Bobby, Hank, and Warren) have been brought to the future by Beast in hopes of sobering up Scott Summers. She's not nearly as versed in her powerset, and she's not really as moral either. She reads people's minds by accident most of the time, but she's not adverse to making people think what she wants them to think. Still pretty new to this whole "X-Man" thing. Also to this whole "future" thing.

But then there's also some alternate versions of Jean too. So yeah.
11532.title: 50 Shades of Grey

115322.content:
Okay, so you want the teenaged Jean Grey from All-New X-Men. Now the only hump in the road is figuring out just how our fledgling psychic is going to start gaining weight. She's a superhero after all, and that requires an awful lot of calorie burning...

Well she's from the past, right? Nobody will shut up about how unhealthy everything is these days. I mean think about it. We've got fast food restaurants coming out the wazoo, it's no wonder everyone's so fat nowadays! It's more than understandable that someone not used to such an indulgent culture getting a little swept up in all the consumption and consumerism. Maybe Jean has an All-New experience with Culture Shock?

Or hey, thinking about it now, why does Jean even need to move at all? She can float. And float other stuff to her using the same telekinesis. Seriously, if you could get the remote without actually moving, wouldn't you? Well without an Xavier there to guide her on the "responsible" use of her powers, it's a little understandable that she might get a little... lazy.

Or, uh... maybe something else?
115322.title: an All-New Jean Grey

choices: Jean sees that she's gotten a bit softer. Nothing to be concerned about.
A true potbelly but she can work it off. At a later time, naturally.
She's rocking an absolute buddha belly! How could she let this happen?!
She's gotten quite big but is in utter denial.
She's skinny and fit as ever. Or, she at least, thinks she is...
1153222.content:
Jean sighed contently as she floated a plate of hotdogs and wings over to her position on the couch. She grabbed hold of the plate with her hand and started to telekinetically bring the food up to her mouth.

Ever since she'd come to the future, things had been a whirlwind of action. It had made her appreciate these moments of calm and quiet so much more. Not to mention, for all the crap the future threw at her, at least it had good food. So many things to try, so many more restaurants and that was before one went on to the internet and saw all the various crazy ideas! It was a tad overwhelming at first, but Jean had taken to it well enough as it helped take the edge of things. She'd also gotten into the habit of using her telekinesis a lot more. Her control was quickly increasing, the amount of power she could throw behind it was astonishing and she found multi-tasking to becoming easier and easier with every day that passed. She'd begun to use it in her every day life. It seemed only natural. What was the point in moving multiple feet to get an object when she could quickly bring it to herself with just a thought? Not only was it more efficient, it helped her to acclimate her powers to almost natural instinct.

Now, several people had express concern over her new eating and telekinetic habits. Not to her face, few had the courage for that, but they were definitely thinking it. Jean's telepathy made sure she knew.

'She should be careful. She's going to get fat.'

'Man, if she keeps that up...'

'Is Jean looking a bit bigg-OH CRAP! She can read minds! I'm sorry!'

Jean had to stifle a giggle at that last one. Scott was so easy to fluster sometimes. One would think she'd be angry. A girl's weight was a touchy subject by most standards. But Jean was not overtly concerned. Her powers dealt with her mind, not her body. Even if she turned into a butterball, it wouldn't really affect what she could do or hinder her performance. Heck, that was part of her reasoning of using her telekinesis so much more, to demonstrate that physicality really didn't enter the equation where she was concerned. If she happened to enjoy some extra perks or indulgences, what did matter at the end of the day?

'Besides, it's not like I'm fat or anything, anyway,' Jean reassured herself. She looked down at herself and saw...
1153222.title: Power Abuse!

choices: Jean goes through her memories and finds that she has gotten THAT lazy.
Jean tries to remember and finds that there are gaps in her memory!
Someone swings by before Jean can reflect. Who is it?
11532223.content:
Jean's eyes widened considerably as her gaze met the bulbous gut that was occupying her lap. That hadn't been there before! Jean knew she'd gotten a tad lazy but this, this was ridiculous. Jean was so taken aback that she nearly lost her psychic grip on the floating food and plate before her.

Jean brought her hands to her stomach and almost screamed when she felt the taunt flesh of her domed stomach against her palms. She squeezed and patted it, as if trying to make sure that the ruination bulging from where her toned stomach had been was real. To her utter dismay, it was.

'I-I-I look like I'm expecting!.' She mentally wailed.

She couldn't have eating so much. She couldn't have become so lazy. Not in such a short period of time and definitely not without noticing. She wracked her brain, trying to recollect what could have led up to this...
11532223.title: She's rocking an absolute buddha belly! How...

choices: A knock on the door? Who may it be?
115322231.content:
"C'mon, Jeanie. Think...think, think. I've only been here for a while, this is impossible.." The redhead paced back and forth across the wooden tiles of her bedroom floor. The soft ball of flesh, that she sadly had to call her gut, wobbled with every step she took. And Jean felt it every time.

And she suddenly stopped in place, fingers placed onto her temple as her brows furrowed. Found one.

About three weeks ago. Oh, that wasn't that long ago...

"Jean, I think of you as one of my most treasured friends, and I am surely glad to have you as a teammate..but, is this efficient for the both of us?" Hank pushed up his glasses with his hand, before going down for his 56th push-up of the day. Jean on the other hand, laying across the, yet to be hairy, back of her teammate, a book telekinetically floating up in the air, and a chocolate bar making it's way into her maw.

"Look, Hank.. I just, dwant get tha whole werkouht thingy. Ah can just-- Mmph, good chocolate bar, never thought Hershey's would become this good!" The redhead exclaimed.

Hank just groaned as he lowered himself once more, "You were saying?"

"Oh! Yeah, the whole telekinesis part? What's the point of getting even more abs, it's all in the head is it not?"

Though she had a point, Jean's flat as an ironing board, had it's slight bulge, as another chocolate bar unwrapped itself as it made it's way towards her lips. Quietly.

"Jean, mind or not, I don't see why not you shouldn't have to work on your limbs, you know I've read our bodies are way more important i--- Is that another Hershey's bar?"

"Uh, no." That was most definitely a lie.

"Ah! I knew those Hershey bars were too good to be true..mmphm..making me gai- WHAT THE HECK?!" Jean tossed the halfway done bar across the room, hitting a wall with a thud.

"Ohnoohnoohmygod." Jean panicked, food coming to her when she was distracted?! Was this like a fat person's mind? Oh, god.

"Okay, Jeanie. No more food, only thinking about...how I got pregnant with a food baby." She frowned, looking down at the gut that sprouted out. Luckily she can..she can see the tips of her toes?

A few days ago

Rachel Grey and Kitty Pryde stood near by one of the many kitchen counters, both mutants stared out to the nearest couch, where resident Jean Grey sat and watched a movie.

"It's just...so.." Rachel spoke out, taking a sip of coffee from her mug. "Weird?" Kitty finished the sentence, "I know, your mom is suddenly..how old again?"

"I don't even want to know." She took another sip from her mug.

Jean on the other hand, was stretched across the couch, her head rested comfortably on a stack of pillows, and her eyes set onto the TV screen.

"Hey..Ma..Jean..shit." Rachel coughed into her fist, she was holding a sandwich, and a can of Pepsi in her hands. "Hm?" Jean perked up, "Oh, hi.. Rachel!" Yeah, this was awkward for the both of them.

"So." Rachel started.

"Yeah.." Jean..yeahed.

"Heresthesandwichyourewelcome!" Rachel said, arms out with the can and wrapped sandwich out for Jean, leaving Jean to sit up, but Rachel noticed the slight roll her stomach bunched into, and surprised she didn't even notice her..mom already had a mom bod.

Wait that's weird, Rachel shook her head and went off.

Kitty snickered as Rachel stood by her again, "Went well I suppose?" "Shutu-"

A loud BRUURP came from Jean's direction. Which she replied with a tiny, "sorry!"

Jean opened her eyes once again, "Okay, that was nothing! Just..just me enjoyi- NOT AGAIN!" A sandwich floated itself to her lips, basically pushing it self in. She frowned, and pushed the sandwich away.

"Last. One."

The redhead placed her fingers onto her temple, furrowed her brows..and.

The room was dark, completely black except the shine of a computer screen, reflecting onto Jean's face as she started into it.

And if you were to look close enough, while skimming through the internet, Jean Grey found a site dedicated to fat wo--


"OKAY, THAT'S DEFINITELY ENOUGH." She shoved the sandwich into her mouth and tore off a chunk of it. Chewing furiously as she made her way to her bed, and flopped down, stomach doing the same.

"I'm..fat." She sighed, telekinetically feeding herself.

How can this get any worse?

Oh, wait.

Eventually she had to give in, and when her finger was on her one of the many saved ordering apps. That was it.

Looking both ways, the coast was clear, and Kitty phased through the floor to the hall beneath her gracefully. Those dance lessons do pay off. And with a quick phase, she poked her head through Jean's door and caught the redhead in her act.

Jean was bright read, as her cheeks were puffed out by her telekinetic feeding. Quickly grabbing at her bed sheets to cover any sight of belly possible. But kitty didn't even seem to mind, her head was still through the door, sort of squinting but she brushed it off.

"Hey, Jeanie! Just wanted to go and check if you were hungry or something." Which the brown haired mutant ended with a slight snicker, waiting for her response. Wiggling her phone around, she smirked, "Technology, you can order whatever you want, Grey. Anything."

And Jean looked at her, and.....

The duo pig out, Kitty and Jean gets indigestion (burping and farting)
115322231111.content:
"Um, Kitty... I don't think I should..." Jean began slowly. "Oh c'mon! I'll bet you've worked up an appetite!" Kitty smiled as she came in and sat down on Jean's bed.

"Here." she said as she opened one app. "This is for that pizza place down on 52nd. You can get three extra large pizzas with your choice of toppings and a side order of breadsticks, complete with dipping sauce." She explained, showing Jean the first app. Jean looked interested so Kitty opened another app.

"Here is one from KFC. You can get a regular or family sized meal of chicken, mashed potatoes and biscuits. You can also get corn on the cob if you'd like and a cookie for dessert." Kitty continued.

Jean was quiet as Kitty showed her a few more apps for a Chinese dinery and a taco place. She knew she should keep trying to loose the weight, but these foods sounded really yummy. Her belly was rumbling at the thought of it.

"Jeanie? You okay?" Kitty asked, noticing her younger friend's daydreaming. "Huh? Oh, yeah Kitty. I-I'm okay." Jean said quickly, blushing at her zoned out moment.

"Well? which one do you want?" Kitty asked, nodding to the six open apps on her phone.

Jena was silent as she thought it over and then... "I want all of it!" she smiled. Kitty smirked. "I kinda had a feeling you'd say that. Okay. Let's do it."

With that, Kitty began placing orders for tacos, Chinese food, pizza and KFC, as well as some baked goods for dessert. Jean smiled happily at the thought of the upcoming feast.

"-Yeah. So that's six large pizzas with pepperoni, cheese and meat and one large order of breadsticks with tomato sauce." Kitty was saying into her phone as she talked with the guy at the pizza parlor. "Okay. Thanks." She hung up and placed the order at the Chinese and taco eateries. After doing so, she hung up and smiled at Jean.

"It should be here in an hour." she said as she sat back down, Jean plopping down beside her. "Are you gonna eat with me?" Jean asked with a smile.

Kitty nodded. "Yeah. I was getting kinda peck-ish myself." she confessed with a grin.

"Can we eat in here?" Jean asked hopefully. "Sure. I figured we would so you won't be humiliated by your current size." Kitty smiled as she put an arm around Jean's shoulders.
115322231111.title: "Kitty, I really shouldn't--"

choices: Rachel attempts to help out Jean.
1153222311111.content:
"Ohhh....god." Jean, and Kitty simultaneously groaned at the same time, both girls flopping hard onto Jean's bed, and wincing as their impact cause their ballooned out guts to shake inside their tight costumes. Both girls, flat on their bloated butts, with their stomachs sticking out almost abnormally to the ceiling. Packed to the brim with a variety of different fast foods, especially poor Jean, the..."bigger of the two" who's already pudgy stomach, was stiff and made her look like she was overdue. Kitty on the other hand, had it easy, yet still owning a watermelon sized gut, in place where her flat board stomach once was.

An hour wait was enough to make both girls completely ravenous, and it did, sort of worrying. The food came in, and in a sort time, it was gone. The remaining wrappers, grease stains, crumbs, and others laid around the culprits. Getting a small whimper out of Jean as she realized, turning her head to look at Kitty. "Think..um..we over did it?" The redhead nervously smiled.

With a frown, the mutant slapped her own gut, and not surprised as it gurgled almost angrily. Opening her mouth to respond, kitty quickly closed them, and Jean saw as her cheeks puffed up. A sound like someone was revving up an engine, pushed out of her lips and she sighed, eyes locking with the redhead. "We over did it? What do you...BHHTHINKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKK." Kitty was taken back as her words mixed into her belch, but as the two laid in silence, she started hollering. Slightly wincing to give her gut a quick a rub.

"Didya hear that, Jeanie!" She exclaimed, "Haven't burped like that since I was a teenager! Which wasn't that long ago, but y'know.." She shrugged, and heaved her self up off the bed, gut sticking out inches infront of her as she made her way across the room. "Kitty, it's probably just the foo-"
"Jean." Kitty looked at her, "Kitty." Jean looked back. "Jean.". "What, kitt--" and her green eyes widened as

"BBBHJEEAAAAAAAAAANNNNNIEEEE!" Kitty sighed, patted her gut, and bowed. Leaving Jean in some sort of disgust, before laughter started slipping out of her, and the two started laughing out loud like a pair of bloated hyenas.

Jean, too embarrassed really to do anything, watched as kitty scavenged for any left over sodas and chugged them whole, leaving her with the ability to belch out the alphabet, and even an entire math equation, which she solved! That left Jean clapping.

"C'mon, Jean. Just one." Kitty pleaded. "Kitty, please- who knows, with my powers I could..I could blow you away or something!" With an all too real worry, kitty brushed it off, sliding over a can of soda, and watching it roll until it bumped into Jean's gut. She swiftly grabbed the drink, cracked it opened, and took a large sip..... "Urp."

"That's..it? Well, it was som-"

"Hey, guys! Woah...what the hell.." Rachel stood in the doorway and scanned the room, seeing the junk left behind, and the awful smell. Jean burned bright red, but Kitty stood right up, waddling over to Rachel and giving her a hug, her gut pressing right into the stick of a girl. "Think I'm done for the night, you redheads stick together...or whatever." She patted Rachel on the back and walked off.

Rachel looked at Jean, and Jean looked at Rachel, cocking her head to the side softly as a long drawn out burp left her lips quietly, heating the poor girl even more than she already was. And making this way too awkward for Rachel.

"We...had dinner?"

"...yeah, I see that."
1153222311111.title: Big bellied X-women

The next morning Kitty, Jean and Rachel eat themselves sick at breakfast
11532223111111.content:
Jean and Rachel were quiet for a moment, then Rachel spoke. "So um... how was your guys' dinner?" she asked, eyeing the numerous bits of debris on Jean's floor. "It was really yummy. I had no idea food in the future was so good!" Jean smiled, patting her jumbo gut as she spoke.

Rachel didn't say anything for a moment. Then, *Rumble* *Gurgle* *Rumble* Her stomach gurgled hungrily.

"You hungry?" Jean asked. Rachel blushed and nodded with a smile. "Yeah kinda." She admitted. Jean smiled and set to work using the apps Kitty helped download onto her phone when they waited for their feast.

Soon, hamburgers, tacos, pizza, Chinese food, pie, cake and other foods were in the room. "Wow. You really got a lot for us didn't you?" Rachel smiled as she picked up a jumbo cheeseburger and started eating. "Guess I did go overboard." Jean agreed with a blush as she slurped up a giant helping of noodles from a Chinese container.

For the next few hours, the two Greys kept stuffing their faces, Rachel gradually growing rounder and rounder as her skinny belly bulged out as it filled with fattening, greasy and sugary foods. More containers, tins, cartons and pizza boxes began littering Jean's room as the duo pigged out, enjoying their unofficial mother-daughter bonding time.

Soon, "Oooh boy. I think I may've overdone it." Rachel moaned with a large burp as she massaged her large bloated gut of a belly. "You overdid it? I think I put on at least sixty pounds since Kitty and I pigged out earlier!" Jean groaned as she rubbed her boulder sized tummy while it sloshed and gurgled loudly.

"Still, it was kinda nice to let go and eat like that." Rachel admitted as she kept playing with her tummy.

"Yeah. It really was." Jean agreed with a giggle as she poked her belly.

The rest of the night was spent with the two telepaths burping, farting and talking before finally falling asleep on Jean's bed together, Jean putting an arm over Rachel as they snored softly, occasionally farting in their sleep.

115322231112.content:
*BBBBBUUURRRRRAAAPPPP!!!!* Kitty and Jean burped loudly as they finished their phoenix sized meal an hour later. "Ooooohh god..." They groaned together as they flopped onto Jean's bed, wincing as their swollen tummies sloshed and gurgled due to the impact.

Jean had originally protested against the meal but had ultimately given in, having Kitty order 10 large ham, cheese, pepperoni and sausage pizzas, 12 extra large family meals from KFC, 15 orders of Chinese food, 6 orders of hot wings and 14 meatball subs from Subway, resulting in a massive 57 course meal. Jean was surprised that Kitty had managed to keep up with her during it, due to Kitty being rather skinny and healthy while Jean was lazy and more used to big meals.

Now, Jean looked like she was way overdue to give birth while Kitty merely looked like she's swallowed a very big watermelon. Both of them had food stains on their clothes and faces and were both stuffed to the gills, though still somewhat peck-ish.

"Oh man. I haven't eaten like that in my life..." Kitty moaned, rubbing her big sloshy belly as it gurgled and rumbled. Then, her cheeks puffed up ominously. "Uh, Kitty? Are you ok-" Jean began with concern when Kitty opened her mouth and....

*BBBBBBBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!! !!!!* Out flew an enormous belch that shook the bed and table beside it, nearly breaking the windows as well.

Jean tried to be disgusted, but ultimately she just burst out laughing alongside Kitty, their massive tummies sloshing and burbling as they did. "That was awesome. I haven't burped like that since I was 14 and took part in a burping contest with Illyana and Rachel!" Kitty giggled.

"Could you teach me to do that?" Jean asked with a grin as she rubbed her even bigger tummy. "Sure thing, Jennie!" Kitty chirped as her own gut rumbled and burbled hopefully.

Then, the two bloated girls started the belching lesson, with Kitty having Jean guzzle down every leftover soda from their binge she could find and helping by rubbing and pressing on Jean's large gut, Jean's burps getting bigger and louder with each time.

Finally, the duo decided to pack it in for the night and fell asleep on Jean's bed, their massive tummies gurgling, burbling and rumbling as they digested the massive, phoenix-sized meal overnight.

1153222312.content:
Jean Grey was almost at the end of her rope.

No matter what she did, no matter what she tried, she couldn't shake her new eating habits. Any attempts at dieting stopped before they even started. Mainly due to the fact that she was used to eating so much now. Her stomach would let out a small roar if she didn't fill it, much to her embarrassment. She'd turned more than a couple heads that way, much to her chargin. There was always some kind of morsel floating around, ready to be eaten, tempting her. Based on that, Jean had taken actually exercising regularly; jogging, stretching, and all manner of general fitness routines to get herself back into shape. Surprisingly, she had stuck to it, despite all odds. If for no other reason than that Jean refused to become so useless pile of lard that could only do things with her mind and who'd end up red faced and wheezing if she had to climb more than a flight of stairs.

But that just made itworse.

Due to the exercise, her body demanded more. More to keep her moving, more to keep her going. This was on top of the amounts that it had already become accustomed to. As her need for sustenance increased, more and more weight piled onto her. Her gut had only become bigger, a globe of flesh that protruded outward like a great mound before her. Her modest bust had increased as well, though not to any ridiculous degree. Her arms and legs were not spared either, becoming laden with adipose. Her rear had expanded greatly, her enlarged buns big enough to crush any poor small animal should they find themselves underneath her. When she walked it was like her cheeks and hips were fighting to rise higher than the other than the other. Even her face had plumped, though she remained easily identifiable.

The only upside to this seeming vicious cycle was that the constant exercise had prevent Jean from turning into a flabby mess. Yes, she was big. Yes, she was fat. But she was...compact? Sturdy? More akin to a sumo wrestler than anything else.

Jean frowned. Once upon a time, she'd had never made that comparison and the fact that she was thinking that was a plus, of all things, just reinforced how different she was.

'There's got to be something going on. I don't think like this! I would never think like this.' she thought, almost desperately. 'This cannot be natural. I have weigh over two hundred pounds and I shouldn't be able to gain that much so fast!'

115322231232.content:
Power. Self control. Balance. Empty your mind, Rachel. No thoughts. Just....geez, how did Jean get so f-- Before even finishing her thought, Rachel crashed down onto the wooden floor. Objects around her either broke or shattered as she lost her focus.

Crap.Laying on the floor with an arrangement of broken objects wasn't going to be a good look for the redhead, thus her floating to her toes, and stepping over the shards of whatever broke. Might've been a cup?

Focus, Rachel, don't wanna be the reason there's no mugs here. She frowned to herself, walking towards the door until her stomach made a lion cub type roar. Unlike someone else's stomach. That got a snicker out of her, using her mind to swing the door open and she made her way through.

She's huge! You see how she looks like in her uniform? Oh man! Think she ate my lunch... Lke, I'd totally not, um, want to look like her. Just wish her chest got big--

Alright, that's enough wierdos. Rachel had to remember, this was still a school, still teenagers, even if they were a bunch of Mutants. But she couldn't help herself peer into the minds of others..just to hear what they were saying, to know! Hell, that was basically her own mother. This was giving her a headache.

The fridge opened up, and with a grin, ham, cheese, mayonnaise, all the good stuff floated up into the air, the food formed itself into a wonderfully crafted sandwich, which for one, Rachel just had to watch and think. And not think of the out of breath redhead that approached her with a puffy, red as her hair face.

"Ra-wheeze-chel!" Jean cracked open a smile, from her red face. The poor redhead huffed and puffed her way to the counter, opening her hand to let a water bottle fly into it.

Jean's all too short attempts at working out continued, and they seemed to just get shorter. Her 200 pound framed was packed into a top with a large "X" printed across her still intact breast, with her bulbous gut poking out and forming a bit of a muffin top, especially with her butt and thighs, forced into a too tight shorts. Definitely this out fit hugged her curves, but she did not want that.

"Workout?" Rachel assumed, scanning the stature of her peer..ish. She almost felt pity for the girl.

Jean responded with a quick nod, dipping her head back and chugging the drink like there was no tommorow, but there was. And a small burp was it's signal. "Y-yeah.. took a lot of breath out of me, but we're getting there! Can already...feel the abs coming back.." Her hand pressed into her gut, and sunk into it.

Rachel blinked, bit into the sandwich, and blinked again. This girl ain't gonna lose a pound.. especially if she keeps eyeing my sandwich. God, maybe I should... Maybe she should.. "Hey, Jean?" Jean perked up.

"I'll spot you, get some weights... y'know? Work out together..bonding? Yeah, I think that's bonding."

Jean looked at Rachel, almost staring at her like she just spoke in some foreign language, that probably wasn't that hard to learn but-- She hesitated, looking down at the growling gut she owned. And opened her mouth to......
115322231232.title: Greys help out..bigger Greys

choices: Rachel had enough, what's wrong with Jean?
1153222312321.content:
Jeanie...Jeanie!...Jean.. it's breakfast!

The intense aura of breakfast foods were the only reason Jean forced her eyes open, but god, if felt like a task just to do so. Dazed, Jean blinked a few times before making sure she was truly awake, her eyes shifted from side to side, she saw her room, her bedroom, intact and everything, but to the side of her...Emma Frost, Rachel...and Kitty?! What the heck, were they doing in her roo...and why was there..mm! Her thoughts were ignored, as the blonde beauty had shoved an entire folded pancake into Jean's mouth, the pancake was abnormally large, with syrup drizzled onto the middle. Wh-whats happening?! Jean, forced her eyes down..and mentally screamed when she saw her obese body, cramped into her usual outfit, now altered by tears with pudge seeping through them, and multiple stains from her binges. Her chins dug into each other, seeing her gut fill onto her lap, and her breast resting comfortably on the giant ball of fat. Oh..no, oh no, oh... Her thoughts were stopped again, when Rachel and Kitty fed her more of these fatty foods, more and more, these greased filled snacks were added onto her body by the second, and it stopped when all three ladies looked directly at Jean..and started...BEEP! BEEP BEEP!

Jean bolted awake, breathing heavily, the girl looked down at the watch that was strapped tightly onto her soft arm. She huffed, placing a hand on her exposed pudgy stomach, exposed by her current outfit for her workout with Rachel. An X branded sports bra was clad onto her chest, leaving her stomach to poke out like a pimple. Not to mention her shorts, which bubble butt and all, were packed tight in, she could've sworn she was losing circulation in her bottom half. She sighed, resting her head back onto the couch, hoping this scheduled nap time was worth the wait, until her eyes were met with an unimpressed Rachel staring down at her.....

"I made a schedule for this, y'know?! Had to reschedule some of my classes. But it's for...a good cause?" Rachel spun around to see, a waddling red in the face redhead, thighs rubbing against each other, each step making her feel worse than the last. "This might just be the longest workout, of my entire damned life."

-------------------------


"One!...Two!....Three!..Four!..Fi... Five...five?"

Jean struggled to rise from the floor, rising with the strength of a sloth, her elbow inched, and inched.. and... Down the redhead went, and sweat drenched fat slapped against the already stained mat. Placed in the custom programmed Danger Room session, which as it seemed. Worked...just a bit? Rachel deadpanned, getting up and leaving the bloated telepath on her mat. The room around them, dissolving into a clean, sleek grey room. "Lunch...?" Jean panted out, rolling onto her flabby stomach, and getting back to her feet, with a little bit of help of course.

-----------------------------


It was unimaginable, that this sweet, powerful girl was devouring a handful of fries in seconds. Right next to me, I was a stick. A stick compared to Jean's growing body, her thigh practically touched over my excuse of one. And as I took my first bite, she already was on her last. It wasn't the most ideal meal for a post workout, but those puppy eyes she would do on you, couldn't resist, but the size of these hamburgers. Almost one Beast hand large, and this was just the medium sized one. Hell, the fries? Almost like sausage links, and this girl was absolutely devouring them. As Jean states, it's to refill her "energy".

Push-ups, sit ups, jumping jacks, all of those passed by during the week. Every other day, it seemed to get harder for Jean, as her gut, and all of her jiggled and wobbled about. Pull ups became hell, her soft arms, lost of any form of biceps or muscles, didn't move an inch, Rachel having to lower the bar, and it still didn't make a difference. Push ups were equally as bad, her arms barely able to lift her frame, and not to mention, her gut, inches from touching the floor, when she did manage to do the task. And running? Absolutely horrid, and the impact it left on her, leaving her exhausted, sweaty, and most of all, her stomach roaring out for any type of substance. Meaning as the days went on, Rachel noticed her post meals got even worsening.

And it'll only get worse by then, when Rachel Grey looked into the mirror, to find a bloated gut. And Jean Grey was lazily shoving slices into her maw.

Urgh, gruh! Hhhhh, and other sounds a redhead whopping at 200 pounds made as she struggled to zip up her own jacket over her soft paunch.

Packed thighs wobbled slightly from the movement, as well as, her least favorite feature, a bubble butt that's been growing every so slightly. Each cheek was at least growing into the size of basketballs, wobbling at any given movement. Her paunch, just ready to rip and tear, any piece of clothing she owned. She did not have the time to relax like this, but relaxing also meant working, for her anyways. Rachel shrugged, and enjoyed the blastic music by the world's favorite mutant, until the sound of doors sliding ruined her moment and caused her to sit right up.

“Look who finally came.” She sneered at...

choices: Jean is given a taste of what Spineless Ones consider "entertainment"
There's a welcome banquet of... questionably edible food waiting for her!
So I'm not really a fan of this story. Another please!
1153223.content:
It should really go without saying that the Mojoverse is a really shitty place.

The people who live there, the Spineless Ones--accurately named, by the way-- spent their first couple centuries of existence crawling around on their bellies before someone finally had the brilliant idea to invent some legs for them. So instead of crawling, now they all get around by relying on these awful metal spider-limbed harnesses that carry them pubah-style. And as if that wasn't bad enough, everyone in this sad little shithole of a dimension is constantly bombarded with time-displaced media waves that drive them steadily insane. It wasn't until they learned how to decipher these radio waves that they really came into their niche though. The waves were from our media. So once television was a thing, the Spineless Ones only got steadily worse.

They're not so terrifying to look at, really. Aside from being a jaundiced yellow, they almost look kind of human. If you can ignore the spider-harness-things that make up where their legs should be. They're all fat, sluggish people who are both enamored and enraged by Earth culture.

So basically, they're day-time TV junkies.

And the leader of them all, the ruler of the Mojoverse, is Mojo.

(Shocker, right?)

Mojo's probably the most terrifying out of all of them. Most of them, the Spineless Ones, look more or less human. But Mojo... doesn't. He's incredibly obese, most of his body is comprised of a big naked yellow stomach, sagging man breasts, and jowls. But somehow he keeps his arms all stringy and spindly, which makes him all the more awkward to look at. Mojo's skin color looks somehow more sickeningly yellow than the rest of his people, and he is visibly the most unstable out of everyone else in his dimension.

And of course, he was the Villain of the Day.

Just another day in the life of being a time-displaced X-Man, right?

It had more or less been your average day, as far as being a mutant went. Wake up, School breakfast, wipe up after that guy with the congealed exoskeleton, ignore Bobby, go to class with Professor Kitty, ignore Bobby, notice some unidentified flying objects Roswell-style hovering over a recently discovered mutant, and head out to save said mutant while ignoring Bobby. What was so strange about that?

"Move it, brat."

One of the few "normal" people in this awful place was some woman with white hair, clouded eyes, and six arms--two natural, four mechanical. She didn't seem to share the same kinship at being the two most humanoid beings on this terrible rock. Six-Armed-Chick held Jean's hands behind her back with one pair of appendages, held the power-dampening collar around her neck with another, and let the other two hang sharply at her side.

Jean Grey had spent the grand total of a year in the "future." In that time she'd spontaneously developed psychic powers due to the stress of time-travel, learned that in this future she's dead twice over and became a planet-killing monster embued with the power of the Phoenix Force, learned that her boyfriend grows up to become a mutant revolutionary, broke up with said boyfriend only to have him go off and become a space pirate, attacked by a version of the aptly named Brotherhood of Evil Mutants that included herself from the future (not the one that's dead, but a version of her that never went back in time to... whatever, her), traveled to an alternate universe, been captured for the crimes of her future self (the, uh... the one that died) on top of nearly getting herself killed multiple times.

And now she was getting manhandled by a dominatrix with six arms in front of the poster-child of television addiction.

Super.

"Is that... is that really her?" the great mooshy monster whispered excitedly, "the fabled Teenaged Jean Grey plucked from time and space?"

"The one and only." Jean whimpered

"Marvelous!" Mojo roared boistrously, "Oh what a treat! This girl, this ugly little thing has just been the talk of the town! People love you, people hate you, people can't decide if they want to hug you or rip your arms off!"

"...Thanks?" Jean ducked her head, trying to avoid Mojo's putrid breath, "Hey, I'm not--"

"Oh but you ARE, my dear!" Mojo stretched out an arm, his long fingernails scraping against Jean's chin, "You're the biggest ratings grab this dimension has ever seen! You're almost as big as that scrappy little guy with the claws around here--what you and your boyfriend did to J'Son? BRILLIANT!"

"I'm not just some ratings... and Scott and I are not--!"

"Oh I know, the relationship drama, the romance!" Mojo's mechanical spider-legs clacked against the metal tile of his chambers, "He loves you, you love him, that hairy fellow loves you, even the Angel loves you!"

Jean clenched slightly as Mojo let out a disturbing cackle that sent ripples through his belly.

"Yes, everybody loves Jean Grey. You." Mojo purred sickeningly, click-clacking close enough to caress Jean's jaw, "And that's just what I'm counting on for my latest project--Little Girl Lost... on Mojoworld!"

Jean didn't have to be able to read minds (she kinda couldn't right now) to be able to tell that the woman who was holding her at attention was just about as excited about Mojo's latest "project" as she was.

"Picture it, dear: a girl, a mutant, you are stranded on an unfamiliar but beautiful planet that's strikingly different than the one you call home. You'll explore the culture, walk around town with those ghastly legs of yours, and try to find a way back home. But in the meantime there'll be plenty of time for your traditional fish-out-of-water excursions, hilarious misunderstandings, and maybe a romance or two to help spice things up a bit--you know, get the ladies a little riled up. And then--"

"This is insane!" Jean interrupted his rant with a sharp cry, "I'm not some... toy! You can't just do this to people! Abduct them and... and take away their powers and make them perform for you!"

"Oh but I can, you ugly little ratings eater." Mojo's smile widened evilly, "Not only are you in the wrong time... you're in the wrong space. Who on this planet, on my planet, is going to care? As long as that collar is on you, you'll do whatever I want. And maybe, just maybe, I'll ship you home once the ratings drop."

Jean bit her bottom lip, holding back tears.

"Or kill you. However sweeps season works out."
1153223.title: Little Mutant Girl Lost

choices: After a little Mojovision, Jean is shown to her room-she refuses to perfom!
This is too much! She freaks out and is given a sedative with nasty side effects
Spiral has other plans for Jean Grey...
11532231.content:
All Jean could focus on was how quiet it was.

Ever since she'd gotten here--to the future, not Mojoworld--everyone had been telling her what a great psychic she was. Some kind of prodigy. Professor Cyclops, Professor Kitty, Ms. Frost and her stupid little cuckoo not-daughters, everyone couldn't shut up about how great she was supposed to be. What's worse, she could hear them talk about how great she's supposed to be. Constantly. All the time, their thoughts just poured into her head like water into a pitcher. Professor Kitty had been doing her best to teach her how to work her psychic powers to stop things like that, and for the most part it had been steadily improving. But even when she wasn't trying to, Jean could still hear the thoughts of other people. She didn't like it (usually), and neither did anyone else (usually).

But she would have given anything to be able to hear the thoughts again.

The room was painfully still, the only sounds to be heard were the click-clacking of the six-armed woman's heels as she guided Jean to a large uncomfortable-looking chair that stood under the otherwise pitch-black room's sole light. She sat Jean down and held her with two sets of arms while the latter two fastened her in. The restraints were uncomfortably tight as they cut into her wrists. Once her hands were secured, the woman went to work on her feet.

Then came the helmet.

It was a weird thing. Not really a "helmet" per se, but some kind of headband-wire contraption. Jean's captor strapped it around her long red locks, pulling it until it squeezed her head obstructively, and then started fiddling with the wires. She placed one above each eyelid and stretched another around for the lower lids, the reeled them back in until Jean couldn't blink. Her green eyes, dialated by fear, shot across the room. Back and forth, unable to discern anything that could have potentially helped her out.

"What are you going to do to me?!" Jean yelped as the strain on her lids caused her eyes to water, "Wh-What is this?!"

"Too tight?" the woman asked nonchalantly, her voice a sultry purr, "Can't have that. You'll miss the show if your precious little eyelids rip."

The strain on her eyes did lighten slightly as her captor loosened the wires.

"Th-Thank you..." did she just thank the woman who attacked her team? The one who'd slapped this awful collar on her and held her captive for... God, how long had she been here? "What's going on?! What the hell even is this place?!"

"This is Mojoworld. That was Mojo. I'm Spiral. And you're the biggest thing to hit Mojoworld since Deadpool." the woman stated matter-of-factly, "You'll probably get the gist of this, but I work for Mojo. And now, so do you. You're going to star in a new lighter-and-softer TV show that'll air after some documentary about a bunch of kids killing each other to keep things balanced out."

"Wh-What...?" Jean stared stupidly in front of her, the power-dampening collar restricting her neck movements

"You haven't heard of it? Strange. It was filmed on your Earth. It had that girl. The Angel's new girlfriend--Little Wolverine." Spiral said idly as she fiddled with some remote, "X-23, that's it."

"You... you watch that kind of stuff?"

Jean wasn't there in Murderworld (a little before her time) but she had some vague idea of what went down inside it. Laura--X-23--had some nasty memories of what happened there. Ones that stood out against her already particularly nasty memories. People... teenagers, some no older than herself, died in horrible, awful ways. What kind of time--what kind of world was she on where people watched that kind of thing for fun?

"Well, not yet. I have it set to record." Spiral shrugged as the lights dimmed, "Normally I try not to watch too much Mojovision. Rots the brain. But I make an occasional exception for programs that... interest me."

Before Jean's unblinking eyes, a television screen appeared as if from nowhere. Back where she came from, in her time, an eighteen inch was considered big. This was a theatre-grade monstrosity, bigger than Jean could have really fathomed. And it suddenly just came to life with a big flash of white light. She couldn't look away--everywhere her eyes could go, some portion of the screen remained visible. She was going to be forced to watch... something. Something awful, judging by the look on Spiral's face before she turned around.

"Welcome to Mojoworld, Precious." Spiral snorted, "This is what those fat slobs call entertainment. Better buckle up."
11532231.title: Cruel and Unusual Entertainment

choices: God these Spineless Ones have a sick sense of humore... Mojovision is awful!
It's... not so bad, actually. Jean might have actually laughed a few times...
Jean doesn't really pay attention. But she gets some company...
115322311.content:
How could people do... that to mutants?

That couldn't be the future--the timeline she found herself in. It had to be something different. Something terrible and awful, but something different surely. Giant robots taller than skyscrapers, stomping out cities wreathed in fire and bathed in blood. Mutant blood. The blood of her people splattered across their giant purple feet like they were nothing but bugs to be stepped on. And humans too--kidnapping, torturing, raping, and killing mutants just for the sake of being born differently. Born with an X-Gene. Hours of footage, all rolled into one and set to a laugh track.

This wasn't right.

It couldn't be right.

And Spiral laughing the entire time like some kind of inhuman monster at all the worst possible parts. How could anyone take so much pleasure in the suffering of so many people? How could anyone, mutant or not, laugh while people are burned alive by fire? Or melted by a giant robot's laser vision? How was this even a thing? Screw the giant robots, had people become so calloused that they just... didn't care?

Jean stared into the floating blue eye of the video camera that had been following her around ever since she'd been shoved into her room. It was just... there. Getting different shots of her, probably waiting for her to do something interesting. But she wasn't, and probably wouldn't be doing anything interesting for some time.

Mojo had given her a pretty nice room. Nothing like the prison cell she was expecting. A lot better than the actual prison cell she had back at the New Xavier School, and somehow even moreso than her room back at the Jean Grey School. It was supposed to be "modern", but the word had kind of lost meaning to the time-displaced teenager. Big bed, big TV, big silver fridge and those hanging square lights over the window, nice view of the city skyline. It was sleek and fancy like all the magazines in this time seemed to like. Actually, knowing how much these freaks liked Earth Culture, Mojo probably based it around the same magazine.

She was just laying there, on her bed, in her uniform. The white and green onesie that Professor Magick had conjured up for her a while back, and sadly enough the last little bit of "home" she had left. And not even her real home. Some twisted alternate future timeline where she was dead. Her bright red hair was spread out on the bed, flared as she lay motionless. Her hands folded across her stomach, trying to ignore the thick gurgling groans of hunger that rumbled deep within.

How could they expect her to just... snap back from all of that?

The little silver ball floating over her head watched her expectantly, capturing even the littlest twitch in its quest for daytime TV gold. The blue lense adjusted visibly, its pupil dialated slightly before contracting in the light. Probably another close-up shot.

"Jean?" the ball suddenly projected a familiar voice, "Jean, can you hear me?"

"No." her face curled into one of disgust, "Now shut up."

"Jean, you're not... doing anything." Mojo said from the other end of the line, his voice distorted by the speaker, "Do something interesting."

"You're a freak." Jean snarled, "How could you show me all of that?"

"We'll do a lot worse than show you some reruns if you don't get moving!" Mojo hollered from behind his little camera, "We've got a show to shoot, and you're our lead star!"

"Reruns?!" Jean shot up on her bed, "You showed me genocide! You showed me my people being massacred!"

"Your people from a few expendeable alternate realities and simulations, rest assured!" Mojo laugh-lied his way through his placating attitude, "We had to show you what you're up against. You need to be cute (as cute as you can be with that ugly human... thing you've got going on, anyway) and quirky and hilarious if you want to keep their interest. People are tired of the whole brutal killing and raping and pillaging, at least the 14-18 female crowd is. They want something... new. Something unique!"

"You're showing a Battle Royale ripoff with my friend in it." Jean said flatly, "I've read her mind. There was nothing cute or quirky in that Arena."

"It's a demographic thing!" Mojo corrected her gently before his tone took a sharp turn, "Now. Get. Up. Jean. You have a pilot to shoot and we need something good."

"Even if I wanted to entertain you and your gross yellow blob-on-spider people, which I seriously don't want to do, you took away the one thing that was interesting about me." she pointed to her collar, "My powers. You kind of neutered me. But if you want to stick around until my team gets back--which, newsflash, will be any second now--you and your freaks will get to see a whole lot of X-Gene getting thrown around."

"Ugh! Why are you making this so difficult for me? For us? All we want to do is make you a star, Jeannie." Mojo cried through the speaker, "Your powers aren't your only defining feature, you know! You're fiery. You're smart. You charm the pants off of all the little twerps in your group--do that! Make some of that happen!"

"With who?" Jean stood, putting her hands on her hips defiantly, "You? Through a talking eyeball camera? Yeah, that'll be good for ratings."

"D'oooh... you're a snarky little human, aren't you?" Mojo's voice sounded angry, but the unphased and unblinking eyeball camera held no such emotion, "Fine. We'll... work something out. Just... watch some Mojovision and we'll work something out. In the meantime, just be as interesting as possible. But not too interesting-- we need to save something for the holiday break."

"Yeah, I'll try to do that." Jean rolled her eyes as she collapsed back on the bed, her arms spread-eagled as she lay, staring up at the cieling.

"Go watch the Mojovision." Mojo commanded again from the camera as it followed her, "It's good for you."

"Bite me." Jean spat at the lens.

"Go. Watch. The. Mojovision." the speaker sadid slowly and throutgh (what she assumed were) gritted teeth

"Make me."

A sharp jolt of electricity caught Jean off-guard, causing her to flounder and roll off of the bed, where she seized for a bit more before it stopped. She looked around wildly, unable to discern the source of her sudden shock.

"We have our ways." Mojo said proudly, "Your collar doesn't just nullify your psychic powers--it is also equipped with a remote electrical charge. It's light. But it's also adjustable. Just in case you try anything unsavory like, say, trying to remove your collar, I have a handy dandy cattle prod to help coerce you back into my control."

"You're sick."

"And you're missing Maury."
115322311.title: Pouting in the Penthouse

choices: It's Spiral, all six arms full of corporate-sponsored food, for advertising.
It's some Spineless One who looks like Jay Sherman. Her director?
1153223113.content:
So Mojovision was really just Earth television.

Which is weird.

Jean still hadn't gotten over how much TV had changed since "her" time, but here it was literally just the bad stuff. All the time. Like, the worst of the worst. Jerry Springer and Maury Pauvich and Steve Wilkos. Fashion Police. Court shows confusingly enough. It was just... daytime television. On every channel. And when it wasn't that, it was recordings of superhero fights. Spider-Man versus some creepy vampire guy, the "replacement" Fantastic Four versus the Mole Man, something about Captain America on a distant planet? Some other alternate future? None of this made sense.

The windows in her room were unbreakable. And even if they weren't, she was up really high. If she had her powers, she could float herself down nice and easy. But as she stood now, all she'd manage to accomplish is making herself a redheaded road pizza.

This world... Mojoworld, whatever... it just wasn't right. There were giant floating televisions showcasing the violent acts from her world. Skyscrapers pierced the horizon, and the sky was a sick purple even this late at night. Below her, even this high up from her penthouse, Jean could see the people of this world--the Spineless Ones--skittering around on those awful metal harnesses. Jean had seen a lot of shit in the past few months. Even before coming to the future, she'd seen a bit of the ugliness humanity had to offer towards the mutants. But this... this was scary.

Since coming to the future, there wasn't much time to think about the Professor they'd left back in their time. They had really just gotten to know each other before Old Hank took them away to help with Old Scott's "mutant genocide", but it was times like these that she really wished he were here right now to keep her calm.

But the insane laughter from the television was hardly going to do much of that.

Jean reached for the remote, and posed herself to turn it off.

Suddenly, a flash of light from behind her as she heard the sound of footsteps encroaching. She whipped around, dropping the remote, to see a conspicuous spiral smack-dab in the middle of the penthouse. Instinctively, she posed her two fingers against her temple, preparing her psychic powers. But the uncomfortable weight of her collar reminded her that she was powerless--helpless against whomever might be coming. The footsteps continued as a distinctly humanoid shape became sillouhetted in the light...
1153223113.title: Casting Party

115332.content: The young Welsh mutant with the fairy wings? Or someone else?
115332.title: Pixie

choices: Pixie's not the only X-man making that promise...
1153321.content:
Pixie, or Megan Gwynn as the people of the small Welsh mining town where she grew up would have known her, woke up feeling hungry. This was hardly a surprise considering the packed schedule of mental and physical exertion that composed her days at the Jean Grey School, but this morning in particular seemed different. Most mornings she could get by on a bowl of cereal and maybe one or two pieces of fresh fruit, but the rumble in her stomach was calling for the full treatment of waffles, bacon and eggs, all coated in lashings of maple syrup.

This seemed a little odd to her, and it certainly drew the attention of her friends as they sat around the cafeteria table.

"Geez Megan, that's enough food for three people." Cessily said as she put down her tray. There might have been a hint of jealously in her voice, as her unique physiology of living mercury meant she was unable to eat food like a normal person.

"It certainly is more than you would normally have." Soorya agreed from behind her veil, though with slightly more tact.

Nori, who's electricity based powers had earned her the codename Surge, only shrugged. "If you're hungry, you're hungry." She may have had more sympathy due to the fact that her elevated metabolism meant she tended to eat bigger meals than the other girls. However even she was finished for a good ten minutes before Pixie finally put down her fork.

By that time she was feeling uncomfortably full, her stomach bulging out visibly beneath the mandatory blouse and blazer which were a constant source of irritation to the more long-standing junior members of the X-Men.

"I'm just saying, Wolverine's put in charge and no one bats an eye when his first decision is to dress us all up like some schoolgirl fantasy?" Mercury said, treading a well worn argument. Both Surge and Dust agreed, even though the latter had been exempted from exchanging her burka for the much despised uniform.

Pixie was glad the conversation had been directed away from her unusual gluttony, and concentrated on walking without jostling her swollen stomach, deciding against flying to class as she usually did.

The first lesson was thankfully a less intensive one, Mutant Culture with Ms. Guthrie, who usually just talked through whatever lecture she had prepared while the class ignored her. Pixie used this time to rest her head on her desk and run her bloated belly, promising herself that she would never eat that much again.
