115332211.content:
The year is 2049, and the future is ruled by Sentinels, giant machines who were created thirty years before to control and potentially eliminate the mutant race. At first, the Sentinels did exactly that, and managed to bring down many mutants, which brought them into fights with both the Brotherhood and the X-Men. Things were controlled, but not for long.

In the year 2033 the Sentinels realized the mutant race evolved from regular humans, so to truly eliminate the mutant race, the humans must also be controlled. So the Sentinels launched a massive attack across the planet, eliminating most life on Earth, including superhuman teams such as the Avengers, Fantastic Four, and most of the X-Men.

The Sentinels did not kill everybody though, and a small group of resistance fighters survived, though scarred, beaten, and starved of food. The resistance included May Parker, the daughter of Spider-Man and Mary Jane Watson; Morgan Stark, the daughter of Iron Man; an aging Wanda Maximoff, better known as the Scarlet Witch; James Hudson, the son of Wolverine; the head of Deadpool; and a middle aged Kitty Pryde, now called Kate.

Kate did not look good, at fifty three years old and after fighting a decade long war, nobody could come out looking good. She looked very frail, having not eaten anything substantial in years. She had trouble phasing she was so weak.

The future was dire, but the resistance had one final plan. After a raid on a Sentinel facility, the group came into possession of power enhancers, and planned to use them on Wanda to Kate back in time to prevent the future.

“Ms. Pryde, remember your mission. 2019 was the year the Sentinels gained sentience. Wanda will send your consciousness into your pasts selfs body. As soon as you get to the past, you need to warn the X-Men and tell them to destroy the Trask facility.” May said as Wanda was injected with the power enhancers.

“Right, I’m not going to mess this up, we’ve waited over ten years for this.” Kate said as she laid down on the table in front of Wanda. Wanda blasted her, as her mind we’re blasted thirty years in the past. Kate woke up in her twenty three year old, slightly thick but still thin body. But she was still absolutely starving. She was in the Danger Room, and noticed a machine that she remembered. Beast created it a mutant who constantly lost weight, and it kept him stocked up on a paste-like food. Kate’s stomach growled, and she looked at the machine.

“Just a little bit of food couldn’t hurt.” Kate said as she walked to the machine...
115332211.title: Days of Fatter Past

choices: Kate Tells The X-Men About the Sentinels
1153322111.content:
A face mask was attached to the machine, and Kate slid it on, as a tube slid down out of the mask and into her throat. Kate flicked the switch to turn the machine on and the thick paste started going down her throat. She was astounded by the taste, having only eaten scraps for over a decade, this tasted like real food.

The paste was continuously pumping food down her throat with no signs of stopping, not that Kate was complaining. She was loving the food, so much in fact that the straining of her tight X-Men uniform didn’t even bother her. She didn’t notice how tight it was getting as a coat of fat was beginning to form, and even if she did, she probably wouldn’t even care. Her guy was beginning to push forward, and every inch of muscle in her body was quickly being replaced by fat.

Kate has no concept for how long she was hooked up to that machine, but she was so focused on how good the food tasted and how good it felt to eat a lot of food again, that she didn’t even hear Beast and Cyclops shutting the machine off.

“Kitty! What the hell were you doing? What the hell did you do?” Kate snapped back to reality when Cyclops yelled that, as she looked at him and Beast.

“It was just a little bit of food, what’s the big deal?” Kate said, but as she said that she noticed a thick layer of something beneath her chin. She then went to stand up, but she couldn’t. She felt slower, and much heavier than before. It all made sense when Kate looked down at herself.

Kate was now immense, weighing in at an astonishing five hundred and twenty pounds. She resembled a large beanbag chair, with her gut being pushed out multiple feet from where it once was. Her breasts were also much bigger than before, as was her butt which now sagged off the sides of the chair she was sitting in. Her arms and legs were extremely bloated, with her thigh gap being forever closed. Her cheeks were extremely full, and her neck was replaced by multiple chins.

“Oh my God! I didn’t know I was getting this fat. Why would you make that paste so fattening?” Kate yelled, thinking of the ramifications this had for her future body.

“The machine was designed for a mutant whose body weight kept dissipating. He had to get extremely fattening food to keep him alive until Forge built a cure. What made you so hungry anyway?” Beast asked as Kate remembered her mission. She had to warn the X-Men of the Sentinels. But she also wanted more of that paste...
1153322111.title: Making Up For Lost Meals

choices: Kitty is disgusted  with her new body
11533221112.content:
The rest of the story went about as expected. Kate informed the X-Men of the dire situation that awaits them in the future, and after a mind read from Jean Grey, they confirmed that Kate was telling the truth. So the X-Men took a trip to the major Sentinel facilities and shut them down, while saving the future in the process. On the Blackbird on the way back to the mansion, Kate felt herself starting to slip away, as her future no longer came to pass.

“My time here is over. Thank you guys, you prevented a tragedy the world could never recover from. And, when my past self wakes up, tell her I’m sorry for the additional weight.” Kate said as she slipped into unconsciousness. The X-Men surrounded her, as one of the fat girls eyes began to open.

“Oh man. Where am I? And why do I feel so slow?” The now much returned Kitty Pryde said. The X-Men were trying to handle the situation as delicately as possible.

“Kitty, this might come as a bit of a shock to you...” Cyclops began to say, before he was rudely interrupted by Iceman.

“Your future self took over your body and got you massively fat.” Bobby said calmly, before being elbowed by the super strong Rogue.

Kitty looked down at herself and opened her mouth in shock. She was huge, and it wasn’t even her own fault.

“Oh my God!” Kitty said.
11533221112.title: Kate Tells The X-Men About the Sentinels

115332211121.content:
"I love this!" Kitty smiled as she poked her large belly, her finger sinking into her soft, squishy belly.

"Are you sure, Kitten?" Storm asked in surprise and concern. She knew Kitty liked being nice and thin, especially since she does dance lessons. The fact that Kitty seemed willing to become fat was rather surprising.

"Yeah! I mean, sure maybe I should loose a little of my blubber, but otherwise it's awesome!" Kitty giggled as she rubbed her jumbo tummy in delight.

"But what about your dance lessons, sugah?" Rogue asked. "I'll still take 'em. I'll just explain everything to Stevie when I go in tomorrow." Kitty smiled as she slapped her belly, watching it jiggle like Jell-O. Stevie Hunter was a former dancer turned dance teacher. She was aware of the X-Men and Kitty's membership with them so she would likely understand Kitty's current situation after being told about it.

The other X-Men didn't say anything at first, but ultimately smiled at their youngest teammate's delight at her new size.

"If it makes you happy, Kitty, then I don't see the harm in it." Jean smiled. "I don't either." agreed Storm as she hugged the obese 13 and a half year old. "I guess I could get used to seeing you the size of a hippo." Iceman smirked teasingly, only for Kitty to stick her tongue out at him and smile.

"Hey, Cyclops?" Kitty asked after a moment as they continued home. "Yes, Kitty?" Scott smiled. "D'you think we could swing by a McDonald's and get, oh maybe, six Big Mac meals?" She asked. "Um... I guess." Cyclops replied after a moment.

"Cool! Um... also, I could go for at least three extra big buckets of KFC chicken and maybe seven chocolate frosties from Wendy's." Kitty added as she began drooling at the thought of all that food.

"Something tells me we're gonna have a hard time gettin' Kitty to work out and shed some of her new blubber." Rogue whispered to Storm after hearing Kitty's request for on the way home.

"I believe you are right, Rogue. But I am sure Kitty will retain her self control." Ororo smiled assuredly as they watched Kitty happily stroking her new belly as they headed home, laughing and joking with Iceman as they did.

Ororo had no idea how true her and Rogue's conversation would prove to be as they headed for home.
115332211121.title: Kitty loves being this size

choices: It’s Peter (or Piotr) Rasputin, A.K.A. Colossus!
115332211122.content:
“I’m fucking huge!” Kitty screamed at the top of her lungs, still trying to stand but constantly failing. The last thing she remembered before she blacked out she was in the Danger Room getting some training in before her date later that night. And now when she awoke she was now on the Blackbird in a five hundred twenty pound body stuffed in an X-Men uniform the Blob would feel snug in.

Right off the bat, Kitty was feeling the impact of her increased mass. The new gravity weighing down on her was immense, as her new flab was sagging off of her in all directions. Kitty noticed her breathing was different, heavier and slower breaths for her newer, bigger body. Her uniform was extremely tight, and any slight movement caused a straining sound that was a clear indication that her costume was gonna break.

“Kitten, just try to relax.” Storm said, reaching her arms out to comfort her teammate.

“Yeah kid just take it easy.” Wolverine said, hoping to calm down his student. Kitty backed away from the rest of her team, heading toward the back of the jet. Kitty had tears rolling down her fattened cheeks as she began to rant.

“No! I’m not gonna calm down! My life is ruined! I’m a god damn whale now! And you said my future self did this?! The whole “future self in my body“ thing already happened to me when I was thirteen, like ten years ago. Now it happens again and I wind up like this! I have a date tonight with Peter! I can’t let him see me like this, he’ll freak out! Do you know how long it’s gonna take to work this weight off!” Kitty screamed at her friends, tears rolling down her face.

“Well technically the paste was designed to be lasting, as the mutant we designed it for’s metabolism broke it down so quickly. An average metabolism would probably take decades to work off that much weight.” Beast chimed in, as Rogue gave him an elbow as well.

More tears began to rapidly fall down the obese woman’s face as she opened the door to the Blackbirds bathroom, as she waddled inside. Unfortunately, her new hips got stuck on the door, so Kitty used her powers to phase herself through.

The rest of the ride was very quiet for the X-Men, as Kitty didn’t leave the bathroom the entire ride back to the mansion. When the X-Men arrived back to the mansion, Storm knocked on the door to the bathroom on the jet, and found it to be unlocked. Storm opened the door and no one was in there.

Kitty has phased through the floor once the X-Men arrived back to the mansion, and slowly waddled to her room. She found it to be a struggle, reaching the elevator alone felt like running a marathon. By the time she reached the elevator, her face was bright red, with heavy sweat running down her face, and her breaths felt as though she was having an asthma attack. She made it to the second floor and waddled to her room.

Kitty phased through the door, as she waddled over to her bed and crashed on it, giant gut first. Once the massively overweight girl landed so suddenly on the bed, it crashed under her immense weight, only adding to her depression. Between the sweat and her tears, her entire pillow was drenched. The tears stopped, however when she heard her phone buzz. Kitty raised her massive body up and checked her phone to see the text message she had just received. It read “I’m here” and it was from Peter, Kitty’s date for the night! Kitty ran over and looked out her window, and saw her supposed date for the evening.
115332211122.title: Kitty’s Post-Fat Freak Out

1153322111222.content:
Peter Parker stood outside Xavier’s School For Gifted Youngsters, checking his phone to see if his date for the evening had responded to his message. Kitty Pryde and Peter Parker met during one of the times the X-Men had to work with Peter’s superhero alter ego, the Amazing Spider-Man.

When Peter and Kitty met both were in relationships, Peter with Mary Jane Watson and Kitty with fellow X-Man Piotr Rasputin, but both were going through there different relationship issues. Mary Jane broke up with Peter because she felt that Peter didn’t let her take care of herself while reporting. Kitty and Piotr however had been having issues ever since Colossus came back from an intergalactic war were Piotr developed feelings for an alien healer. So Peter called Kitty and asked her out, which Kitty accepted. But that was before Kitty’s sudden change.

Kitty looked down from her window, and almost had a panic attack. She was really hoping this date was gonna go well, but now that she was a five hundred and twenty pound blob, all hope of that was practically gone. Kitty was panicking, as she had literally no idea what she was going to do. She didn’t want to turn Peter down or lie to him, but she also didn’t want him to see her like this. Kitty collapsed on her already destroyed bed, as she heard a knock on her bedroom door, as Storm opened it.

“Kitten, the rest of the team are in debriefing with the Professor, but I felt it was best to come check up on you.” Storm walked over to Kitty, sitting down next to her.

“My date is here Ororo. And I’m disgustingly obese and I don’t know what to do.” Kitty said, as Ororo hugged her.

“Kitten, you are not disgusting. You are a bright, gorgeous young woman no matter how much you may weigh. If this boy can’t see that, he’s obviously not worthy of you.” Storm said, making Kitty feel a lot better. Kitty shifted her immense body up forward, as she wrapped her massive arms around her close friend for a hug.

“Thank you Ororo, you really did make me feel better. But I’m really not in a date mood. I kind of just want to shower, get into some clothes that fit, and go to sleep.” Kitty said, as Ororo chuckled.

“I completely understand Kitten. I will send Logan to deal with Mr. Parker, while I’ll send Kurt to get you some knew clothes. You just get in the shower.” Ororo said as she got up and left the room.

Kitty slowly rose from her bed and went into the bathroom, phasing out of her skintight uniform as opposed to trying to peel it off. Kitty looked into her full body mirror for the first time, seeing her new body in the nude for the first time. It honestly looked very similar to her body wearing her costume, as it was skin tight anyways. She saw the clear stretch marks on her skin, as well as the dimples all over her humongous butt.

Kitty grabbed a beach towel and wrapped it around her body, even though her massive stomach covered her private parts anyway. As she waddled along, she saw her new clothes. Kitty had a couple new outfits, but she chose to wear massive yoga pants, and a bright pink t-shirt, along with a massive adjustable bra and huge parties. Kitty slowly put on her clothes, covering her giant stomach with her new pants. Kitty looked out the window and saw Peter had left. Kitty chuckled, causing a jiggle in her face fat. Logan must have taken care of him. Kitty climbed into her bed, and covered herself with her bed sheets.

“Maybe tomorrow will be better.” Kitty said hopefully, but unfortunately she completely forgot about her prior commitments.
1153322111222.title: Spider-Man and his Amazingly Fat Friend

choices: It was the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants
It was the Mutant Response Division
11533221112221.content:
Kitty awoke from her slumber, as she was truly hoping the terrible experience from the night before was just a dream. Kitty had been dreaming of gluttony and food all night, and the scary part was that she found herself enjoying those dreams. Unfortunately, the reality of Kitty’s situation was firmly established as she felt the gravity weighing down on her as soon as she opened her eyes. Just to be sure, Kitty lifted her covers up, and she was met with a massive pair of breasts and her gigantic, round stomach.

“Yep, definitely still fat.” Kitty said to herself, as she got out of bed and began waddling downstairs. Today was Sunday, and for Kitty Pryde that meant training in the Danger Room with her mentor, Wolverine. Kitty had no idea what to expect, but she was sure it was not going to be fun. Kitty got to her locker in the X-Men’s subbasement, where she was met with a brand new, much bigger uniform. The Professor must have had Forge, the resident team mechanic, make one for her. She put it on, and while it was still skin tight and hugged her roles, it was a lot more flexible and didn’t feel as though it was going to tear apart. So it was already a big improvement over the last one.

Kitty entered the Danger Room, where Wolverine stood, dressed in his orange and brown uniform. Scattered around him were many robots, all slashed to bits with distinct claw markings through them.

“Sorry I’m late Logan.” Kitty said, as Wolverine sheathed his claws and turned around to face his super sized student.

“Look kid, I have no idea how to teach you to fight given your current, predicament. There is a way, and I will figure it out. But for right now, I can’t train you. I’m sorry.” Wolverine said, very heartfelt. He truly did care about his student, and it broke his heart that he didn’t know how to teacher her anymore. Kitty tried to hide her clear sadness.

“It’s okay Logan. I know you’ll figure it out. This change just requires some adjustment is all.” Kitty replied, as Logan nodded in agreement. Wolverine called off the training session, as Kitty changed back into her civilian clothes and went back upstairs, clearly upset. She waddled to the kitchen and grabbed a large tub of ice cream from the freezer, and she began shoving bites into her mouth.

As Kitty sat alone in the kitchen, her teammates Rogue walked into the kitchen, dressed in her gothic civilian clothes. She saw Kitty clearly upset, and wanted to make her feel better, as Rogue considered Kitty her best friend on the team.

“So Kitty, ah was wondering if you wanted to go to the mall with me. I would really like the company.” Rogue asked Kitty, reaching out to her friend. Kitty took note of that and appreciated it, as Rogue didn’t like hanging out with anyone, so it showed she did care about Kitty after all. Kitty wasn’t completely comfortable going out in public yet, but maybe actually going out would be good for her.

“Yeah I would love to. Logan called off training and Kurt only got me a couple outfits anyways so I should probably go.” Kitty and Rogue both got ready and headed to the Westchester Mall. They took the X-Van, with one woman much more squished in there than the other one. Once the two reached the mall, they began shopping immediately, with Kitty buying a few new outfits and Rogue buying new makeup for herself. The two were gossiping about their teammates and having a really good time. Sure the obese woman and her goth friend got stares but neither really cared. Kitty was having fun, and her mind was off her weight for the first time since she gained it; despite the slow pace, heavy breathing, her thighs brushing against each other and her stomach smacking her legs with each massive step.

The two stopped at a food court, where Kitty ordered five hotdogs while Rogue stuck to one. The two girls sat in a booth seat, so Kitty’s immense body could fit and she didn’t have to worry about breaking a chair.

“Thank you for taking me out Rogue. I really did need this.” Kitty said, with hotdog bits flying out of her mouth. Rogue took a second to respond however, as she was astonished with how much food Kitty was consuming. Before the gain, it was a struggle to get Kitty to eat one hotdog, let alone five.

“No problem sugah. After all, what are friends for?” Rogue replied, as the two women continued talking, until the heard a loud explosion at the front of the mall. The two women looked to see who their attacker was...
11533221112221.title: Super Sized Training Session

115332211122211.content:
Avalanche, Pyro, Blob, and Toad all stood in the destroyed entrance of the Westchester Mall. Seeing the homo sapiens running in fear brought smiles to all of their faces. Magneto would have been very proud of them, if he wasn’t ruling over Genosha of course. Still if anything, they could cause a little havoc and get a good laugh out of it. Of course, they weren’t the only mutants in the mall, as Rogue and Kitty Pryde were monitoring the situation from the second floor food court.

“Stay calm, we’ll see what they do next and plan our next move after that.” Rogue told Kitty, as she swallowed her last bite of hotdog, sweat beating down her head and on to her jowls. Avalanche and Pyro created a large rock structure in the middle of the mall with a huge wall blocking them off, as Toad was on look out and Blob moved to the second floor.

“I’m gonna take care of Toad, while you handle Blob. Then we’ll knock down that fortress and teach those two idiots a lesson.” Kitty said, still as heroic as ever despite her massive size.

“Sounds good, just be careful.” Rogue replied, worried about how her big friend would handle herself in a combat situation.

Kitty crouched and waddled as quietly as she could over toward where Toad was. Kitty kept going until she was directly above where Toad was, the only thing separating them was the floor. Kitty looked down at her fattened body and got an idea that made her smile. She phased through the floor and let herself fall. All Toad saw was a massive butt coming directly at him, and before he could leap away, he was completely crushed underneath the massive weight. Toad was incapacitated, as Kitty now had the struggle of getting up.

Meanwhile up on the second floor, Blob approached the food court, where Rogue was still sitting. While most people ran away, Rogue sat completely still, un phased by the five hundred and ten pound giant approaching her. Blob broke through the counter just by walking through it, not even stopping. Rogue knew she had to get through Avalanche’s barrier eventually, and she had to take down Blob. Maybe she could still two birds with one stone. Rogue got up and silently sneaked yo behind Blob. She than removed her glove and leaped on him, absorbing his powers and knocking him out. Rogue immediately felt a change coming...

Kitty had finally managed to get up off of the unconscious Toad, and slowly made her way over to the fortress. Kitty was sweating bad, and she didn’t know how much longer she could keep going. But, she knew the Brotherhood had to be stopped. So Kitty waddle-ran up to the fortress, and phased through the massive wall. When she arrived on the other side, she was met by Avalanche and Pyro on the top of their massive structure. Pyro was the first to see the huge hero.

“Oí Avalanche! Check it out. The X-Chumps got themselves a Blob now too!” Pyro said, as he and Avalanche both began laughing. Kitty felt terrible, between the negative comments and the general feeling of being out of shape, Kitty really doubted if she could take these two.

“Not just one Blob, sugah! Now you got two to deal with!” A voice rang throughout the mall, as a giant hole was knocked into the stone wall. What Kitty saw next was unbelievable. Rogue was the cause of the hole, and she now weighed as much as Blob. After touching him, Rogue absorbed his powers, and by extension his massive weight. Rogue was huge; with ginormous breasts bigger than her head, a giant stomach with multiple folds and rolls under her breasts, giant sagging thighs that hung off her legs, a huge plumped face, and a gigantic butt. She had obliterated her clothes, with her old shirt riding up on her breasts and her leggings had massive holes in them.

Kitty was shocked, but she would have to worry about that later, as Rogue and her had bad guys to deal with now. Pyro armed his flamethrowers and Avalanche jumped down to face the two morbidly obese women.

“Rogue, throw me up there!” Kitty said as Rogue picked up Kitty effortlessly thanks to her new strength, and threw her friend toward Pyro. Kitty flew through the air like a big soft wrecking ball. Pyro tried blasting her with his flamethrowers, but Kitty phased through them, until the five hundred twenty pound mutant collided with him, knocking him unconscious. Rogue approached Avalanche knocking through any structure he made, until she got close enough and punched him clean in the face, knocking him out. Kitty phased back down through the structure arriving next to Rogue and the two obese women caught their breath.

“That was exhausting, the other X-Men should be here soon though.” Kitty said, face bright read, her hands on her massive, soft knees.

“Yeah your tellin’ me. You want to grab something to eat while we wait?” Rogue replied, her new stomach feeling very empty. Kitty nodded as the two mutants went back upstairs to the food court. When the X-Men arrived, Rogue and Kitty had almost finished an entire stores food stock. Both had crumbs and food bits all over them, but they were both very happy. The two women went on the Blackbird, as the MRD came and took the Brotherhood to prison.

When the X-Men arrived back to the mansion, Kitty was summoned to Cerebro, where someone wanted to talk to her.
115332211122211.title: Massive Mutant Mall Fight!

1153322111222111.content:
The Blackbird landed in the hanger below the mansion, after picking up the two women from the mall. Beast (who was piloting the jet) stayed behind to unload the X-Van, as the ramp lowered from the jet. The two obese mutants waddled down the ramp, causing a loud creaking on the poor ramp. Kitty was holding multiple corn dogs in her hands, shoving them into her mouth one by one. Rogue had a whole bucket of fried chicken, and she was continuously eating chicken pieces the whole ride home.

“Thank you Rogue. I had a really great time.” Kitty said, mustard dripping down her lips. Rogue looked over while chewing on a drumstick.

“It’s really no problem. I never knew being big and pigging out could be this much fun. Unfortunately, this isn’t gonna last that much longer for me, so I’m heading up to my room to enjoy the last few minutes of gluttony.” Rogue said, waving Kitty goodbye as she headed up to her room. Kitty continued eating her corn dogs until she was suddenly interrupted.

“Katherine, I would like to speak with you in Cerebro please.” Kitty recognized that voice from anywhere, that voice belonging to the the leader and founder of the X-Men, Charles Xavier. Kitty waddled down through the subbasement, still shoving in corn dogs, until she reached Cerebro. Cerebro is what the X-Men use to track and find mutants all across the world, and Professor Xavier was in the middle of it.

“You wanted to see me Professor?” Kitty said, holding the sticks to her corn dogs in her plump hands. The Professor removed his helmet, and placed it on the platform in front of him. He then turned his wheelchair around and looked at his obese student.

“I just wanted to congratulate you on your victory at the mall. Taking down the Brotherhood was no small feat, and I was very impressed by your resourcefulness given your current state.” Professor X congratulated his student, much to Kitty’s shock. It really had just set in that her and Rogue took down the entire Brotherhood by themselves. She would have never been able to do that before, maybe the extra bulk helped her a little.

“Thanks Professor, but Rogue helped a lot.” Kitty said, not believing she deserved all the credit for the victory.

“Yes but you lead her Kitty. In most cases being your size would cripple anyone else but you fought through it and beat the Brotherhood. It seems as though Rogue even took a page from your textbook during the fight and the two of you did amazingly. Keep up the good work.” Charles said, as he excused Kitty from their meeting and went back to Cerebro.

Kitty left the chamber with a large grin spread across her round face, as she took the elevator back up to the first floor of the mansion. Kitty waddled to the kitchen, grabbed a soda and brought it into the empty living room, where she sunk into the couch and turned on the television. As Kitty began chugging the drink, Rogue also entered the living room, however she looked a lot different than she last did. Blob’s powers had worn off, so Rogue lost all of her additional weight. She was back to her one hundred twenty pound self. She had changed out of her destroyed clothes and took a seat on the chair next to Kitty’s seat, as her girth engulfed the entire surface of the couch.

“Ah had such a good time at the mall.” Rogue said as Kitty stopped chugging and nodded in agreement. Rogue was eyeing Kitty up and down, she seemed enamored with Kitty’s expanded body.

“Being that big was so liberating, and ah really miss it already.” Rogue continued now shifting her focus to her own thin body.

“I just wanted to say thank you again. Between the mall and you being so cool, I feel a lot more comfortable in all this fat.” Kitty replied, thankful she had such a good friend. The two girls watched television for a little while longer, until later that night.
1153322111222111.title: Chat with the Professor

choices: Rogue is in love with Kitty’s new body
11533221112221112.content:
The elevator reached the bottom floor of the subbasement, and Kitty Pryde exited into the tunnels. She moved her massive body forward, gut smacking against her legs and her massive hips swayed from side to side in an almost hypnotic fashion. She waddled along, her mind set on her goal, and at that size, nothing could even hope to stop her. Kitty was ready to complete her goal, her stomach was full and her mind was in the right place. The main point was that Kitty Pryde was determined, and she was gonna get what she wanted.

Kitty reached the girls locker room, and phased out of her civilian clothes. The massive five hundred and twenty pound girl was now only wearing her giant bra and panties, as she opened her locker and took out her new and improved uniform. She put it on and fitted it the outfit looked just like her old uniform, with the yellow stripe going down her now extremely ginormous stomach and the uniform hugging her roles beautifully. Even her gloves and boots were bigger, to accommodate for her sausage like fingers and cankles. Kitty exited the locker room with a confident grin spread over her face.

Kitty waddled to the Danger Room, and the door opened and she was met with a familiar site. Wolverine standing in the middle of the Room, robots shredded all around him. Kitty slowly made her way to Logan, and the two mutants met eye-to-eye.

“I heard about your big showdown with the Brotherhood. From what I heard you did a good job. Maybe you don’t need any guidance.” Logan said nonchalantly, as Kitty almost geeked out. Wolverine just gave her a compliment. But she kept her cool and presented her idea to Logan.

“I think I need to completely change my combat style. I can’t be stealthy anymore so I think brute force could serve me very well. My ninja-style of fighting is also a little outdated given my new body, so I was thinking more sumo wrestling.” Kitty said to Logan. She had put a lot of thought into her new weight and how she would operate differently in combat. Wolverine chuckled.

“It sounds like you got it all figured out kid. A warrior who knows there faults and can adapt to situations is a great warrior in my opinion. You’ve done well Kitty, but I don’t think there’s anything else I need to teach you.” Logan said, as he bowed to his student. Kitty bowed back, with her stomach getting in the way but the point still remained. Her training was complete, and all it took was ten years and four hundred pounds. Kitty exited the Danger Room with a serious face, but as soon as the doors closed a huge smile appeared.

“Yes!” Kitty exclaimed, pumping her fist in the air, arm fat jiggling to and fro. If she wasn’t so heavy Kitty would have jumped, but she settled for the fist pump. Of course Wolverine heard her, but that just brought a grin to the mutants face as more robots appeared and he unsheathed his claws. Kitty waddled away from the Danger Room, clearly happy, as she embraced what this new weight had done for her life. She got changed in the locker room and went up to the elevator.

Kitty rode elevator all the way to the second floor and waddled to her room. The first thing Kitty noticed was all her clothes were there, and she had a new re-enforced bed, most likely thanks to Forge. She took her regular clothes off and got into the shower. She embraced her fatness, she unlike last night she wasn’t grossed out by it. Kitty left the shower and climbed into her new super-sized pajamas, as she peeled back the covers and climbed into her new bed. Kitty went from a state of almost depression to a state of pure happiness in less than twenty four hours. She wondered what tomorrow would bring as she shut her eyes.

“Kitty! Kitty wake up!” The obese woman opened her eyes and was met with a familiar face. Rogue was next to her, on her knees and looking at Kitty. She looked off, like she hadn’t slept. Kitty also got a view of the alarm clock, noting that it was two o’clock in the morning.

Rogue confessed as she slowly picked at Kitty's blankets. Kitty was quiet for a moment as she processed her friend's confession. "Okay. So why did you wake me up?" she finally asked.

"Cause I figured you might be able to help me get that large again." Rogue explained shyly. Kitty thought it over for a few minutes. Rogue was a good friend and teammate of hers. True, Kitty had been uneasy with Rogue joining the X-Men ten years ago when she left the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants after accidently putting Ms. Marvel in a coma during a fight, giving Rogue Carol's flight, super strength and other powers in the process, but now they were close friends.

"Okay. I'll help you Rogue." Kitty smiled at her friend and teammate. Rogue smiled in delight. "Thanks Kit. Um... do you mind if I sleep with you for tonight?" She replied, blushing slightly. Kitty seemed equally shy upon receiving the request. "Sure." She finally decided.

Rogue slowly climbed in beside Kitty and snuggled beside her obese teammate and friend. Kitty laid down and sighed in contentment.

"Good night, Kitty." Rogue smiled as she closed her eyes and drifted off to sleep, putting an arm over Kitty's wide belly. Kitty blushed at this and smiled at her softly snoring friend. "Night Rogue." she whispered as her eyelids drooped shut and she began softly snoring alongside Rogue.

Ah know ah can gain the weight naturally but that would take years to get as big as ah was.” Rogue said depressed. She was destined to want a body she could never have. Kitty was lost in thought, she wanted to help her friend as she did for her. Kitty suddenly had an idea.

“Of course. After all, what are friends for?” Kitty replied, as the two mutants continued to hug. The X-Men went down to the subbasement and got dressed in there uniforms, and then piled into the X-Van and drove toward the MRD. They parked the van a few blocks away, and slowly made there way toward the facility so Kitty didn’t lose her breath. A guard stood outside the massive prison, and Rogue removed her glove and leapt on him, grabbing his face. This both knocked him out and gave Rogue his memories. Including telling her where Blob was.

“He isn’t that deep into the facility. Most inmates are sleeping right now. If we do a straight shot through the walls right there we’ll come up to him.” Rogue said, pointing at a wall to the right. The two women approached the spot Rogue marked, and Kitty extended her flabby arm out to her. She grabbed Rogue’s shoulder, and the two girls began stealthily walking or waddling through the cells. Kitty had to slow down her breathing, as any heavy breath could wake up the inmates. Eventually after a numerous amount of cells, they found Blob sleeping on his giant bed.

“You ready?” Kitty asked Rogue, but she already knew the answer. Rogue removed her glove and slowly approached Blob, and she grabbed his face. Blob’s eyes shot open, but quickly closed again, as he was knocked unconscious. Rogue held onto Blob for a solid couple minutes, and then let go. Blob was still alive somehow, and Rogue was lucky she didn’t accidentally kill him. But the deal has been done, and Rogue knew it. As she began swelling up again, she knew this time was permanent. Rogue got much heavier than last time, now weighing in at six hundred and thirty pounds. It seems she had Blob’s weight on top of her own. Her breasts were massive, twice the size of her head. Her massive gut swayed and rippled with each slight movement she made. Her ginormous legs were twice the size of her entire previous body, and were pushed away from each other by the mass amount of fat. Every inch of her was covered in soft fat again. Her back rolls were immense, and led down to her bean bag sized butt. Rogue no longer had a neck, instead replaced by a giant double chin, and a big smile pronounced her chipmunk cheeks and jowls.

“It feels good to be be back sugah! Thank you Kitty! I couldn’t have done it without you.” Rogue hugged Kitty, there flab colliding with each other, and Kitty found it weird to finally be hugging someone bigger than her. The two girls embrace was cut short by a loud alarm though...

Wanda Maximoff, the Scarlet Witch.
The Avengers very own European beauty with the magical bite.

1. Wanda’s checkered past has taken its toll on the chaotic witch, leading her to find ways to bury her emotions any way she can. Turns out American food possesses a magic all of its own.

122.title: Scarlet Witch''(Wanda Maximoff)

choices: Wanda continues to isolate herself with more bodily impacts
Vision buys Wanda's confidence with more food
Duty calls, but not all is easy for Wanda
1221.content:
Wanda Maximoff was a troubled soul.
Sure, her abilities and courage had saved the world countless times (she had also rewritten reality once but that's not important) and had earned her the respect of her team mates through heroism.
Sadly though, deeds alone did not ease the witch's mind.

Wanda was no Steve Rogers, built on courage and morality with an unyielding belief in justice.
She wasn't a Peter Parker, a teenager innocent to the intricacies and cruelties of the world.
She wasn't even a Tony Stark, full of ego and able to hide her true feelings behind one liners and financial flash.
Despite all these characters close to her, Wanda was built on her grief and the harsh realities that had surrounded her younger years and nothing could change that.

Or so the chaos witch thought...

**********

*knock knock knock*

"Not now" muttered Wanda, her Serbian accent still as present as ever despite living state side for some time now.

Apparently, words were not sufficient for her impromptu visitor though.

"Sorry Wanda, I just haven't seen you for days and I was..." started Vision as he drifted through the door to Wanda's room, only to stop mid sentence as her caught a glimpse of his friend and ally.

"I'm fine, just leave me in peace" asserted Wanda again, blissfully unaware of Vision stopping or staring for that matter.
The fact of the matter was, Wanda had nested herself in her room for quite some time and had managed to shut the outside world out completely.
Her time in solitude had also blinkered her to how she was handling her grief these days.

For some reason or another that the witch could not quite recall, she had been turned onto what her friends frequently referred to as 'comfort food' and, with said food not tasting terrible, Wanda had taken quite a fancy to it.
It also had the added bonus of cheering her up slightly when she was feeling particularly reflective or down.
Flash forward to the present and the results of Wanda's piqued interest in food had developed into the scene playing out before Vision.

Perched on her bed, Wanda was nestled in between the array of plush pillows at the headboard where her back was rested, legs sprawled down the bed whilst a wide assortment of food and drink items lazily danced through the air, circling the upper most portion of the bed as they did with a faint cloud of red holding each item in the air.

Vision's keen synthezoid eyes glimpsed Wanda's fingers moving ever so slowly against the fluffy duvet she was currently laid on top of, a clear sign that she was using her powers to cause the food to float as it did.

Right before his eyes, a subtle flick of an index finger pulled a burger from the food formation, drawing it slowly towards Wanda's mouth which she deftly opened in a well practiced rhythm to recieve the bread encased meat before casually flicking it away again.
The whole process was so refined that Wanda hadn't needed to move any more than the single finger controlling the burger which, upon returning the burger to its rightful place, had fallen back into line with the rest of her delicate hand movements.

"I'm just worried for you Wanda, nobody has seen you for days" finished Vision, his concern clear in his voice.

"I'm fine Vision, I did not want bothering."
As she spoke, Wanda shot a brief look towards the synthezoid in her doorway as a quick flash of red coloured her eyes to indicate her annoyance, which also caused the food items to spin slightly faster for a few seconds.

The glance was brief, but enough to tip Vision off that Wanda's reliance on food had started to have an effect on more than just her mental state.
The slight turn of her body had made it clear that the Serbian's middle had started to soften just enough to be picked up by the synthezoid, mostly due to the subtle roll forming around her waist caused by the awkward twist she put herself through so as to glare at Vision.
Maintaining his composure, Vision continued to air his concern.

"We are all your friends here and we only want the best for you" insisted Vision, daring to step closer to the woman on the bed

"I am fine" returned the witch as she pulled a large soda cup towards her, actually grabbing the cup mid air as it came towards her this time before posting the straw through her lips.

Halting his movement, Vision simply looked over his friend as she drank deeply from the cup before sending it back into the rotation around her.

"Don't forget we are here for you Wanda" finished Vision before turning to leave the room again, realising her was onto a losing battle.

As the door was about to close, the synthezoid felt a great deal of resistance stopping him from closing it fully and he turned to look back into the room.
Wanda was looking at him now, the barely noticeable increase in concentration proving that she had stopped the door closing, as a single tear ran down her cheek.

"Thank you" was all her silky Serbian voice uttered across the room but it was enough.

Vision simply nodded before turning away again and closing the door with ease, not wishing to pressure the witch any more than he already had.
As he rested against the door, making sure it had clicked behind him, a familiar face walked past.

"How is she Vision?" called the confident yet concerned voice of Steve Rogers as he passed the now closed room of Wanda Maximoff.

"Fine Captain" lied Vision, avoiding eye contact "Just fine"

Captain America simply nodded before grasping Vision's shoulder gently

"We're all a family here, she knows that deep down"

The words rang through Vision's synthetic ears long after Cap had walked off but he knew what he had to do.

'We're all family, and family look out for one another'

12211.content:
"Hey, has anyone seen Wanda recently?" asked Janet aka The Wasp to a semi crowded room

Amongst the continued buzz of general chit chat there was a pretty unanimous response of 'no' that caused Janet to bite her lip out of concern.
She knew how volatile Wanda could be, particularly when her emotions got ahold of her, but going completely silent on everybody was out of character even for the witch.

"She'll be fine, shes been in worse binds than giving us all the silent treatment" announced Jessica Jones, the rough mouthed PI nursing a baby close to Janet.

"I dunno, this is different..." muttered Janet as her mind began to wander.

"Well we know shes got herself on lockdown in her room, right?" declared Jessica Drew aka Spider-Woman, striding towards Janet as she stuck her hair into a lengthy pony tail, preparing to hit the gym.

"So?" retorted Janet, confused as to where her colleague was going.

"Well go get that pretty little suit of yours and fly under the door to see what she's up to" finished Drew with an inherent 'you idiot' laced into the sentiment.

Janet looked shocked, the thought of betraying the trust of one of her fellow superheroes like that seemed barbaric.
Reading the face, Drew intersected again.

"Well if you won't do it get that Lang fella to do it instead"

"Scott wouldn't do that..." started Janet before been cut off again.

"He's a criminal and he's making us bug themed heroes look bad" finished Spider-Woman with an accusing stare at a copy of the Daily Bugle on the table.

As Drew walked off, Janet sighed rather disheartened by the whole situation.
Weren't they meant to stick together as superheroes?
That's what Cap always said anyway.

"Janet, a word?"

Janet nearly screamed as Vision came into her line of sight.

"What have we said about things like that?" she stared the synthezoid down accusingly before he continued.

"I apologise" said Vision with a slight bow of his head "I just overheard your concern about Miss Maximoff and I think we can get to the bottom of this together"

"You two haven't been up to..." started Janet before realising her mistake "Sorry, hard to let go of things in this game, you know?"

Vision nodded knowingly.
"I think that may be part of Wanda's problem"

*****

Vision led Janet to a more secluded part of the compound, not wanting to irk the others who were obviously less sympathetic to Wanda's cause.

"So what do you know Vision?" asked Janet, sitting on the edge of her seat.

"Well, I haven't spoken to Miss Maximoff for a few weeks now but..."

"She hasn't even spoken to you? Wow..." breathed Janet, suddenly feeling her concerns spike.

"No, and even then she was not happy" finished Vision.

"What do you suggest that we do then?"

"I'm not entirely sure" admitted Vision, his own concerns feeling ever more prominent "I do know that when I saw her she seems to have taken quite a likening to 'fast food'"

"That's...strange" mused Janet, furrowing her brow in contemplation.

"I thought so too" replied Vision.

Janet stood up and began pacing in front of Vision.
She wished she was wearing her suit at this point, shrinking and growing was far more relaxing than pacing.
As the two heroes pondered the situation with Janet still pacing, a sudden thought struck the stood woman.

"Hang on, so Wanda has been unhappy and ordering food in a lot?"

"Quite, it was very out of character" responded Vision, elbows on knees with his fingers pressed together in thought.

"For her maybe, but it is very typi...shit! what was that?" exclaimed Janet as she suddenly found herself on the ground with a scalding sting radiating around her right cheek.

"If I may be so blunt it appears that you have been hit with a...cheeseburger Miss" answered Vision, literally as ever.

"A cheesebur...what?" asked the confused Janet as she clambered back to her feet.
Hoping to find a more logical answer, Janet wiped her cheek to find a great smear of blood running down her face.

"Ketchup" nodded Vision to the substance Janet had thought was her own blood now coating her fingers.

"Why on earth would there be..."
Janet felt her words stop as a strange sensation ran through her hair, a feeling of being dragged but the rest of her wasn't moving.

"That would be the rest of the burger" answered Vision again as strings of cheese and meat dragged themselves out of Janet's hair surrounded by an all too familiar red mist.

"Follow that burger Vision, we've got to talk to her"

*****

"I knew it" declared Janet triumphantly as the mangled food remnants made the last turn into the corridor leading to Wanda's room.
As successful as the trail had been though, the situation took a dramatic turn as in a motion almost unnoticeable, Wanda's door flew open and snapped back shut to allow the burger into the dark room behind and nothing else.

Vision and Janet came to a grinding halt before the door, a faint smell of grease permeating from behind into the corridor.

"Wanda, we have got to talk" called out Janet with a gentle knock on the door.

Silence.

"Please Wanda, we only want to help you" pleaded Vision, hoping for some success where had found it a few weeks before.

Silence.

"For the love of god Wanda, open this door!" screamed Janet, not wanting to miss out so close to her goal now.

Still silence.

"You hit me in the head with a cheeseburger Wanda, the least you can do is open this damn door!"
Janet could feel the situation getting away from her as the silence continued to grow around her and Vision.

"Right, screw this!" shouted the Pym particle powered woman "open this damn door RIGHT NOW Maximoff or I'm shrinking myself through the keyhole!"
Janet hated how motherly she sounded at that point.
She also hated that she was screaming at an obviously hurting woman through her bedroom door.
Having burger grease matted into her hair didn't mark high on her list of happy moments though so something had to be done about this situation.

With a heavy sigh, Janet turned her back on the door.
"Come on Vision, she doesn't want our help"
Not wanting to give up on his friend, Vision lingered a moment longer but, eventually, he too turned away.
Naturally, that was when the door clicked open.

*****

"Good grief Wanda, what is going on that has got you holed up in her for weeks on end?" asked Janet, all anger melting away instantly and being replaced by the concern she had originally harboured.
Her concern was kicked up a notch as she laid eyes on the woman who had caused her so much grief that day.

Laid on her bed just like how Vision had found her last time he had been granted entry was Wanda but, unlike that time, there was a little bit more of Wanda than either of them expected.

"Go on, what do you want?" hissed Wanda, her accent adding a layer of aggression more than was maybe intended.

"We're worried about you Wanda" started Janet, not wanting to cross any boundaries too early.

"I'm fine, ask Vision" retorted Wanda between mouthfuls of food that came to meet her crimson lips.

"My sensors indicate that Miss Maximoff has gained approximately 83.6 pounds since her last physical examination putting her at nearly 205 pounds total body mass" Vision plainly delivered.

"That doesn't sound fine Wanda, you need help" pleaded Janet.

"Pfft, I am happy when I'm eating" announced Wanda and, as if to make a point, summoned a pan of cheesecake from above her head before enchanting a fork to feed her.

"But you're gaining weight at an alarming rate" said Vision.

"So? My magic can take the brunt of it" declared the witch, refusing to back down.

"OK, fair enough" nodded Janet, realising that was a fight that could not be won "we are finding you someone to talk to though, because you can not be alone any more"

"I don't want anyone" forced Wanda, a flare of red shrouding her slightly as she spoke.

"Well tough, you're getting them" defied Janet before turning on her heels and storming out, leaving Vision with Wanda.

"It will help you in the long run Wanda" added Vision, hoping his word may add weight to the argument.

Wanda simply ignored him, returning her full attention to the cheesecake disappearing between her lips.

"She will not be changed on this one Wanda, she wants the best for you" finished Vision before gliding from the room, closing the door behind him.

*****

It didn't take long for Vision to catch up his accomplice for the day who was busy looking exasperated whilst leaning against a wall.

"What's the plan then Janet?"

"I've got a few people in mind" she responded quite coldly, more from personal pain than anything.
It was difficult to see a friend look like that but not all was lost.
They had a plan after all.
12211.title: Well Fed Witch of the Red

choices: Janet and Wanda get lunch—like, a lot of lunch.
There's a supervillain attack on the way—great, Wanda could use the exercise!
122113.content:
And while Janet did have a few people in mind, she was a little sore to discover that not one of them would be able to help her out.

Carol was off-world, that much she should have suspected, but Janet had started to wonder if that was just an excuse to dip out on social obligations (it’s a hell of an alibi). Jennifer apparently had cases stacked as high as she stood tall, and Janet wasn’t about to challenge her on that. Both Jessicas, of the spider-y and investigative varieties, had obligations with their kids. Nat wasn’t exactly the “talk it out” kind of person—and no one was really gunning to compare trauma conga lines with that one. Was Jean Grey alive again? She might have worked? No, the X-guys had enough of their own problems to work through.

But she couldn’t just pair Wanda off with someone younger than her—someone who hadn’t been in this game for as long as everyone else had—in hopes that their idealism would rub off on her. The younger generation had it rough in their own ways, but Wanda had literally been in a group called the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants. Superheroics had come a long way and it had left a lot of scars on a lot of Avengers over the years in ways that girls like Ms. Marvel or Clint’s protégé couldn’t even begin to understand. Even still, there was no way that she could let any of the male Avengers sticking their spoons in this pot. Tony would slap a band-aid on it and wonder why she was still comfort food-ing on floating ice cream three days later.

The real issue with all of this was that everyone knew what Wanda was going through. They were Avengers, and that pretty much meant constantly mucking things up until they got it right. Wanda had gone through a lot—a lot—over the course of her career, and nobody knew what that kind of stress could do to a person better than someone who used to be married to Hank Pym.

So, without any further options… that left none other than the Wasp.

After all, they’d both been Avengers longer than almost everybody else—why should it have been anyone else but her?

***


“Go away.”

Janet found herself on the other side of Wanda’s door yet again. This time she was flying solo. She felt that it was better to approach Wanda one on one without the Vision. She didn’t want her friend to feel like they were ganging up on her, after all. Plus, with that messy history, Viz’s presence might have hindered her a lot more than helped.

“I didn’t even knock yet!” Janet whined, “Come on Wanda, let me in!”

“No.” she said flatly, through the wall.

Wasp rolled her eyes let out a groan quiet enough to not be heard through the tower walls. She definitely wasn’t making this easy—which sucked, because she seemed to be the only one willing to lift a hand here.

“O-kay, guess I’ll just be off then!” Janet said loudly, “Since you don’t want my help!”

She started stomping in place, gradually taking quieter and quieter steps without ever leaving her spot before stopping altogether. She waited a moment, held her ear to the door, and readied her hand at the doorknob.

“I know you’re still out there.”

“DAMMIT WANDA.” Janet broke her silence, “How did you know?!”

“I can still see your feet from the bottom of the door.”

Janet let out a groan, pressing her head against the wall to Wanda’s room. This was so frustrating! All she was trying to do was help her friend before things got out of hand. More out of hand than they already were, really. Wanda had already put on a lot of weight since she started eating her feelings away and being known as the “Fat Avenger” wouldn’t exactly do wonders for her self-esteem right about now.

“Okay, look, if you won’t let me in, I’m coming in.” Janet cracked her fingers, “I’ll shrink right down and slip under the door. Through the keyhole. The air-vents. I’ve got all day Witchy-poo!”

Then, on the other side of the door, silence. Janet held her breath as she waited to hear the tell-tale footsteps of her roommate coming towards the door. As soon as she heard feet hit the floor, Janet knew that she’d gotten her. Finally she was getting somewhere—all without invading her privacy via Pym Particles!

The door slid down, revealing her friend and longtime teammate had obviously not been expecting company.

She was just as big as she’d been two days ago the last time she’d seen her, with the added girth of what had been an especially big lunch. Food floated behind her, casting an eerie red glow as her powers kept her meals easy to access and afloat. She’d dressed herself in pajamas—a large I’M NOT DAREDEVIL t-shirt that distorted along the curve of her prominent belly and chest. Her gray sweatpants were filled tightly with her ample hips and thighs. Her long brown hair, usually elegant and pristinely kept, was left in a bedheady disarray.

“What do you want from me?” Wanda hissed, her round cheeks creasing at the frown, “For weeks now you have been pestering me—telling me not to eat what I want, not to use my powers, threatening to break into my room now.”

“I just—”

“Want to tell me how to live my life?” Wanda poked Janet in her bony chest, “Want to tell me to stop eating? Well I like to eat. It makes me feel good. I can control it.”

“Wanda, I just—”

“No!” Wanda said, throwing her thick arms around, “You pester me like the annoying little bug you’re named after. You don’t leave me alone!”

“Wanda—”

“I was just fine in my room until you and that stupid robot decided to—”

“WANDA.” Janet said sternly, putting a hand on her friend’s surprisingly meaty shoulder, “I didn’t come here for that.”

Wanda exhaled, her proud features hardening as she put her hands on her chunky hips.

“Well.” She mumbled, embarrassed, “What did you come here for?”

“I figured we could go get some lunch.” Janet said a little softly, but not placatingly, “So we could eat together. Like friends.”

She looked behind her fellow Avenger to see the food still floating in place around the room.

“With our hands.”

Wanda’s thin lips tightened. She took a deep breath that swelled her bigger bosom and slowly let it out as she visibly contemplated the pro’s and con’s of her friend’s suggestion.

“Well…” she relented, “I am hungry.”

“I really don’t see how, but okay.” Janet joked, “We’ll both change into some civ’s and meet in the lobby. I know a great place.”
122113.title: the Wasp's Self-Imposed Scarlet Weight Watch

choices: Friendship affirmed, the two heroines get lunch more often
Happiness is temporary and Wanda quickly retreats again
Stuffed from lunch, our heroes encounter a call for help
1221131.content:
To say that Wanda looked foul was an understatement.
It was one thing to force her to socialise outside of the compound, but the prospect of clothes was borderline repulsive for the witch.
Not to say that sizing itself had caused her problems, a short time weaving her magic had made sure that her outfit was fitting fine, 'civvies' just lacked the comfort of pyjamas she had become so used to as of late.

"Isn't this great Wanda?" shouted Janet a few steps ahead of Wanda as they walked towards their destination.
In contrast to her friend, Janet was far more excited about their lunch date.
Ever the fashionista, it didn't take much convincing for Janet to put an outfit together, especially with a new season on the horizon.
Feeling exceptionally autumnal, the weather had called for jumpers and Janet was set for the occasion with modest natural tones cladding her body from top to toe with a knee length skirt, tights and heeled boots to match.

"Uh huh" grunted Wanda in response, her mind mulling over any potential escape from her forced excursion whilst a mental flick eased the wedgie working its way up her ass.
She found further distraction in the hot dog cart parked on the other side of the road, a glimmer of red dancing across her eyes at the thought.

"Come on" cooed the smaller heroine, stopping on her heels to close the gap between herself and her guest "even you can't be grumpy when food is involved"

"Uh huh" grunted Wanda again, Janet's optimism starting to grate on her.
By pure coincidence they were dressed quite similarly, the main difference been Wanda had opted for jeans and her leather coat was knee length to Janet's hip hugger.
None of that mattered to the witch though and Janet continued her march.

"Have you thought about what you're going to get for lunch then?" asked Janet in the hope that Wanda's new favourite topic would instill some conversation from her and, in a strange roundabout way, it did.

"I dumph know" grunted Wanda through a large mouthful of hot dog, one delicacy in each hand as she continued to swagger behind Janet.

"Where did you get those from?" asked Janet, bemused at the appearance of food as well as Wanda's apparent need to eat more when they were nearly at the restaurant where they were about to get lunch.
Silence followed, met instead with a single movement of the brunette's eyes guiding Janet to the cart where she had acquired her food, using her magic to demonstrate as she drew a third dog to her to refill her now empty left hand.
Janet was dumbstruck and opted to carry on rather than question the situation further which suited Wanda down to the ground as she proceeded to eat in peace.

*****

"Table for two is it?" asked the hostess without looking up as she caught a glimpse of two pairs of feet walk through the restaurant door before her.

"That would be great thanks" replied Janet as the hostess looked up at the pair for the first time.

"Wonderful, lets see where...ohmygod! Jan...Miss van Dyne?!" cried the hostess upon realising who she was speaking to.

Janet chuckled, not to say she was vain but it always brought a smile to her face when she was recognised outside of her superhero get up.
"Janet will be fine"

"Oh great, follow me...Janet"

The two women followed the host as she meandered between tables of people already dining, or at least waiting to dine, with little disruption and it didn't take them long before finding themselves by a discreet booth to one side of the restaurant.

"This is a little more out of the way so you'll be able to dine in peace today" smiled the hostess as she beckoned the two women to their seats "would you like a moment to browse the menu?"
The two women sat down and instinctively reached for a menu, particularly Wanda who couldn't seem to reach hers fast enough, which was odd given that she had had to disintegrate her last hot dog wrapper with her powers as they walked through the restaurant doors.
That was when their host spotted Wanda for the first time properly.

"Oh my goodness, you're Scarlet Witch aren't you, like, THE Scarlet Witch!" squealed the girl, even more excited than when she had indentified Janet.

'Oh great' groaned Wanda internally, feeling no patience for fan girls today of all days.
She never had the patience for them come to think of it but today was low on the list when it came to her tolerance levels.

"Can I just say that you are my absolute favourite Avenger and..."

"I'll take the foot long BLT, a half pound steak burger, a double portion of the macaroni chilli cheese, fries with all three and an onion loaf"
Patience well and truly tested, Wanda had cut the poor girl off mid speech as her hunger gnawed away inside her.
"Please"

"Not a problem, let me just write that down" acknowledged their host, basking in the mere presence of her favourite superhero "and for you Janet van Dyne?"

*****

"Mhm, this looks great" purred Janet as her chicken Cesar salad was placed before her along with the stream of plates been placed before Wanda.
Pleasant acknowledgment wasn't on the larger woman's mind though as she dove straight into her meal.
Considerably more refined than her friend, however, Janet proceeded to delicately spear a selection of greens through a piece of chicken and gently pop it into her mouth.
"Oh wow, that tastes really good too" cooed Janet, continuing to attack her salad with her usual delicate grace.

Wanda, meanwhile, was far from delicate, tearing large mouthfuls from the sandwiches she had ordered whilst magically controlling a spoon to handle her macaroni for her so as not to delay its creamy deliciousness.
It crossed Janet's mind to play mother and insist that Wanda didn't use her magic to eat in public but the prospect of annoying the woman opposite her when there was a chance to help her halted that thought.
'Let her be Jan, let her be' she thought to herself as she continued to work through her salad.

*****

"Oh boy, I am stuffed" declared Janet as she delicately placed her fork down onto her plate, feeling a pleasant warmth inside after her meal.
Meanwhile, Wanda was still devouring the remnants of her order along with the replenished macaroni she had ordered after.
'My that girl can eat' thought Janet, watching over her friend as the last morsels of burger disappeared between her crimson lips.

"Hey, was your lunch good too?" asked Janet genuinely, seeing an opening

"Yeah, it was pretty good" pondered Wanda with an air of pleasantness to her that Janet had not seen on her recently.

"Can I get you anything else today?"
The hostess had returned again, looking a little flustered having still not gotten over the fact that she was serving her idol.

"Oh I think we're done now" responded Janet, taking a moment to inhale some air.

"I could go for some dessert" chimed up Wanda

"Absolutely" smiled their waitress, producing her notepad "what can I get you?"

"Could we get a cheesecake for the table please?" purred Wanda, an almost sultry aspect sneaking into her voice as she ordered.

"Certainly, coming right up"

As the waitress disappeared from the table, Janet could only stare at Wanda in disbelief.

"There is no way you're still hungry after all that"

"Oh yeah, I've been eating none stop for weeks now, this is nothing" purred Wanda again "besides, you know you want a piece now"
Wanda wasn't wrong, although you wouldn't need a telepath to tell you that Janet was a sucker for sweet desserts.
"Besides, with me asking we'll probably get it for free seeing as this girl is crazy about me" smirked Wanda, taking a gentle sip from her glass.
Janet laughed.
The day had certainly taken a turn beyond what she expected but seeing Wanda actually interacting with her was fantastic.
A slice of cheesecake was a worthwhile sacrifice for that cause surely.
1221131.title: The ladies what lunched

choices: Wanda and Wasp have a few peaceful weeks, with lots of lunches inbetween!
Ain't no rest for the wicked; Wanda's new physique gets lots of media exposure!
12211313.content:
Leaving the restaurant and heading out into the city streets, the two superheroes couldn't have looked more content. The fall air was crisp, their coats were warm, and their bellies were full. It was important to do this kind of thing, the “totally normal human” kind of thing, whenever they could. After all, who knew when some costumed loony would attack New York City? The next big crisis event was always looming on the horizon—fighting villains, fighting aliens, fighting each other—and the pros knew that it was important to get in these small bites of normalcy while you can.

Well, in Wanda’s case, big bites of normalcy. Lots and lots of big bites.

The Scarlet Witch rested her hands on her big, stuffed belly. It had swollen to full size throughout the course of her lunch date with Jan, pooching proudly from her coat’s center front. Turgid and round, and with her weight gain, there was no doubt in Jan’s mind that the tabloids would have a field day dreaming up some pregnancy scandal to put in the papers.

Thankfully for all of them, Wanda was just pregnant with one heck of a food baby.

“That was nice, huh?” Janet offered pleasantly, “You have fun?”

“The lunch was very good.” Wanda burped softly

“But did you have fun?” Wanda craned her neck expectantly, “Like, did you enjoy getting out of the Tower?”

“It was…” Janet could see the beginnings of a smile tugging at Wanda’s lips, “…enjoyable.”

“Good, I’m glad you enjoyed yourself.” Janet fought the urge to pump her arms and gloat about getting her out of the house, “Well, we can do this any time you want, Wanda. I’m always here for you.”

“I may take you up on that offer.” Wanda said with a pleased pat at the top of her stomach, “I’ll admit that I have missed—”

And then, just as soon as Janet was sure Wanda was going to say “I have missed being around people”, there was a loud explosion off in the horizon. The two of them paused as the ground shook slightly, the citizens around them looking up to see yet another attack on the constantly recovering NYC.

“I hate New York.” Janet huffed, shrinking down. Her clothes fell into a neat little pile below her—the now tiny woman hovering at eye-level with her lunchmate, “You coming?”

“I suppose.” Wanda huffed, taking a logy step forward, “Oogh… better fly there too…”

***


The source of the commotion was another eatery, not too far away from where they’d just eaten lunch. It was an old-timey burger joint that Cap and some of the other Avengers liked to go to after especially big missions to cool off. Janet had been here once or twice—usually when someplace a little more cosmopolitan wasn’t open. She wasn’t much of a burger girl.

“Alright, money in the bag!”

Nobody but Spider-Man was really sure what happened to the original Electro. During the time he switched bodies with Doctor Octopus, he had his powers taken away by a Parker Industries lab. Or was it after? Whatever, something something cloning, something something no powers, something something ex-girlfriend. That guy couldn’t write a mission report to save his life. To everyone who wasn’t in on the Clone Conspiracy, that old hokey villain Electro had just been replaced by a new one—Francine Frye—who took the name and the powers for herself.

And, not to be catty, but Janet couldn’t help but feel like she filled out her green spandex better when she had first gotten the job.

Francine Frye was holding up a burger joint for cash. How quaint! These new villains sure liked to get in their grunt work, that much was for sure. But as Wanda and Janet got closer, they could tell that this had been the most exercise that Francine had gotten in quite a while. She’d gone and gotten a little plump since the last time her mugshot was uploaded into the Avengers database—carrying some heft around her middle in a glorious green muffin-top and starter belly.

“Seriously, robbing a restaurant?” Janet snorted, crossing her arms and fluttering next to her partner, “Cliché.”

“So excuse the hell outta me for not having been around when superheroing was invented you hag.” Electro rolled her eyes and shot a bolt of lightning across the room, “A girl’s gotta eat!”

“But do you have to eat so much?” Janet zipped out of the way while Wanda absorbed the bolt with a bright red shield of energy, “Seriously, you look like you’ve had enough.”

Janet looked back to Wanda, who shot her a dirty look. Looks like Wanda was a bit more sensitive about her weight than she’d been letting on, and didn’t appreciate the jabs that the Wasp had been making. It was a look petulant enough to distract Janet into getting fried by a stray zap.

“Rude!” Francine growled, “And I’m the bad guy when you’re over there body-shaming me!”

“You are robbing a restaurant!” Wanda said, shooting the lightning back with a fresh red glow, “You are still very much the bad guy!”

“BUT NOW MY FEELINGS ARE HURT.”

Electro roared as she pulled the electricity from the lights, kitchen equipment, and even from people’s cell phones to power up a sudden doming charge of power. It was enough to shock plenty of the patrons and knock Wanda onto her well-padded rump.

Janet stayed close to the ground, her muscles tensed by the lightning coursing throughout her body.

“I do not have time for this.” Wanda grunted as she struggled to stand, “You are making a very pleasant day into a very tedious one, Electra!”

“IT’S ELECTRO!” Francine barked, shooting another bolt of lightning at the rising witch, “WHY IS THAT SO HARD FOR EVERYBODY?!”

Wanda absorbed the bolt and fired back.

“J-Just because you weigh as much as the old Electro did in muscle, doesn’t mean—”

Janet received another shock

“You want us to treat you like the real thing?” Wanda asked, her eyes glowing red as she lifted slightly into the air, “Here is an old trick that has never failed someone without magic powers.”

Using her Hex magic, Wanda made the pipes beneath the restaurant groan in agony as a sudden deluge filled the place. The sprinkler systems activated, the floors flooded, and Francine Frye shorted out like a toaster in a bathtub.

As the customers and wait staff slowly realized the battle was done, they came to the heroes’ side. Soggy and wet, their food ruined, they were happy just happy that the day was saved. Or that they got to see a real-life superhero fight. Either way, fun story for them to tell.

“Thank you, thank you.” Wanda said in a bored tone of voice as she picked up the Wasp—absolutely drenched and her outfit ruined—“We will be happy to be on our way now and, um… someone should probably call the police.”

***


Back in the infirmary at the Tower, Wanda slowly sat up from her reclined position, a little woozy but no worse for wear from the scuffle that they’d both endured.

“What I said back there, about Electro…” Wanda looked away shyly, “You know I was just trying to get under her skin, right?”

“As you and the Spider-Man are wont to do.” Wanda huffed, “For all of your talk about wanting to help me and accepting me, you were very quick to make Fat Jokes back there. Words hurt, you know.”

“Well, trust me, electricity isn’t a walk in the park either.” Wasp grimaced, “But even still. I’m sorry if I hurt your feelings.”

Wanda made a face.

“All is forgiven.” She said with a small smile, “Once you are all taken care of, we should get lunch another time. It wasn’t… too bad.”

“I’d like that—” Janet smiled, “One superhero team-up, hold the punches.”
12211313.title: One Superhero Team-Up, Extra Crispy

choices: Janet's worry goes into overdrive, pushing her to spend more time with Wanda
Wanda's newspaper roast propels her into body positivity stardom
Certain lady Avengers are less than supportive and feel Wanda's bite
122113132.content:
Despite some frosty moments after their fight with Electro, the girls had a good routine down with Janet's penchant for giddiness and Wanda's moody tendencies working in a strange roundabout way, but it didn't take long for things to get a violent shake up.

*****

"Oh lordy..." muttered Janet with that morning's copy of the Daily Bugle in hand, an anxious bite dug into her lower lip.

"What's that doofus said now?" inquired Peter Parker from across the room, dangling upside down in a large armchair whilst flicking through some holographic designs.

"Oh erm...nothing about you Peter, just Jameson being Jameson" grumbled Janet as she scanned the front page article, trying not to look at the half page photograph that went with it.

"Oh...ok" shrugged Peter before going back to his schematics, a typical teenage disinterest taking his attention elsewhere.

Hardly involved in the conversation anyway, Janet returned to anxiously reading the paper.

'...Like any hero of New York, it is only to be expected that Wanda Maximoff would require some down time, but one cannot help but be concerned when her past times seem to revolve exclusively around indulging in any eatery within a ten-block radius of Avengers Tower and stretching her clothes to the MAX...'

"Woah boy, is that Wanda?!" screeched Jessica Drew from behind where Janet was sat before barrel rolling over the sofa onto the seat beside her colleague and snatching the paper from her unsuspecting hands.

"Hey!" tried Janet before been abruptly cut off by the sound of raucous laughter.

"Oh my god, she is getting huge!" burst Jessica as her eyes began to stream laughing tears from looking at the accompanying photograph.
It was hard for Janet to argue that particular sentiment, even to try and spare her friend's feelings.
The photo was quite recent if Janet recalled the outfit correctly and certainly wasn't from a flattering angle but, having seen Wanda recently, The Wasp was well aware that the betrayed assets were genuine.
From the slight one-sided angle Wanda's thick flaring hips and thighs were evident in the witch's jeans, not to mention the heavy looking belly extending ahead of her enlarged figure. It was undeniable that Wanda's chest had also benefited from her constant eating but it would take a much different media outlet to draw attention to that than the Bugle distributed roast splattered across the pages before the two superheroines.

"Come on Jess, don't be so mean" defended Janet as she tried to grab the paper back to prevent Jessica from reading more than she already had "she's going through a rough time"

"Oh I can see that!" chuckled Jessica "must be real difficult getting those jeans on before going and stuffing her face"

"What are you guys talking about?"

The question caught both women off guard but they knew it had come from behind and, Janet at the least, knew who it had come from.

"Oh, hey Wanda!" forced Janet, turning to face her friend in an attempt to avoid her discovering the derogatory article "how are you feeling today? You want to go and grab some lunch?"

Jessica giggled uncontrollably as the words came from Janet's lips.

"Maybe" replied Wanda, opting to ignore the childish fit going on on the sofa.

"Well let me know and I'll book somewhere" smiled Janet.

Jessica's laughter only intensified as she made a pathetic attempt to muffle the noise, stomping her foot slightly on the sofa cushion beneath her.

"Oh is that today's paper?" asked Wanda, noticing the pages crumpled up between her colleagues "I've not had chance to read it yet"

"It is" rushed Janet "but its a real slow news day, nothing interesting at all"

"That actually sounds nice, I wouldn't mind a moment of mundane" purred Wanda as she lent over the sofa.
The angle did wonders for her chest as it sat heavily on the back of the sofa which, in turn, caused her woefully undersized tshirt to expose the small of her back and her hips.
Unable to stop what was about to happen, Janet simply sighed and allowed it as Jessica bit her lip sheepishly, trying to hold back more laughter.

Standing straight again and straightening the paper, Wanda glanced over the front page.
For a moment she looked oddly peaceful and Janet foolishly hoped that Wanda had reached a place of peace with the situation so as not to be affected by such a low blow.
Janet was wrong.
