Although calm reigned at first, it was brief, and Wanda's face slowly but surely twisted into a much more fierce expression.
As her grip tightened on the edges of the paper, her lips curled tightly against her teeth and the faintest glimmer of red burst across her brown eyes as they slowly lowered down the page.
The glow only intensified as Wanda read the article and her hair began to float around her before, in a sudden red burst, the paper disappeared between her hands as a few scraps of paper floated to the floor.

Completely lost for what to say, Janet and Jessica watched as Wanda quietly seethed, maintaining her posture as if the paper hadn't just been vapourised with her face screwed up viciously.

"Wanda, I...I'm..." started Janet, hoping her intended comforting message would form itself if she started it.

"I have to go" murmured Wanda before turning on her heels, her anger still apparent in her voice.

Again, silence washed over the two women as the stared at the space that Wanda had occupied just seconds before.
Glancing at each other in their confusion, it took an unexpected comment to snap the pair out of their trance.

"Hey, erm...does she know she's still wearing pyjamas or?..." asked Peter, having never left his seat on the other side of the room.

"Shut up Parker" snapped Jessica with a half glance over her shoulder, still transfixed on the same spot.

*****

"So I know that Maximoff isn't our usual front pager and all but I just couldn't resist after that photo was mailed in" mused Miriam Birchwood.

"I don't give a rats ass what you couldn't resist Miriam, you're the god damn GOSSIP WRITER!" screamed J. Jonah Jameson through his smoldering cigar.

"I know that boss but you should see the response it's getting, Spidey hasn't had this kind of response on the front page in weeks" defended Miriam, knowing how to handle Jameson's moods after years of working at the Bugle.

"Are you out of your god damn mind, we're...there's a response?"

"Yes, lots of interest, people might act all prim and proper but everybody loves a good bitch, especially when it comes to celebrities"

Jameson pondered this with a good chomp on his cigar before sliding back into his chair.

"You know what Miriam, I want you on this 24/7. Maximoff leaves that tower and I want you on her faster than she can eat doughnuts, y'hear?" demanded Jameson as he looked over the front page of that morning's paper.

"Yes sir" chirped Miriam with a wry smile.

"Oh and keep an eye out for if any more of these freaks start to make like Thanksgiving turkeys, you got that?"

"Yes sir" smiled the office gossip as she made to leave her senior's office, only to walk straight into Wanda Maximoff herself.

"Out of my way" growled the brunette as she shoved Miriam into an office chair before striding into Jameson's office with a box of doughnuts in tow.

"What in god's name, call security!" screamed Jameson as he stood from his desk to square up to the marauding witch but, with a flick of her finger, Wanda had closed and barred the door before Miriam could leave.

"You crazy woman, what the hell are you doing?!" demanded Jameson as Wanda came within an inch of her tormentor for the day, not even pausing as she allowed a doughnut to glide into her mouth from the box behind "and why the hell are you stealing the doughnuts I buy for my reporters?!"

Wanda swallowed before wiping her mouth on the back of her hand politely, exuding a lot of confidence (or intimidation at the least) for a woman wearing short pyjamas that were too small for her growing figure.
"You weren't very nice about me in your paper today" purred Wanda, leaning into the bearded man before her.

"And what? I'm here to report news and your fat ass made the news this morning!" shouted Jameson directly into the witch's face, spraying her with spittle from one side of his cigar.

Wanda smiled before wiping her face which, as her hand came away, had changed.
The change hadn't gone unnoticed by Jameson who only realised what it meant far too late.

In one well practiced move Wanda launched herself and Jameson into the air with her powers, pinning the journalist against his office window, a faint cracking sound radiating from behind as a razor thin line shot past his ear.
Taking a probably inappropriate time to bite into another doughnut, Wanda slowly floated towards Jameson, pressing herself against him as she chewed slowly and increasing the pressure just enough to cause more cracks to spread across the window.
All manner of decorum lost, Wanda readdressed him with a mouthful of pastry.

"Call me fat again in your paper and I won't stop you before going through the glass next time" purred Wanda, continuing to indulge in her doughnuts whilst pressing her weight ever so slightly more against the angered newspaper owner.

"Alright, alright! Get off of me you crazy woman!" screamed Jameson, feeling uncomfortably squashed against Wanda's bulk.

Wanda smirked before floating herself down to the floor and striding for the door.
"Hey! Let me down!" bellowed Jameson again, veins pulsing in his forehead.
With a moment's hesitation Wanda flicked her wrist causing Jameson to come crashing down onto his office floor and a torrent of expletives followed her into the lift.
122113132.title: The fork-tongued Bugler of NYC!

choices: A "little" takeout, ha!—Not much little about Wanda these days, or her appetite!
It becomes apparent very early on that this might have been a mistake...
1221131321.content:
Being a superhero wasn’t as cut and dry as it used to be—ask anyone who had been in the game for as long as Janet had, and they’d tell you just the same.

But the one thing that you generally didn’t get to do, unless the other person’s name was Sally Field, was go into a media outlet and threaten the chief of staff for putting unflattering pictures of you in their gossip rag. Even if you were made the subject of an entire article, that kind of thing didn’t fly—just ask Spider-Man.

No matter how much ol’ Brush-Head had it coming, pretty much everyone agreed that Wanda had taken a step too far. The minute that one of them—an Avenger, Defender, X-Man, what have you—could go in and demand a retraction and forcefully discourage having their name in an (admittedly trashy) gossip column was the minute that they needed to take a step back and reevaulate why they were in the business of saving people’s lives.

Cap had been against it the most—First Amendment, Freedom of the Press, Bill of Rights and all that. Taking Wanda’s heavy-handed approach to censorship into account with her already strange behavior, he was the first to suggest that it was time for her to take a leave of absence.

“Just until she can work through whatever’s been bothering her.” His sternness softened a bit, “Wanda’s a good woman. She’s just going through a lot right now.”

“No arguments on that—but that’s all the more reason that we should be watching her at the Tower instead of kicking her out.” Tony’s holographic interface said, broadcasting all the way from Dubai, “I mean, Wanda doesn’t exactly have the best history when it comes to being on her own during times of crisis.”

This meeting had been going on for at least an hour, and Janet couldn’t felt more conflicted about it. They all did, each and every one of them. Wanda may not have been there at the beginning, but she was a second wave Avenger—one of their first choices for expanding the team. All of them had known her for years, and seeing her act so strangely, so suddenly, was more than a little troubling.

Especially given the aforementioned history that she had whenever things got sour for her mental space. Reality altering powers were a great thing when they were fighting on the side of good, but when the wielder of those powers sunk a little too far off the deep end, for one reason or another, things could get messy.

Captain America, Banner, and herself had been the only ones to make it in person. Tony’s hologram flickered alongside one of Hawkeye—busy in South America—while Thor and Quicksilver had been unable to respond. Two wieners out of the pack didn’t make this any less of a sausage fest though. They were all about band-aiding this problem. Janet and Wanda were the only girls on the “original” team, and it was times like this that she was reminded of that little fact.

“We could always study her brain chemistry?” Bruce suggested helpfully (or rather, what he thought was helpful), “I’ve been working on a new Gamma-based radiation experiment that, in theory should—”

“We are not going green on Wanda’s brain.” Janet said firmly, “Seriously, do you hear yourself when you talk?”

“It was just a suggestion.” Bruce shrunk back into his seat

“Janet, I appreciate how passionate you are about this situation—but Wanda is a dear friend to all of us.” Cap said with a gesture to the remaining roster, “We’re all concerned, and you have shot down every one of our suggestions as to how to contain her.”

“We don’t need to contain her, we need to talk to her.” Janet scowled, “We don’t need to lock her up, and we don’t need to kick her off the team, and we super don’t need to microwave her brain!”

“Maybe it’s her—”

“I swear to God Clint, if you even suggest that it’s her time of the month, I will wasp sting the depth-perception part of your brain.”

The holographic Hawkeye slowly put his hand down like a child, rejected in class by an irate teacher.

“Well Wasp, you have the floor.” Tony sighed, “What do you suggest that we do about Wanda?”

***


Trying to find a place in New York that offered a modicum of privacy from the superheroing community, and one that also wasn’t overrun with super villains, was almost impossible. Since they’d carved it up like a Thanksgiving turkey, all of the best spots were taken. Spider-Man had Queens, Luke Cage had Harlem, ol’ Hornhead had Hell’s Kitchen, Doc Strange had the Village, even that new Spider-Man had Brooklyn—the list went on. New York was a big place, but with new superheroes cropping out of the woodwork, it was getting harder and harder to find neighborhoods that were “unclaimed”.

The object here was to find a place that was relatively devoid of superheroics—a place where Wanda could de-stress, but still be on-call if they needed her. Or if she went off the deep end.

So, where else was a girl to go? SoHo.

“I hope you don’t mind—it’s a little cramped.” Janet wiped the sweat from her brow as she plopped an especially heavy box of junk onto the floor, “Well, for you I mean. Whole size-changing thing means that just about anywhere I want can be as roomy as I need it to be.”

Wanda had opted to float her boxes, and herself, up the fire escape rather than brave the elevator. Her sizable shape had grown even moreso since her little incident at the Daily Bugle, as she’d grown increasingly comfortable with her heft hovering. She’d developed a wide, wide set of hips that blossomed into thick legs and an improbably plump rear. Her large stomach had begun to sink lower into a blobby white belly apron, thickening around the middle as it folded into two distinct tiers. Wanda’s round face looked especially rosy with the scarlet aura of her magical abilities, keeping her load weightless as she slowly came to settle everything on the floor.

“I used to sleep in the back of a vardo.” Wanda snorted, settling everything with a quiet oof, “And even if I had not, your apartment is bigger than most people’s homes.”

“Really? I always thought this place was a little small…”

Janet had owned this place for a while now—well, her father’s company had owned it. It was a place to stay for off-site business partners to stay while they were in town. But, seeing as how it hadn’t been used since before Janet and Hank were married (and that was a long, long time ago) she figured that there wouldn’t be any harm in allocating it for a little official Avengers business.

Janet had managed to talk Tony and Steve into letting her and Wanda live here, as a sort of compromise between their two ideas. Wanda wouldn’t be kicked off of the team, she’d just be put on the bench for a while until she could get things figured out. But she wouldn’t be doing it alone, because Wanda had graciously offered to be her sponsor. And more importantly, she’d agreed to be her friend in this time of need.

“Okay—room on the right’s yours, room on the left’s mine.” Janet brushed her hands together triumphantly, “What do you say we break in the joint?”

“Wonderful, I am starved.” the Rubenesque Romani said in a husky voice as she waddled towards the couch, “Moving is exhausting.”

Throwing herself down with all her weight, Scarlet Witch let out a grunt. Her whole body wobbled at the meteoric impact of her ass to the big leather couch. Floating the remote over to her, bathing the little device in a bright red glow, Wanda sank comfortably into the sofa as she flicked the TV on.

“I was thinking more like a little champagne, but…” Janet grimaced

“We can have champagne.” Wanda conceded graciously, “And Chinese food. I have had such a craving.”

Janet could only laugh. She was getting passed the point of being worried by Wanda's appetite. If anything, it was a sign that her friend was feeling up to things. The fact that they'd gotten her to agree to move in here, away from the Tower at all, had been a small miracle. With how well she'd been taking it so far, what was the harm in a little takeout?

Just the two of them, OG Avengers gals, rooming together? This might actually be kind of fun!
1221131321.title: Super Roomies

choices: Absolutely! Wanda was going nuts with the food lately, but this was too much!
No way! The last thing that Wanda needed to hear from Janet was criticism!
12211313211.content:
Janet had been left in charge of getting the champagne. She’d shifted in size, her insectoid wings coming through, and buzzed her way out of the open skylight (a necessity for those flying superheroics!) before returning to full size on the street in her civvies. She knew just the place to get the best wine for the occasion, and she wasn’t about to let her first night in her new apartment go without a proper toast.

“I’ll be right back, Wanda!” she had said cordially, shrinking down into her alter-ego, “Order us something for lunch—make sure it’s light!”

And to say that Wanda had gone overboard would have been an understatement.

By the time that Janet had returned, from her trip, wine bottle in hand, she had only been gone about an hour. She’d had to take the elevator up since she couldn’t shrink the champagne with her, which added another five… maybe ten minutes to her commute upstairs. An insufficient amount of time to explain just how Wanda had managed to order all of this food and have it arrive in just seventy short minutes.

“Wanda!” Janet nearly dropped the champagne, “I told you to order something light!”

“Did you?” the Scarlet Witch sniffed, one container into her Chinese food, “You must have been tiny—I would have heard you.”

Wanda had ordered something from every corner of the city. Wieners, subs, pizza from the good places and the bad, and enough Chinese food to feed Wakanda. All of it was placed in an array, on the coffee table in front of the gigantic television in a tightly grouped bunch.

Well, whatever wasn’t floating around Wanda anyway.

“Jesus Christ, you would have thought we were having the Hulks over.” The Wasp gasped at the sight of it all—the thick smell of greasy takeout lingering heavy in the air, “What’s gotten into you, girl?”

“I am just hungry.” Wanda non-answered, slurping from her noodle box, “Moving is exhausting.”

Yeah, if only you moved, Janet grumbled to herself as she took her seat on the couch. Her fellow Avenger hadn’t so much as moved a muscle since she set foot in their apartment! All she’d done is float her share of the boxes up with her, herself included. Which half of that equation weighed more was becoming less and less of a clear question…

“Do you like what I have done with the place?” Wanda gestured vaguely with her thickening arms around the apartment, “The only boxes left are yours. They are in the corner.”

“The what now?” Janet asked as she picked a box of Chinese food at random from the pile

After looking around, Janet was impressed to find that, yes, Wanda had done something other than cram their apartment with enough food to feed the entire line of Avengers—Mighty, New, and Young. All of their stuff had been put up! Pictures with old teammates hung up on the wall, knick-knacks and souvenirs placed in the cabinets… the cabinet had been assembled… everything was already moved in! She’d even managed to get plants from somewhere…

“Wow, Wanda.” Janet whistled, popping open her takeout box, “I thought Pietro was supposed to be the speedster.”

“It was nothing—I was bored.” Wanda grunted, elevating one of many drinks straw-first to her plump pink lips, “Did you get the wine?”

“Oh, right—“Janet held it up, “Best champagne in town!”

“Good, I would like something bubbly to settle my stomach.” Wanda floated two glasses over from the cabinet, “Let us do the Cheers.”

***


Janet leaned back into the sofa, her tiny belly taut and fit to burst.

She hadn’t eaten this much since her newly divorced days. Those nights comfort-eating Hagendaas hadn’t been fun, but even they had left her feeling less like crap than what she’d just done to herself. For such a small woman (no pun intended) Janet had always thought that she could pack away more than her fair share of food when the time called for it.

But today? Woof…

“Are you going to finish that?” Wanda asked thickly from her side of the couch

“God no, take it away…” Janet whimpered as her half a sub sandwich began to glow red and float away, “I’m so full…”

If the Scarlet Witch had heard her, she hadn’t cared to respond. She was far too engrossed in what had to have been her bajillionth hot dog. As Janet’s sandwich hovered over, the blimping brunette barely took her eyes off of the chili-cheese dog as she opened her mouth. Her piggish sounds of mastication played under the superhero documentary playing on the television as she lazily fed herself via telekinesis. As her stomach bulged and rose, slowly filling up with more food than any one woman had any right to eat in one sitting, she rested her hands on its doming circumference. Occasionally she’d pat it approvingly, stroking it as she filled it more and more to its capacity…

“Jeez Wanda, it’s not going anywhere.” Janet grumbled, “It’s not like it’s going to fly away.”

Wanda, preoccupied with her flying food, barely responded. She breathed in shallow breaths, her mind foggy as indulgence overcame her.

“Are you okay?” Janet asked, “You sound like you’re about to give birth to a litter over there…”
“Fine.” Wanda grunted, her hands traveling down the slope of her stomach, “Lemme just…”

With a great sigh of relief, Wanda unfastened the button on her pants and berthed her beastly belly onto her lap. Her expression hazy and dumb with relief, Wanda’s indulgence resumed once more with gusto. She began eating—gorging her way through the various meals that she’d ordered to the apartment more than two hours ago.

And she was still going strong.

“Much better.” She said happily, her hands resting pleasantly on her growing gut as she reclined deeper into her seat.

Watching Wanda go was nauseating. How a woman could eat that much, shove that much past her lips, was astounding. But it was like a train wreck, Janet couldn’t look away.

It was no wonder Wanda’s weight was getting out of hand.

As her friend… was it Janet’s job to say something?
12211313211.title: Getting Settled

choices: With no active duty and nothing to do but eat, Wanda gets wide.
A super-villain attacks in SoHo! It's a familiar face with some new chins!
122113132112.content:
As her friend, it was Janet’s job to watch out for Wanda—that’s why she was here.

But from one woman to another, the last thing that Wanda probably needed to hear right about now was that Janet, her longtime friend and sole defender against this crusade that everyone had against her weight, was getting freaked out by how much food she was eating. They had just moved in and with a talk like that, all of Janet’s hard work would have been undone. She would have floated off to God knows where and would have been left to sit and stew all by her lonesome.

And historically, that was never the best option to take.

Reality would thank Janet for withholding her feelings later, for sure.

Regardless, the woman was totally overcome with consuming everything in front of her. Like a big red goldfish. She had to eat it all. Her heavy grunts and her fatty sounds of piggish enjoyment were all that Janet could hear, even under the Disney+ queue! And with every bite, she just seemed to sink deeper into the couch, deeper into her hedonism, as her hands began to rub deep concentric circles into her doming stomach…

It definitely made Janet feel better about pigging out on two boxes of chicken fried rice and a half a sub sandwich, that much was for sure.

“I’m, uh… gonna go sleep this off.” Janet offered an explanation to unhearing ears, “You gonna pause that?”

Wanda grunted dumbly in response as she deep-throated a burrito

“Cool.”

Standing up, her legs noodly, Janet did her best to drone out the sights and sounds of one of her oldest friends making a pig out of herself as she made her way to her room. She hadn’t been exaggerating about needing to sleep this off—all the moving, plus all the eating really had left her exhausted.

As she collapsed into her mattress, Janet could still hear the sounds of her new roommate gorging and the TV blaring. Reaching into her coat pocket, she pulled out a tiny disk with a stylized FF logo on it.

“Reed Richards, you’re the most useless man in the universe.” Janet sighed before activating her White Noise machine, “Except for this, and only this moment.”

All of the sound outside of the room came to a standstill as Janet was finally left alone with her thoughts. That thing would drown out any noise from outside and muffle any noise from inside the radius of her room. It would be useful for giving reports back to Steve about Wanda’s progress, but it also apparently worked as a great noise barrier from her noisy roommate. The less she had to think about food, the better.

“Tell me I’m doing the right thing, here.” Janet groaned skyward, “I’m a good friend, right?”

No answer. Obviously. The one God in the universe that she wanted to talk to, and he wasn’t one of the ones that she had on speed-dial.

“Yeah, I thought as much.” Janet groaned, rolling off of her bed, “I’m gonna put on my PJs…”

When Janet woke up the next morning, none of the food was left from the night before. None of the mess, either. But the loud snoring from the boulder-sized Scarlet Witch as she struggled to digest her epic feast suggested that it had been one battle that Wanda hadn’t won so easily.

Janet really had her work cut out for her with this one…
122113132112.title: Friends Let Friends Float Food

choices: "Right, I had... forgotten." in a bashful, genuinely remorseful way
"Why bother? I am a laughingstock..." in a depressed dismissal
"No more diets." with a manic twinkle in her eye
1221131321121.content:
Founding Avengers didn’t get to take vacations very often.

Saving the world was a full-time job, and nobody could do it quite like the Avengers. Back at the Tower, slumming it at the old Mansion, Wasp was pretty much a full-time superhero. Not like some of the other part-timers these days—the ones who managed to have personal lives. The world always threatened to pull itself apart the minute anyone got any peace and quiet, and somehow the Wasp had always managed to put personal time as an aside.

Wanda’s bench warming days were a blessing for the wonderful Wasp, because it finally allowed her some downtime. Time to be spent at normal size, out of uniform, and not having to zap bad guys. Time just being a regular New Yorker—well, at least as normal as you could get with a life like Janet VanDyne’s.

She spent her time doing everything she wished she could do when she was on active duty. She saw plays, she went to see movies, she went downtown, tried new restaurants. Would you believe that she even had a few dates? Short of having an actual job outside of spandex and looking over her shoulder for the next crisis that forced all the teams to cross over (or fight against each other), Janet did her best to spend her time like she’d always wanted.

Wanda used her free time to eat.

For the better part of two months Janet had been on Wanda-Vision, trying to get her friend to work through her funk. Coaxing her out of the apartment every once in a while, taking her to nice clothing stores that catered to women of her *ahem* particular size, and generally just trying to be a supportive friend.

But most days, whether Janet was home or not, Wanda spent her time cooped up in apartment. She would spend all day dressed down getting cozy as she waited on herself hand and foot. Anything and everything in the living room was up to glow red as soon as Wanda decided she needed it—she’d levitate her phone over to the couch with an outstretched chubby palm, her remote with a stubborn look. But with anything edible, it just sort of gravitated towards her. Janet had come home for about the billionth time to a lazy river of takeout circling Wanda’s head.

She had certainly gotten bigger—no arguments about that. Janet had done her best to stay supportive, but there was no denying that this was getting out of control.

“Wanda?” Janet asked as the door shut behind her, “You okay?”

“Mrmph.”

The Scarlet Witch’s neck had further receded underneath the rounding slope of her second chin as it hung from her neck. Chubby ivory cheeks reflected the crimson glow of her abilities, specks and splashes of her previous courses evident on her face while her tongue lolled out excitedly. Her hands resting lazily on her bulging stomach as it sloped and rolled towards the edge of their couch, she drummed her fingers happily as a burrito forced about a third of itself into her awaiting mouth.

“You sure?” Janet piqued, hanging her coat up on the catch, “Because you were there when I left. This morning.”

“Just having a little dinner.”

Wanda answered in a nonplussed, dismissive sort of way as her brown eyes flashed greedily. She had grown hoggishly fat since this whole debacle started, her stunning superhero looks having been padded and expanded to an almost unrecognizable degree.

All she wanted to do was eat—Wanda had made that very clear. That’s all she did. Janet couldn’t bring her anywhere without stopping at various food stands or restaurants, both of which she had a nasty tendency to empty. The woman had a one-track mind these days, and it led straight into that giant gut of hers.

Sitting on the couch, Wanda’s stomach rolled over both of her mile-wide thighs. It was a constantly stuffed mountain, growing ever bigger and rounder with each passing meal. Her atrophied arms were distressingly round and useless. She’d barely used them since she moved into this new apartment. Or at least, Janet hadn’t seen her do so.

“How’s your diet going?” Janet asked hopefully, “You know, we talked about this—cutting out some extra calories might do you some good!”

Wanda didn’t even look at Janet as she said the words…
1221131321121.title: The Plot Thickens

choices: In her efforts to help slim Wanda down, Janet suffers some... temptation.
After a few weeks, Janet notices something odd about the other Avengers gals...
12211313211213.content:
“No more diets.” The Scarlet Witch puffed weakly as a sandwich floated past her lips, “No… more…”

“Wanda!” Janet balked, “What have you done to yourself now!?”

Janet had walked over to the other side of the couch by now, giving her a good look at the sheer size of her friend—the planetary pink belly of her super-sized scarlet superfriend was stuffed round and taut with what had to have been another one of her all-day binges.

Each of her pillowy thighs had to spread painfully far. Her sloping, rock-hard middle domed painfully out from her waist, shiny with sweat and Hex magic. With her hands resting on either side, her great chest rising and falling with her erratic shallow breaths, Wanda may as well have been having contractions! Her food baby belly was so huge and round, Wanda wasn’t sure how she hadn’t popped yet! The double-tiered doughy gut that her friend had been sporting had become almost completely spherical—pinning her super size to the couch and left to stew.

“Just… one more…” Wanda gasped pathetically, “I… need it…”

Craning her neck forward, Wanda’s double chin uncreased slightly as she fought against her own size to reach a slice of pizza. She whimpered weakly, her eyes glassy with piggish greed. Janet could see that her friend was coated in a sheen of sweat beneath her pajamas. She was eating herself to the point of physical pain—this had to stop!

“Wanda!” Janet slapped the slice of pizza away from her friend’s mouth, “This has to stop!”

“Stop?” her friend gasped, her breathing ragged, “No, never stop.”

“Wanda, you have to stop eating so much food!” Janet took her friend by the shoulders, “You’re gonna kill yourself!”

“Stop… eating?” Wanda panted, her blank expression slowly furrowing and creasing in distaste as a manic twinkle sparkled in her eyes, “But I… like to eat.”

And then, with worrying clarity, she said

“I am in control.”

“The only thing you’re in control of is your own gravitational field, wide load.” Janet said sternly, her hands on her hips, “That’s it, this has gone far enough—starting tomorrow we are going to whip you back into shape.”

“Wha… n-no…” Wanda burped, wincing as Janet came into contact with her taut tummy, “Janet…”

Tapping into the Pym Particles that powered her, Janet augmented her strength as best she could. Growing wasn’t her forte—so accessing the strength that came with super-size without ruining a perfectly good coat was difficult. She managed to roll the weighty witch to her feet with an incredible amount of effort. No doubt that, had Janet VanDyne been a normal svelte New Yorker without superpowers, Wanda would still be pinned down on that couch.

“Oof!” she grunted, “God you’re heavy…”

Wanda could only burp in response. Without the support of the couch beneath it, Wanda’s stomach sagged worryingly low underneath the weight of everything she’d eaten. Her great jiggling mass was like battling an avalanche of pizza dough in a brown wig. Janet could barely get a grip on her to force her one way or the other.

“March, missy!” Janet grunted, shoving her sizable friend towards her bedroom, “We’ll talk about this in the morning after you sleep off everything that you’ve eaten tonight!”

“Janeeet!” Wanda whined, “I don’t want to… to…”

A sudden churning in her stomach, audible even to the Wasp, gave Wanda a great discomfort. Her whole face squinched, she began clutching at whatever she could reach of her stomach with both hands. She doubled over as far as her taxed knees would let her, groaning in a low voice as a sudden and sharp pain overcame her.

“I… I suppose some bedrest could help.” Wanda relented, “I…”

“Am not going anywhere, or doing anything, that does not involve that bedroom.” Janet used her best field-commander voice, “I have been nice, I have been helpful, and I have done my best to be supportive, but you have got to get yourself in control.”

“But… I am in control…” Wanda’s dinner plate face turned red and sweaty, “Janet, I—”

“We will talk about this in the morning.” Janet pointed into Wanda’s bedroom, “Now get in there and go to bed.”

Wanda—far too stuffed and tired to argue—simply sighed dejectedly, waddling towards the door. Janet winced as she watched her friend’s gigantic ass wobble behind her.

“And change your pajamas.” The Wasp added, “Those are all… sweaty.”

***


Janet had had to order takeout. Wanda had eaten literally everything in the apartment.

The pizza guy knew their apartment off the top of his head now, which was embarrassing. He was almost surprised when it was Janet who had answered the door and not a three-hundred pound brunette or a red light. The last time there had been one lone, solitary pizza in this apartment was anyone’s guess.

While Wanda slept off her gut-busting meal, Janet went to work cleaning out anything and everything unhealthy that had somehow escaped Wanda’s rampage. Cookies, chips, microwave food, anything that was unhealthy had all gone into the trash. Now, she was vacuuming. Fixing the apartment after Wanda’s binges was going to be a thing of the past, whether she liked it or not.

Wanda wouldn’t be happy about it, but clearly babying her wasn’t getting her anywhere but Extra Large.

“I had a real breakthrough with Wanda today, Tony.” Wanda said into the earpiece, “I sat her down and told her what was what.”

“That’s… good news?” Iron Man asked with an audible wince, “Did she…?”

“No, she was a little… um… under the weather when it all happened.” Janet had wisely chosen to hide the finer details from her fellow Avengers, “But when she sees I’m serious, I think we’ll have things back on track with her.”

In Wanda’s room, the lights dark, as Wanda’s spherical shape hovered a whole foot off of the bed. Her slumbering size loomed ominously beneath the blanket as it draped off of her enormous belly, still domed high in the air. Her thick limbs slumped uselessly, bathed in a soft red glow. She was sound asleep.

No more diets

“Yup, I think we’re going to see a whole new Wanda after all this is said and done.” Janet said confidently, “Just you wait.”
12211313211213.title: No More Diets

choices: The superheroine world continues to fatten up
Long term rest has Janet bored and without exercise
122113132112132.content:
As part of her agreement in taking Wanda away from Avengers Tower to handle her problems, Janet had agreed to regular updates on the situation.
Thus far they had all occurred over comms but on this particular occasion her presence had been demanded to report in on how the rogue Witch was going.

Truthfully, it was less than simple...
Wanda had curtailed her eating since their conversation weeks back, even if 'curtail' was a loose term as the witch still gorged like a woman possessed but Janet's words had had some impact and, at least on a noticeable level, her weight had slowed its constant uphill climb.

Despite not being a total success though, Janet saw the situation as a win and was more than happy to report in person on how things were going.

*****

As Janet paced towards the shimmering glass doors and into Avengers HQ, her usual style radiating outward in a long jacket and boots, she couldn't help but smile at her perceived praise on how the Wanda situation had panned out.
With any luck she would be able to bring Wanda back into the fold and get back to work seeing as, as much as she was enjoying her 'me time', Janet found herself in some serious ass-whooping need.
Lost in her own thoughts though, Janet was abruptly torn from her dreaming as she crashed into someone crossing the foyer from inside.

"Oh jeez, I'm so sorry, I...Janet?" asked the soft voice of Pepper Potts, awkwardly shuffling the folders clasped in her arms that had dislodged from their collision.

"Hey Pepp, its so good to see you again!" beamed Janet as she helped nudge a folder back into the redhead's arms.

"You too! How is Wanda doing?" asked Pepper, finally finding control of her pesky paperwork.

Janet took a moment to recollect her positive thoughts on the situation.
"You know what, she is actually doing really well" nodded Janet, finding the answer perfectly satisfactory and within the realms of truth.

"That's so great to hear, will you send on my wishes?" smiled Miss Potts.

"I will" returned Janet as she cautiously glanced at the large wall clock behind her conversationalist "unfortunately though, I've gotta run, big meeting upstairs"

"Oh yes, don't let me slow you down!" mused Pepper, side stepping slightly to allow Janet through "maybe I'll swing by and see you girls some time soon?"

"That sounds great" smiled Janet as she slowly stepped past the redhead towards the building lifts.
Without hesitation Janet pressed the floor button she needed and stepped into the lift that was still there no doubt from when Pepper had come down, before turning round to see her friend off out of the building.

Her gaze was quickly drawn down though as she watched the administrator saunter out of the building, a rather padded rear stretching her skirt taut around her curving hips.
The sight shouldn't have been much of a shock to Janet, Pepper had always been a sharp dresser, but she certainly didn't remember the fiery haired woman being so...wide.
Come to think of it, Pepper had looked noticeably chubbier in the face as well but, before more thought could be paid to the situation, the lift doors closed and started the ascent up the tower.

*****

Assuming her memories were less than accurate, Janet stepped out of the lift at her destination and took off across the glossy floor, boot heels clicking as she went.
It felt good to be home again, walking the halls she was so used to walking, and couldn't wait to deliver her mission report on the Wanda situation, hope peeking just a little more that she would be able to come back to the tower and rejoin the rest of her friends and colleagues.

"Well well well, if it isn't The Wasp!"

Janet's lips curled in a small smile as the voice beckoned to her from behind, familiar even if the last it spoke to her was largely mockery.

"Come to apologise have you Jess?" called back Janet as she turned slowly on her heels to face Spider-Woman for the first time in weeks.

"Pfft, I haven't got anything to apologise for" smirked Jessica Drew "I thought you were the pizza guy so you basically owe me"

'Pizza guy?' thought Janet, her mind running just a little faster than her eyes as she glanced over her friend.
It seemed like the past few weeks had been...interesting for Jessica.

Last time they had seen each other, Jessica was as obsessed with the gym as ever and ever critical of Wanda's situation but now the female web slinger was looking like a smaller version of her target.
Clad in a vest top and scant booty shorts, Jessica had a soft tummy bulge escaping the tight dark material of her top and an indented belly button was visible through the material.
Her thighs were also looking thicker in a not muscular way and were putting her shorts under some stress.

"Well hurry up, Danvers is back and she's got some tales just for a change" cooed Jessica as she waddled off, expecting Janet to follow.
First Pepper had looked positively plump and now Jess didn't appear to have even seen the gym since they last spoke...
Things were getting a little bit weird now.

*****

"So get this, I'm off world-obviously-and this Kree chick gets well up in my face thinking she can take on Captain Marvel so naturally I've got to take this girl on" preached Carol Danvers to her audience, blonde locks and arms flailing around equally as she spoke, the appearance of Jess and Janet doing little to stem her flow.

"What they didn't tell me though is that they have this new trial by combat thing going on where a challenge between two women is basically a massive eating contest to see who lasts the longest" mused Carol, appearing to lick her lips slightly as she recalled the so-called challenge.

"Obviously I beat this chick no problem, but then everybody wanted a slice and well, things got a bit crazy..."
Breaking from talking, Danvers opted to go for a more visual display and, in one swift motion, unzipped her flight suit causing an unexpectedly large pale belly to bulge out of the front.

Hoping her face didn't betray her shock, Janet was even more surprised to hear cheers from the surrounding girls whilst Carol smugly posed with her pillowy belly squeezing free of the skin tight material held up by her shoulders, hands proudly placed on her thick hips.

Trying to filter the noise, and avoid staring at Carol's exposed figure, Janet caught a few familiar faces.
Alongside Drew, Jessica Jones was also in the room, lounging on a large sofa, with Hellcat occupying the other end.
Jennifer Walters aka She-Hulk was perched on the floor ploughing through a rather large pizza as the tale was told before her although her concentration didn't seem to break from her food.
The X-Men even had representation in the form of Jean Grey and Emma Frost who, although on opposite sides of the room to each other, both seemed to be enjoying Carol's tale equally.

Out of the corner of her eye, Janet also caught a glimpse of food rising from a side table and could only assume that Susan Storm was also in the room although her powers rendered her invisible despite her eating betraying her presence.

All in all though, the sight was quite odd as every single woman in the room was packing more pounds than Janet ever remembered any of them having and she couldn't fathom why, at least, for all apart from Carol.

"So I challenge any one of you here to beat me in this new-and awesome-trial, if any of you ladies dare!" sneered Carol playfully as she slumped down into a high backed chair, her belly filling her lap with her chest perched on top of the pale dome, still squeezing through the opening in the front of her suit.

The sentiment was met with laughter and cheers as every woman, including the spider variety who had now seated herself, dove into some food item or another.

This whole thing didn't seem right to Janet and, quietly, she snuck back out of the room and headed for the elevator to leave.

Before she could reach the doors though, they slid open to reveal another familiar, albeit younger, face in the form of Mary Jane Watson who had made a habit of coming by to visit Parker on occassion.
On closer look though, she had not been left out of the apparent fattening party that had swarmed the tower in Janet's absence as the redhead waddled down the corridor with a full pot belly stretching her shirt and a ripened rear to match behind her.

"Hey Miss VanDyne!" chirped the redhead, a hint of breathlessness punctuating her voice "is Peter in?"

Stunned at seeing the previously svelte girl so plumped up, Janet could only shake her head and mutter her lack of knowledge on the matter.

"I hope he is, I'm starving" groaned the girl, placing a hand on her softened middle as she spoke.

Janet could only weakly nod before beelining for the lift and hammering the ground floor key.
Something was seriously wrong.
122113132112132.title: Careful what you wish for

choices: Tell Wanda about the weight gain—it's not like she won't find out anyway
Better keep it under wraps—the last thing Wanda needs is to think about it
1221131321121322.content:
Janet was used to being the smallest Avenger—when your powers primarily consisted of shrinking, wings or no, you get a certain reputation for being tiny.

Not that her fellow female crimefighters were making it all that difficult.

Amidst chubbing bellies, widening rears, and inflating chests, Janet VanDyne was not only seemingly the sole exception, she was the only one who seemed to catch the correlation between everyone’s lack of willpower and the fact that they all seemed to be bulging out of their spandex!

Ever since she had been put on WandaVision, Janet didn’t visit the Tower much. It was easier to stay put and keep an eye on the Scarlet Witch—better yet, make sure that she didn’t stuff herself like a Thanksgiving turkey. The fact that everyone seemed to be acting so strangely lately only reinforced her sort of quasi-isolation. The Wonderful Wasp didn’t need to worry about her coworkers’ weights… well, except for one.

Ever since they’d had their little “talk”, Janet had been doing double time at their apartment in SoHo. Wanda was in a delicate place right now with her diet and needed a lot of support—which she certainly wouldn’t find at the tower.

”How is the ol’ double wide witch these days?” Jessica Drew snorted, leaning forward to grab another two slices of pizza

“I mean, I know I’ve let myself go a little…” Jessica Jones tugged the hem of her new leather jacket fruitlessly to the curvature of her belly, “But I had a baby.”

“Yeah, like two years ago.” She-Hulk laughed, “Tell you what Jan, if Wanda suddenly wants to change her name to the White and Purple Prestidigitator, she can have some of my old outfits. I’m, um… gonna have to size up.”

Janet wasn’t quite sure what was going on with everyone, but the thought of them all making fun of Wanda like that was enough to get her blood boiling. How could they all treat her like yesterday’s news when they’d been on a team together for so long? Janet would have liked to see any of them squeeze into last year’s costumes these days…

Ugh.

“Janet?” Wanda asked with a furrowed brow, “Is everything alright?”

“It’s fine, Wanda.” Janet snapped back to reality, “Just, uh… brooding.”

“Ah.” Wanda raised her head knowingly, “Hell’s Kitchen is that way, darling.”

If either one of them could have cooked, minding Wanda’s weight would have been a lot easier. Janet had never had to master the art herself (but she could spark a fire if your igniter was broken!) and Wanda had never been particularly enthralled by the subject. Magic had a way of giving you a penchant for instant gratification that didn’t lend itself well to standing in front of an oven.

As it was, takeout was their best option. Healthy(ish) takeout, but still takeout. And it was hard to justify not ordering a little extra since you were already having it delivered to your place—what even was the normal amount of food to order to your apartment for a superhero anymore? Living with Wanda had certainly put a new spin on Janet’s perception of portion sizes…

Instead of filling their apartment with food from all over New York, Janet had done her best to keep Wanda’s requests maintained. Nothing too greasy, nothing too fatty. Sandwiches, some Mexican food, and that new sushi place that opened up. Three courses of takeout was still a lot, mind you, but it was a good compromise between their two philosophies about the concept. If it were up to Janet, Wanda would have had a sandwich and some water—but pushing Wanda was something that had to be handled delicately.

After all, she’d already made some progress.

Small steps were important, but Janet felt like she was trying to box in the Juggernaut when it came to curtailing Wanda’s weight. The woman just couldn’t stop herself—every time Janet turned around, she was snacking on something. Where these endless trains of hot dogs and pizza slices came from was anyone’s best guess.

“Are you sure this is going to be enough?” Wanda made a face as she hovered a piece of sushi into her mouth, “You won’t be hungry afterwards?”

Janet chuckled—Wanda was so transparent.

“No, I’ll be fine.” She held her chopsticks artfully and plopped a fried roll past her lips, “And so will you, Wanda.”

Wanda’s disappointment was palpable.

“I am not a child, you know—I can manage what I eat on my own.” She said in a huff, eating a bit faster, “I am merely suggesting… perhaps ordering more for later?”

“Come on Wanda, don’t be like that.” Janet corrected mildly, “Besides, you’ve made so much progress! Three pounds in two weeks—those are good numbers!”

“I suppose…” Wanda ran one fat hand along the drum-tight blouse that caged her blobby stomach, “But we will be ordering dinner, yes?”

“Oh my god yes, Wanda, we’re gonna order dinner.” Janet laughed a little harder, dropping her next piece, “I’m not gonna starve you—you’re just on a diet!”

At the mention of the dreaded d-word, the scarlet aura of Wanda’s magic intensified. The food that she had been hovering shook dramatically in the air, their orbit around her quickening slightly. Her proud Romani features curled in anger, her brow furrowing in distaste. It wasn’t enough to make the apartment shake or anything, but Janet tried her best to keep Wanda happy about all of this. The minute she started to feel discouraged was the minute she started to head towards the fridge.

“Diets.” Wanda snarled, gnashing on her food, “Such a foolish concept.”

“Uh-huh.” Janet nodded placatingly, touching Wanda’s mile-wide thigh in a friendly way, “But a necessary one—you want to get back out in the field, right?”

“No, I want a pizza.” Wanda growled, her hair drifting upwards, “I want cookies and chili dogs and steaks and burgers—”

“Okay, okay, okay, calm down there Witchy-poo.” Janet intervened just as Wanda’s eyes began to flash red, “I tell you what—when we get you back down to two-eighty, we’ll go have a big dinner. Anything you want. Sound fair?”

Wanda paused, her powers dampening as she turned to her friend, roommate, fellow Avenger, and now dietician.

“Can we get ice cream after lunch?” she asked with that same serious voice

“Um… sure?” Janet offered helpfully, “One cheat day won’t wreck your diet.”

Wanda came back to reality, sinking back into the couch deeply. Her edible orbit resumed its normal pace, popping bites in and out of her mouth. She still seemed a bit upset, but Janet seemed to have mitigated the worst of it.

“I still hate diets.” Wanda grumbled like a child, “I wish we lived in a world without them.”

“Ugh, same.” Janet laughed, “But if you want to live in a world without diets, I should just send you back to Avengers Tower.”

“…pardon?”

Janet paused—where had that come from? She had done her best not to mention the Tower ever since they’d started rooming together, but the thought of barbing at her friends like that had been too good to pass up! Telling Wanda about their friends’ recent dietary mishaps might have done her some good—but it could have also made it look like Janet was just being mean about other peoples’ weight again. Didn’t want to make Wanda upset… again… so soon, anyway.

What was a Wasp to do?
1221131321121322.title: Porky Prestidigitator Progress

choices: What the heck—it's a girl's night, after all!
12211313211213221.content:
“Oh my God she’s huge!”

Telling Wanda about the fattening figures of their fellow femme fatale crime fighters may not have been the most mature thing of Janet to do. After all, they had all been teammates for years now, and they all knew how hard it was to hide extra pounds and inches in spandex.

But on the other hand, none of them had been especially helpful when it came to watching Wanda’s weight. None of them had even offered to check in on her! Janet had been doing this super hard job all by herself, while they all sat around getting fat and lazy… it served them right!

And besides, Wanda seemed to be having a roaring good time with it all.

They had gotten their ice cream—four quarts of the stuff—and decided on a girl’s night in. Janet relented and let Wanda order pizza (a “small” amount, only three pies) and they’d uncorked a particularly good wine made from grapes grown in Attilan. They’d turned the lights on low, synced up Janet’s StarkPhone to the smart TV so that they could enjoy the Daily Bugle’s negative press about their chunky coworkers in the way that they were meant to.

“Jumbo Jones v Janice Lincoln—” Janet read the headline in a dramatic voice, “Private Investigator and self-described “part-timer” Jessica Jones thwarted a robbery by the Beetle, better known as Janice Lincoln—

“Supersized Smackdown!—” Wanda took her turn, “She-Hulk, always having been something of a (snort!) “big girl” reached new heights and widths today after an astonishing display. After having rescued a local eatery from none other than Lady Octopus—”

“Bitten by a Radioactive Spare Tire—” Janet could barely get the headline out, “Spider-Woman showed everyone a new side of herself today after a self-described “spandex mishap” left her—”

Janet and Wanda were rolling on the couch, clutching at each other at the sight of their friends in such a sorry state. The pictures included were icing on the cake—none of them flattering, all of them looked huge!

Glancing over to Wanda, Janet had to admit that her friend was still bigger than most by a longshot. The weighty witch still had more than a few hundred pounds on some of those women in the papers. And the fact that she spent almost as much time eating ice cream as she did laughing, her large belly wobbling and her cheeks rippling at the expense of her fellow Avengers, it was enough to remind Janet that they couldn’t afford to have too many nights like this in.

Not unless Wanda wanted to be the next headline.

“Okay, that’s enough of that.” Janet rolled to her feet, belly full of ice cream and wine, “I’m headed to bed.”

“Are you sure?” Wanda asked quickly, “I think there is still some ice cream in the freezer?”

“No Wanda, I think I’ve had enough.” Janet burped, “Besides, it’s getting late.”

“But I’m having so much fun!” Wanda whined, “Just a little longer, please?”

“It’s passed midnight.” Janet winced

“And this will impede with your nine-to-five job in the morning.” Wanda raised an eyebrow, “We are effectively on vacation, yes?”

“…yes?”

“Then come and sit—just for a little longer.” Wanda paused before adding a particularly poignant “Please?”
12211313211213221.title: Hefty Heroine Headlines

choices: The Superhero Supersizing begins in earnest as Wanda's spell takes hold
Janet wakes up and feels... funny. Like something's not quite right.
122113132112132211.content:
For the third time that day, Janet relented.

Uncorking the last bottle of especially potent Inhuman wine that Crystal had given them as a homecoming present, Janet and Wanda managed to down the whole thing. A glass of the stuff had been enough to give Janet the giggles before she had been sweet-talked into staying up for “a little longer”, but with a half a bottle inside of her, the Wasp was officially off her rocker.

“I don’t understand how you’re still drinking!” Janet hollered uproariously, laying at a one-eighty on their couch, “Wanda you’re gonna diiiiie!”

For the first time in far too long, Wanda had been holding something with her hands. With her chubby fingers wrapped around the neck, she chugged the spicy Inhuman wine like it was nothing. The Wasp’s smaller stature meant that she couldn’t handle the majority of a bottle that had been left after her glass. Wanda had been happy to oblige—the other ¾ of the previous wine run already nestled deep inside her belly.

“My belly will absorb all of it.” Wanda said with a slurred smile, patting her big apron of belly flesh appreciatively “She is a good girl.”

“Your stomach is a she?”

“I am a she.”

Wanda ran her hands up the monstrous bottom roll of her belly as it rolled over her thighs and touched the leather couch cushions. Her milky-white mass dolloped on the couch, covering her impossibly thick thighs as they spread like sour cream across her seat. With her wobbling arms, Wanda hefted a portion of her prodigious paunch up, and let it crash down proudly.

“A big she.” Janet said woozily, “Oof. Wanda… you’re fat.”

“I am very fat.” Wanda said almost mournfully, her hands running in and out along the circumference of her corpulence, “I am the fattest Avenger.”

“Nooooo….” Janet sloshed over to hug her huge friend’s shoulder, “Honey don’t talk like that.”

“If Hulk can be the strongest, I can be the fattest.” Wanda bounced her hands playfully on the gelatinous surface of her stomach, “I am okay with it.”

Janet winced—in her drunken state, she was much less equipped to hide her distaste for Wanda’s figure. How could anyone be happy being so big? Being so round and jiggly? She was as big around as the Hulk’s chest, with none of the muscle. How could anyone have been happy being “the Fat Avenger”?

“I mean, you do you girl.” Janet poked her friend in the belly, losing her finger knuckle-deep in ivory-white pudge, “I mean, I’ll support you no matter what—but I don’t think I could do what you do.”

“What I do?” Wanda pulled away from her belly play in curiosity

“Sit around and eat junk all day.” Janet wretched, “I feel like I’m gonna bust as-is!”

The little woman grabbed at her stomach, rock-hard from her lazy day with Wanda. Letting the Scarlet Witch have her way was dangerous—all that woman wanted to do was eat! And Janet might have been good about it so far, but she’d never eaten two quarts of ice cream in one sitting before. On top of sushi. And a sandwich. And half a bottle of wine. While also having barely moved from the couch.

“Oh stop.” Wanda dismissed in a heady daze, “You had fun.”

“Mebbe a little. I kinna wish we could do it more offen.” Janet worked her way awkwardly to her feet, “Diets are so dumb—g’night!”

Janet VanDyne toddled to her bedroom and collapsed on her bed for the night. She was dead asleep pretty much as soon as her head hit the pillow—three in the morning wine nights weren’t exactly in the superhero’s handbook. Exhausted, sleepy, and more than a little drunk, Janet whisked herself off into a dream.

Completely unaware of what she had set in motion.

“Diets are dumb…”

The Scarlet Witch sat on the couch, pinned by her fluffy white stomach. She drummed her belly thoughtfully as her secret snack stash began to flow from the top cabinet in the kitchen. It glowed a bright red as it hovered over—chips, cookies, and small candies beginning their orbit around Wanda’s planetary body.

As Wanda’s hedonism took hold, enjoying a midnight snack before bed, she couldn’t help but picture a world where they could do this more often. A world where nobody had to diet. A world where she could eat whatever she wanted. A world where she could just eat and eat and eat…

Her hands began to rub sleepy concentric circles into the sides of her stomach. A low, breathy moan escaped her as her pillowy thighs clenched together.

Her last thought before drifting off to sleep was

No More Diets
122113132112132211.title: Third Time's the Charm

choices: With her hunger growing, Janet begins to slip
Janet and Wanda are summoned back to the tower
As heroes gain, so do the villains
1221131321121322111.content:
No More Diets

“Tony?...” groaned Pepper as she shifted in bed awkwardly before sitting up.

“Mhm, yeah Pepp?” mumbled Tony, blearily looking over his shoulder through barely open eyes.

“I’m hungry again...”

Tony sat up himself at this point.
“Again? I didn’t think you were going to stop eating at dinner” smirked the billionaire.

“Hey!” spat Pepper with a half hearted swipe at Tony’s arm “I don’t know why, I’m just REALLY hungry again”

“Ok, ok, what do you want?” asked Tony.
He knew he had to relent, Pepper had him over a barrel after nearly dying AGAIN in the line of duty so a midnight snack seemed reasonable.

“I don’t know, I...”
Before Pepper could finish her thought her stomach interjected with a loud growl.
“Ooph, just need something quick”

“Well how about you get dressed and we’ll see what this can get us at this time in the morning” smiled Tony, offering a reassuring touch to the redhead’s arm.

She smiled back before sliding out of bed and padding towards the walk in wardrobe.
As she walked, Tony couldn’t help but notice how much wider the redhead was.

Delicately grabbing in the dark before finding his ear piece and holding it to the side of his face.
“Hey FRIDAY, can I get a physical on Miss Potts please...incognito if you don’t mind”

No More Diets

The whole lounge was filled with deep nasally snoring punctuated with the odd breathy belch.

*BANG*

“Shit, whadda...who?” grunted Jessica Drew, empty wrappers bouncing clear from her body with her startled reawakening and one leg clumsily slipped off the coach.

“Musta fallen ‘sleep” grunted the spider lady as she fished through the remaining wrappers in arms reach, finding success in a cookie packet providing her with two double stuff Oreos.

“Need more food” grunted Jessica to herself after inhaling her prize instantly and finds her eyes drawn to the dimly illuminated kitchen.
Licking her lips, Jessica called upon her strength and clumsily hoisted herself to her feet.

Idly scratching her exposed stomach and trudging one thicker thigh past the other, Jessica hungrily lurched towards her quarry fantasising a little about what she was about to get hold of.

“Jess?” groaned Drew as she glanced over her friend and colleague whose rear was currently stuck up out of the fridge.

“Mhm? Wassat?” mumbled Jessica Jones, her mouth clearly full.

“Jeez Jess, you made me jump when you got in here” complained Drew, aiming for the cupboards instead.

“Mhm, sorrah” forced Jones past a mouth full of food before swallowing “I have cravings ok?”

Drew snorted “yeah, like Shulkie keeps saying, two years ago!”

“Screw you” muttered the PI as she pulled herself out of the fridge before tossing over a large tub of ice cream “besides, I’m hardly the only one to be so hungry lately”

Drew laughed.
“You’re not wrong gal”
The comment barely had a chance to stand before Drew had torn the lid from her ice cream and dove in.

“Mind you, it’s not just you and me” mused Jones, tucking in to her own tub “seems most of the women are...hungry these days”

“Maybe, long as I get my share” purred Drew, barely stopping to talk.

“Wasn’t quite my point” put Jones plainly, although her own pace didn’t falter.

“Never mind all that anyway” declared Drew, gliding past the conversation as it bored her “remember that trial by combat thing Danvers mentioned?”

“Yes?...”
Jones was cautious.

“Wanna give it a go?”

“You’re crazy” snorted the PI, delicately picking at her ice cream now.

“Sounds like you’re chicken more like” goaded Drew with a teasing smile.

“Pfft, scared of been caught in the blast radius of your next ‘spandex mishap’ more like” teased Jones in return.

“Oh you’re on now!” roared Drew before making double time on her ice cream, a euphoric mania spreading on her face as she ate.

Jones, although marginally more reserved, wasn’t far behind.

No More Diets

“Is that all you’ve got!” shouted Carol as she greedily guzzled strings of juicy meat from a rack of ribs of some beast she didn’t know.
All she did know was it was tasty and had helped her see off her latest ‘combat’ opponent.

The Kree girl in question was certainly built for the situation with a sizeable gut protruding in front of her but the thick sweat that had coated her cheeks early on had not improved as she sat breathing deeply to avoid being sick.

Sadly for the Kree though, Danvers experience in this new trial had been far superior.
Little did the current Captain Marvel know that she was rapidly climbing the Avengers ranks as one of their larger women.

After weeks of consuming calorie dense dishes in these so called trials of combat, Carol’s waistline and figure had ballooned into a bottom heavy temple of zaftig gluttony.
Carol loved it.

*BEEP BEEP - BEEP BEEP*

“scuse me people, duty calls” announced Carol as she swiped her communicator from her bulging hip “someone wanna grab me something to eat whilst I take this?”

“Danvers...BUUUUURP!”

“I can smell that from here” sneered Natasha Romanoff

“Sorry not sorry” smirked Carol, throwing a wink at the holographic display resulting in a sigh from the other end.

“Look Carol, I know you’re having fun out there but we could do with you being back home for a while...” started Romanoff.

“Oh I dunno Nat, kinda busy out here” rushed Carol, seeing a large platter of food being brought her way “lot of chaos in the universe just for a change and I, erm...gottago!”

“No Danvers, come...”
*BEEP BEEP BEEP*
“Damn it” cursed Romanoff as she tossed her comms down.

Taking a moment to pace, Black Widow strode to her bunk and grabbed her jeans.
“And damn you too” cursed Nat, staring the black denim down before sliding her feet into the legs.

This hadn’t been the first time she’d tried that day but Romanoff was determined.
Sadly the jeans were just as determined to not fit and her ass was far too plump now to even humour the tight denim.
With a heavy sigh, Natasha kicked the jeans clean off and sat down heavily.

“Well, can’t hurt now can it” muttered the Widow as she swiped up a doughnut from the half empty box before her.
She wish she knew what had caused this ungodly hunger lately...

No More Diets

It had been a restless night so far for Janet and she didn’t know why.
Sure, a few nights had passed and she had been having a lot of fun with Wanda lately.
She’d even allowed herself to indulge a little more than maybe she would normally do but it seemed to be the support that Wanda needed.

Now though, she was laid awake with her stomach churning angrily at 3am and it was infuriating.

“Come on Janet, it’s just a moment with all this temptation around...” muttered The Wasp to herself

‘It has been good to kick back though’ she thought

“True...”
She’d just answered her internal monologue...
“You’re losing it Janet” she concluded before forcing her eyes shut again in the hopes of getting some sleep.

It didn’t come though.

“Right, one more treat Janet and THAT. IS. IT” she hissed to herself before springing out of bed and quietly opening her bedroom door.

As soon as she opened the door a red glow flooded into her room.
Stepping out quietly, Janet knew it was just Wanda and her usual encirclement of floating food but it still gave her the creeps slightly.

Just for a change, Wanda was crashed out on the sofa with her great expansive belly on show for the world to see but Janet didn’t have time for that, she was hungry.

Sliding into the kitchen, Janet put the door to so as to mute any noise she made and started to scout the cupboards for something to eat.
It didn’t take her too long to come across a rare thing in the fridge; a leftover sandwich.

Leftovers were exceptionally rare, especially once Wanda started to sleep eat but Janet was grateful for the relatively light option this late.
As she plated the sandwich, she also caught a glimpse of some eclairs also left alone.
She Janet knew she shouldn’t but her sweet tooth was particularly demanding lately.

With an eclair on the side of her plate, Janet took a seat in the kitchen and began to munch on her snack delicately.
“Yes, this is just what I needed” smiled Janet, praising herself verbally.

Idly, Janet patted down her pyjama top to remove the creases and noticed it was slightly tighter than it once had been.
All this time with Wanda had caused her to gain a little weight and her stomach was particularly taut at this point.
She’d get back to her routine though and it’d all be fine.

*****

“Morning Janet, looks like you had fun” purred Wanda as she labouriously waddled into the kitchen.

Janet woke with a start, her back against a cupboard and her hand in a family sized tub of cheese puffs.
“Huh? What?”

Wanda simply laughed before floating a spoon towards Janet and used it to prod her in the stomach.
The coolness of the metal made Janet yelp and her eyes shot down to see a tight bulge of stomach pushing her top up to her chest and curving into her lap slightly.

“Oh no...”
1221131321121322111.title: It’s a kind of magic

choices: "I can't do it anymore!" Janet caves, giving into her base desires for FOOD!
"I... need to go for a flight." Janet panics and goes to clear her head
12211313211213221111.content:
Living with Wanda had not been easy, in many ways.

Aside from the recent changes she was going through, Wanda had never exactly been the most warm and cuddly person to begin with. Beginning your career in the “Brotherhood of Evil Mutants” would do that to a girl. On top of the fact that she could manipulate reality, had a supervillain for a father, and had one of the wackiest family trees this side of the Summers tumbleweed, Wanda’s insistence on keeping people at an arm’s length could be frustrating to a more outgoing people-person like Janet.

So imagine her surprise when Wanda had begun to warm up to her.

Believe it or not, it was true! Wanda Maximoff had slowly come around to Janet’s small, but ultimately meaningful acts of friendship. The somewhat cold, distant Romani woman (buried underneath a couple hundred extra pounds of flab) had finally come to see the value in having Janet around. The introvert had finally accepted the extrovert’s presence and, above all things, now wanted to share that friendship.

It was just that now, thanks to a peculiar shift in personality, Wanda’s idea of sharing friendship was food.

She had been doing so well in maintaining what counted for a diet to a compulsive-eating superhero! Janet had put her foot down and done her best to make sure that none of that junk she liked to stuff herself with would stay long in her apartment. Wanda had slowly, reluctantly, but surely realized that Janet only had her best interest at heart.

And it was then that Janet’s willpower began to crumble.

All of the sudden, out of the blue, she became barraged with intrusive thoughts that urged her towards indulgence. Cookies, cakes, pies, everything that the Id inside of her cried out for was suddenly becoming harder to ignore! Fine foods, delicious dining, and everything she wanted flashed behind her eyelids while she slept at night. The call to indulge was so loud, so strong, and so persuasive…

“Janet!” Wanda cried jovially, waddled with some difficulty across the hardwood floors of their SoHo apartment, “I am thinking about ordering some lunch. What are you in the mood for?”

Everything was the first thing that flashed behind Janet’s mind. That pizza place on 51st sounded wonderful. The sushi joint in Midtown was great. Lobster bisque with great big slabs of butter made her mouth melt at the mere thought! The poor size-shifting superhero could only buckle before the great barrage of mental images and smells pouring down her psyche as she quietly said

“I don’t know, maybe a pizza or something?”

“A pizza? Janet VanDyne ordering a pizza?” Wanda mocked with a rich belly laugh, one that sent her great dollop of stomach rolling with mirth, “Are you sure?”

“Yeah.” Janet bit her bottom lip, “With, um… with extra cheese? And maybe… ooh, and maybe some anchovies. I don’t know why, I’ve just got such a craving…”

Janet’s mind flashed with pictures of greasy, cheesy triangles. Lowering them into her awaiting maw. Loosening the belt on her costume. Bellies bulging. She needed more, more…

“I…” she hesitated, “I…”
12211313211213221111.title: Weight Watching the Wasp

choices: With her dietician now a fellow fat girl, Wanda is free to indulge
Wanda realizes that something is wrong, and she has to fix it!
122113132112132211111.content:
Suffice it to say that Janet did not simply stop at a pizza.

While she was on the phone ordering, Wanda kept whispering into her ear for little things that she’d like to have added onto their order. Another pie, for starters, so that they didn’t have to worry about not getting enough. Then breadsticks. Sauce. Garlic butter. Then another order of breadsticks. Then two pies, for leftovers (didn’t want to have to worry about cooking for dinner!) and somehow… somehow… this happened.

The apartment was filled with food.

Again.

From all over New York, as if Wanda herself had been in charge of the food run, all of the best places in town had been rung up and pilfered from their finest stock of fast food. Pizzas, subs, Chinese, the whole works was wrapped up tight in Wanda and the Wasp’s apartment.

“You are sure that you are okay with this?” Wanda asked, a proud Romani eyebrow fishhooked in suspicion at her friend’s behavior, “This seems a little excessive.”

“I mean, I’m not.” Janet’s big blue eyes couldn’t stop staring at the sheer size of the haul that they’d brought in together, “But, I mean… what’s one cheat day between friends?”

And as much as she hated herself for it, Janet couldn’t help but enjoy herself. Why shouldn’t she? She was on vacation! This was her reward for years of Avenger-ing! All the long, long years she’d put in as the Wasp, dealing with things like psycho ex-husbands, stupid squabbles between teams, Tony’s alcoholism and whatever the hell Silver Cyclone was doing with his crush with her these days. Skrull/Kree invasions—all of it was ridiculous!

And this, tonight (and only tonight, she promised!) would be her reward.

Her delicious, delicious reward.

Janet deserved this. The Wasp deserved this.

And as she ate, piggish sounds of enjoyment and arousal filling the apartment as she and Wanda indulged themselves, that thought kept playing in the back of her mind. As if on a loop. She deserved it. She deserved it.

“You deserve this, you know.” Wanda said breathlessly, coming up for air after having dived into her Chinese food for God knows how long, “Putting up with me as you have.”

“Oh… I don’t know about that.” Janet said modestly, her belly bulging underneath her pajama top, “I… I’m just being a good friend.”

“A great friend.” Wanda added meaningfully, “Helping get me under control must have been a lot of work for you.”

Janet’s chest swelled with undeserved pride. She had been doing a good job with Wanda lately. She did deserve a little treat. Just something for herself, every now and then. Not like those other Avengers. Not like Jessica Drew, that cow. Making fun of Wanda during her time of need. How horrible!

“Do you…” Janet clicked her tongue, her stomach still grumbling, “Want to see if we have some wine?”

“Dinner and wine?” Wanda snorted, her fat nostril flaring and making her look that much more like a pig, “Janet, I am surprised at you.”

“Oof… something to help…” Janet’s eyes glimmered manically, “Wash it down…”

Whatever had come over her, Janet was fully in its grasp. More food. More wine. Loose belts. No tight costumes.

No more diets.
122113132112132211111.title: Going Native

choices: Wanda heads to the Tower—maybe her fellow Avengers have noticed something's up?
Wanda heads to the Xavier Institute—maybe there's a psychic disturbance?
1221131321121322111112.content:
“I’ve got to say Witchy-poo, I have no idea where you put it all.”

A triumphant, window-clattering belch escaped the red-clad spellslinger squishing the couch beneath her. She raised on hand heroically and pat the rippling surface of her exposed, enormous stomach. She chuckled huskily, happily, as its great weight shifted slightly in her lap. She could feel the vibrations travelling up her arm and out into the widest regions of her girth.

“You know exactly where I put it all—“ she said in a short, shallow laugh, “Right here, for safe-keeping.”

The sheer amount of food that Wanda had eaten thus far acted as a mild deterrent for leaning forward, back into the fattening fray that was their lunch. After an hours-long breakfast, capped off by a comparatively modest takeout brunch, Janet and Wanda had taken every minute of their two-hour siesta to make as much room as possible for what would ultimately prove to be a rather impressive lunch in and of itself—one that left even Wanda a bit hesitant.

Her stomach acting as a great doughy sandbag, pinning her down to the couch under the weight of her copious excess flesh, the bottom-heavy mutant was very apprehensive about straining herself to lean forward for even more. Even with her telepathy, Wanda felt that she needed a bit of a breather.

At some point during the meal—probably before the button on her last pair of jeans shot off—Wanda’s stomach had swollen out from underneath the red sweater she’d struggled to pull down over her heaving heft. As she’d eaten herself to capacity, her belly had puffed up and up throughout the day until it was this angry white blob, pinning her down on the couch. Her fat, atrophied legs kicked to the side of her gullet as it distended outwards (having slowly pushed the zipper down to reveal her deep, cavernous belly button) Wanda was beginning to feel a bit full.

“You’re living the dream.” Janet scarfed down her pitiful attempt at keeping up (the second of three foot-long chili dogs for the evening) and phrased her complaint between bites, “I totally get it now.”

In the two weeks that Janet had suddenly (almost violently) become attuned to Wanda’s wavelength as far as remorseless gluttony went, she’d already looked to have gotten softer. The formerly svelte (aside from the fairly recent addition of a pot-belly) super hero already looked to be adding pounds and inches in a few key places. It wasn’t imperceptible, as of now, but Wanda didn’t doubt that if she continued as she had been, her roommate would become quite round in the near future.

All the more concerning—in these brief moments of clarity for her—considering that up until two weeks ago, Janet had been her most stalwart champion of dieting.

“You do?” Wanda raised a proud eyebrow, skeptical of Janet’s claim, “Enlighten me—why are we eating so much?”

“Because this whole superhero, tight costume, media coverage thing… it’s so stressful!” Janet declared confidently, kicking her feet up and rolling back into the sofa with a happy smirk as she chomped on the rest of her chili dog, “It’s so nice to just indulge yourself—you know?”

Wanda did know—all of what Janet had been saying was true. But that was not why she’d been overeating. Truth be told (long string of misfortunes that she called her autobiography aside) even Wanda wasn’t entirely sure what had turned the foremost member of the scantily-clad bathing-suit spandex club into “the Fat Avenger”. She’d simply gotten fat, she’d supposed.

And in another lifetime (perhaps, in one of the many alternate universes and futures) she might have simply accepted Janet’s answer as one different from her own reason to indulge. A reason to let go—far be it from her to suggest that there was only one.

But something about this… didn’t seem quite right.

“Quite, yes.” Wanda’s mind percolated on something other than food for the first time in far too long, those deductive skills that formed the superheroine’s most powerful tool in-costume having gotten rusty since she’d effectively gone into retirement, “Janet—what would you say if I said that I needed some air?”

“I’d say I wouldn’t be surprised.” The Wasp snorted, “You’ve barely left the couch since we moved in.”

Wanda winced. The fact that Janet had been holding back in her commentary about Wanda’s weight hadn’t become more apparent until Janet herself began to “let go”. The more time they spent together, the more time she got comfortable and identified with Wanda’s new outlook, the more Janet seemed to put her foot in her mouth.

If that was a position she could even do anymore.

“Yes, well…”

Wanda’s body glowed red as she used her Hex magic to propel herself to a standing position (her knees wobbled horribly—the added weight of her epic meal had thrown her off balance)

“I’m heading out for a bit.”

“Suit yourself!” Janet chirped happily from her (soon to be) permanent position on the couch, “Think about what you want for dinner, okay? I know you like that Chinese place in Hell’s Kitching. What’s say we order out?”

“That sounds…” Wanda’s stomach grumbled, having been conditioned to groan wantingly at the mere mention of food, “…excellent, honestly.”

Waddling towards the door (far too fat to use the skylight, she’d quickly outgrown it once they’d move in) Wanda huffed and puffed her way towards the elevator that led down to the lobby. As the door shut magically behind her, Janet could only lick her lips—a crimson glow flashing in her eyes.

“More for me.” She said with a greedily lick of her lips, opening her mouth wide to christen her third chili dog…
1221131321121322111112.title: Diet Disassembled

choices: Wanda indulges in lunch with a hungry Pepper Potts
Meanwhile, Janet has been enjoying her solitude feasting
Undeterred, but still well fed, Wanda seeks some magical advice
12211313211213221111121.content:
