“So Janet, just how do you manage to be the most successful fashion designer in the world now, keep that rocking figure AND run an extremely popular fashion vlog?”

“Well Janet” started Janet, slowly feeding a thick cream filled eclair into her mouth “it’s a difficult life balancing everything but I find a way”
A wide chocolate covered smile spread across Janet’s lips as she casually breezed over the question.

“Oh I’m sure, you are an inspiration to...”

“Janet! Are you interviewing yourself again?” came the laboured accented voice of Wanda.

“Oops, busted” smirked Janet as she watched herself inhale yet another eclair in her dressing table mirror before addressing Wanda.
“Sorry babe, it’s just fun to wallow in my own fame”

“Well if you want to wallow how about you get in here and wallow with me” came Wanda’s voice again with much more allure in her tone this time.

“Well how can I refuse such an offer?” responded Janet “besides, I’m all out of food in here and it must be time for some meal or another.
Janet planted her hands on the dressing table and pushed, a laborious grunt forced its way out of the brunette’s mouth as she got to her feet with a resounding chorus of creaking wood following her rear into the air as her seat relaxed without Janet’s weight balanced on top of it.

Wobbling slightly on her feet as she reacquainted herself with the entirety of her weight, Janet took a moment to look herself over in the mirror.
The portion of her that was visible in the mirror anyway.

With her plus sized fashion line taking off Janet was able to maintain her own personal style and today was no exception even if comfort did feature in the mix rather prominently.
Today’s ensemble featured a denim jacket deliberately designed to remain open whilst accommodating for the thicker armed woman, a cropped white shirt that was even more cropped on Janet’s figure and a pair of black leggings with yellow thigh panels with as much stretch as was possible.
Perfect for a woman with hips like Janet...

Looking in her mirror, Janet was met with a wall of flab.
Two thick belly rolls with a shapely belly button buried between them.
The under curve of her boobs was visible, stretching her white shirt tightly as her buxom chest hung towards her belly.
Almost mirroring, telltale pinch marks adorned Janet’s chest and around the circumference of her belly where a bra and leggings respectively bit into her soft figure.

And that was all Janet could see in the mirror.

Her hips were a sizeable distance beyond the wooden frame and the legging confined belly hang concealed any view of thighs that may have once made the mirror.

Janet van Dyne was fat
She was huge
She was ENORMOUS
And she loved it

“Jan! Hurry up otherwise *buuurp* you're gonna miss out” puffed Wanda.

“I’m coming” purred Janet, groping a palm of belly fat as she turned from the mirror and made for the door.
Wanda’s threat was hollow at best, the girls got a constant stream of food delivered to the apartment, but it was enough of a threat to get the pear shaped women to move at a reasonable pace for her.

“Ooph...I’m he...*pant*...here babe” panted Janet with her cheeks flushing red as she entered the living room, hips barely clearing the magically widened door as her vast arse cheeks wobbled wildly within the leggings containing them as each chubby foot heavily stepped forward.

“About time” huffed Wanda, swallowing heavily before flicking her wrist and sending a small mountain of food hurtling towards the sofa that Janet would eventually seat herself on...once she’d made her way there.

“Aww no magic feeding?” mused Janet as she lumbered one wobbling thigh past the other, causing more ripples of fat to surge through her enormous bottom half.

Wanda didn’t reply, opting instead to flick her wrist again causing a huge cheesecake to fly through the air and rest gently in front of Janet’s face, her nose dipping in the cream cheese.

“Urgh, you are the be...” started Janet as Wanda applied a smidge of magical pressure to the flying dessert, causing it to squeeze in on itself and slowly pour into Janet’s mouth.
A second glow snaked itself around Janet’s bulbous arse and lifted her just enough off the floor to allow her to glide to the sofa, thick bulges of ass fat hanging over the invisible shelf pushing her along.

As Wanda’s powers lowered Janet into her seat, the springs and frame groaned loudly under the brunettes great bulk.
Seated in the middle, the furniture began to bend slightly under Janet’s arse as the fashionista obliviously sucked in the cheesecake still pouring itself between her lips.

Wanda smiled as she watched her roommate come lover begin her next blind gorge, rapidly pushing the remaining cake into Janet’s mouth and watched with glee as her cheeks puffed out to accommodate the calories.

Meanwhile, the witch had barely eased her own pace as a line of doughnuts and waffles rode into her mouth on a stream of chocolate and syrup.
Having a girlfriend in the fashion industry certainly had its perks and, for the first time in a while, Wanda was able to be fully clothed which she enjoyed immensely even if her wardrobes didn’t last long.

With a red thick strapped vest top barely covering her belly button and a pair of tracksuit shorts tightening around her expanding thighs, Wanda was content to continue pouring food into her gut every moment of the day.
It certainly helped having Janet ogle her between bites as her spherical belly poured over the edge of her own sofa as her vest top failed to contain her to the sound of suffering furniture even more strained than the one that Janet was currently crushing.

*****

“So, how is the factory going?” asked Wanda, feeling the need to check in on Janet’s endeavours.

Janet swallowed before replying.
“Really well actually, which you should know given how things have changed around here” teased Janet before attacking her next fat jammed victim.

Wanda nodded, the wardrobe changes had helped after an awkward moment between the girls and an unexpected Vision who had come to check in, only to be met by the two enormous women sweaty from eating and naked as the day they were born.

“But seriously, it’s come together SOO easy, I can hardly remember how it all started” continued Janet, finding herself a box of ribs to demolish.

“Uh huh”
Wanda found herself unexpectedly nervous at that comment.
The Romani witch would have been lying if she said she hadn’t helped a little in so much as changing reality just a little to give Janet the infrastructure she needed to set up and implanted false memories in everyone’s mind...
But why should she not make use of her powers to help the one she loved where possible.
Stark did it all the time, it wasn’t Wanda’s fault that his super power was money...

“...besides, I’m gonna need some more clothes before long” announced Janet teasingly as she rolled her leggings down, allowing her already fuller belly to escape and settle on her lap with bulging love handles oozing over her hips.

“Oh really?” replied Wanda with a hooked eyebrow as she slowly twirled her fattened fingers, causing all the food in the room to rise around both women.
“Open up Waspy”

*****

“Ooph, I am...BUUUURP...urgh” groaned Janet as she cradled her ballooned belly in her hands.

“What’s that? I can’t hear you” cooed Wanda as she used her magic to tilt Janet’s head over the back of the sofa and started to pour food into her mouth again.

“Mhhhm...”
Janet wanted to stop as the force of food pressing in her belly was beyond uncomfortable but at the same time she really wanted to keep eating.
As Wanda watched Janet inhaling everything she sent her way, it became apparent that she was so full her belly was swelling outwards by the moment as her strained shirt rolled higher on its own.

“Wanda I...” tried Janet, a mix of arousal and discomfort in her voice before being silenced.

“Shhh, just keep...going...” purred Wanda as she increased her own feeding.

Janet groaned sexually as she watched Wanda pigging out, the witch’s own bloated stomach getting tighter by the moment.

Whilst Wanda maintained food, Janet simply sat back and indulged.
The room was filled with muffled grunts and groans as both girls got hot and bothered as the situation developed, calories flying through the air between the two expanding women, clothes shrinking, bellies swelling, emotions souring...

*CRAAAACK*

“Huh, Wanda? What was...”

*CRASH!*

“Wanda! Are you ok?!” shouted Janet, trying to look over to where Wanda was, too weighed down by her latest binge to move.

“Wanda?...”

The sound of laughter rose from the floor and, with an awkward flop onto her side, Janet managed to catch a glimpse of Wanda.

“Oh my god, are you ok?” asked Janet, concerned.

Busy laughing, Wanda was unable to explain that her binge had proven fatal to the sofa she was on, causing the seat to collapse leaving the witch’s massive belly resting on the floor whilst she remained on the cushions.

“That is so hot” whispered Janet as she looked over her girlfriend, her belly pooling on the floor and jiggling as she laughed.

A moment passed with Wanda’s laughter before Janet found her lips being parted around a foot long hot dog at the front of a long line of other dogs.
“Mhmph, oh yeah” groaned Janet, limply massaging her exposed belly as her bra joined the open air.
122113132112132211111211211121121.title: Busy bumble-wasp

choices: The team arrive on 616 and are shocked at what they find
Dr Weying’s symbiotic portal doesn’t work quite as planned...
Feeling a disturbance in her reality, Wanda reacts badly to the new arrivals
1221131321121322111112112111211213.content:
In a universe not so far away and a couple of jumps to the right...

“Sir, those wild readings we’ve been getting are getting bigger by the day” announced one SHIELD agent, hammering away at his holoscreen furiously as data poured in,

“Still?” grunted General Ross as he chewed on his cigar.

“Seems to be intensifying too” added a second agent.

As the female residents of Earth-616 were ballooning, Earth-21213 had been logging events as they transpired with increasing concerns.
As best as 21213’s SHIELD could with the drip fed data seeping through the walls of reality between the neighbouring universes that is.
The past few days had seen an increase in information though, as if reality was breaking down...

“Pfft, it’s a lost cause, bout time we drop this and call in the Witch to patch up those cracks where all this crap came through”.

“Shut it monkey! You aren’t my second to make wise cracks!” shouted the agitated general to the snickers of Hit-Monkey, laid back in a chair beside this universe’s head of SHIELD.

“Maybe not, but I don’t see how we’re gonna fix this” mused the primate, glancing over a screen as numbers scrolled by “we don’t even know what’s causing this or what EXACTLY this is”

General Ross grunted harshly but it did little to settle his uneasiness at the situation.

“It’s damaging reality Monkey and seeping into ours, whatever it is we’ve got to try something...”

“I know” asserted Hit-Monkey “that’s why I said get Maximoff to patch it up and...”

“Sir, urgent message for your eyes only” shouted an agent from the front of the command room.

Ross could only sigh his discontent, last thing he needed was a higher up chewing his arse out for this shit...

“Anything exciting?” called out Hit-Monkey from his reclined position.

“Maybe so” replied Ross, cryptically but with an air of urgency.

*****

“So explain this one to me again because you’ve lost me” quizzed Hit-Monkey as the pair made their way through the science quadrant.

“Wish I could” grunted Ross with determination in his voice “all I know is this scientist might have a way to back door us into 616”

“Interesting” muttered Hit-Monkey “completely bananas but interesting”

Approaching the lab that Ross had been instructed to go to, he pushed the doors wide open with the most enthusiasm he had felt since the whole thing started.

“Dr Weying, this had better be good” insisted Ross as he entered the lab.

“Please, Anne will be fine” replied Dr Weying “to put it simply, I have a way you can reach Earth-616 and investigate what is going on there”

“That’s impossible” muttered Hit-Monkey with his arms folded.

“Quite the opposite” insisted Anne, matching the primates pose “if you will just step back a touch gentlemen”

Obliging, the two agents stepped back as Anne moved to a control panel and, with a few clicks and an electric crackling, a black liquid disc rose into the air.
As the edges of the circle bubbled, a gap slowly opened from the centre like tearing fabric until it reached its full diameter and a soft glow poured out.

“Very clever doctor but I don’t see how this will help us” grunted Ross, less than impressed.

“Look through” urged Dr Weying as she went to open the drawer of her desk.

Ross and Hit-Monkey cautiously stepped forward together and peered into the opening.

“That’s...New York” announced Ross, glancing at the doctor who was now eating a chocolate bar.

“Yes” answered Anne between a mouthful of chocolate “but more importantly it’s New York on Earth-616”

“That’s not possible” gasped Hit-Monkey, still adamantly against what was being suggested.

“Oh but it is” declared Anne with a smile as she reached into her desk again, dropping the now empty chocolate wrapper “as it turns out, symbiotes are able to safely jump between universes so by using this...”

“That thing is a symbiote?!” bellowed Ross with a leap back, hand shooting to his gun instinctively even if such things had little effect on the parasitic aliens in the past.

“Please General, not in my lab” sighed Anne, far too familiar with field agents and their gun readiness “after some persuasion Venom here has settled down quite nicely and has been very helpful in this discovery”

As if agreeing to the sentiment, the portal rippled gently and an almost silent hiss seeped into the room which did not prove reassuring for Ross nor Hit-Monkey who had clambered onto a higher shelf to view from afar.

“Anyway, the crooks of the matter here is this; if you can find a team willing to participate I can get you to Earth-616 safely” continued Dr Weying with a proud smile on her face.

Ross took a moment to consider what had been said.
Science was not his forte as often as it came up in his work but the thought of risking 616’s problems breaking through into his universe...
Ross did not need a new Nick Fury turning up and making his job difficult but he certainly wouldn’t mind rubbing the bastard’s eye patch in having saved his arse.

“I’ll be in touch doc, make sure it’s safe!” declared Ross as he went to leave, Hit-Monkey happily in quick succession behind.

Anne said nothing as the agents left, turning instead to her equipment again and closing the portal down.
As the symbiote dripped closed and slunk back into its container, Anne put her third chocolate bar down with no inclination to pick it up again despite only a couple of bites remaining.

‘I have got to get to the gym once this is all over, we’ve got a bit plush on this experiment Annie’ pondered Dr Weying to herself as she patted her new chubby middle.

*****

“This is insane Ross, you’re suggesting putting some of our best people through a symbiote portal that may or may not work, all for a different universe that we owe nothing to” grumbled Hit-Monkey.

“Doesn’t matter Monkey, if it gets in here then we’re all in trouble” replied Ross begrudgingly “besides, I think we might just stand a chance with this team”

“Hmmmm, still don’t see why I have to go as well” grunted Hit-Monkey as he looked over the team.

In defence of Ross’s plan, he had assembled a pretty impressive team.

Taking leadership of the team was Roberta ‘Bobbie’ Mendez aka Captain America.
Subjected to super soldier serum and morally pristine, Roberta was everything that Earth-616’s Cap was, not to mention a formidable field leader to boot.

Fielding intelligence and espionage, Ronin.
Clint Barton had a much more...challenging life on Earth-21213 leaving him to fully adopt the persona of Ronin the assassin completely.
Following a nasty streak of vengeance and nearly losing himself completely, Clint had freely submitted himself for rehabilitation on The Raft and, now, was one of Ross’s most trusted secret agents.

As already suggested with a great deal of begrudging attitude, Hit-Monkey’s specialism has been employed *cough* forced *cough* onto the team, even if a chance in the field was very much to the primate assassin’s taste.
Cleaning his affects to settle his nerves, the monkey was perfect for such an obscure mission.

“Not a bad looking team...Dad” came a teasing voice.

“It’ll get the job done I’m sure” grunted Ross as his daughter drew beside him, thick red biceps pulsing as she crossed her arms.

“Good job you’ve put so much muscle on the team” teased Betty as she strode past her father to join the line up, giving Roberta an air cracking fist bump as she took her place next to the blonde.
After the failed experiment that had killed her boyfriend Bruce Banner, Betty Ross had been left permanently hulk-ified without the need for anger to fuel her powers.
Despite her reddened physique she found acceptance amongst the superhero community and had earned the respect of her father, even if all the chairs had to be reinforced to support her vast muscular frame when she visited home.

“Well, you all know why we are here and what the mission entails” began Ross, rolling into his briefing for the team in typical army fashion.
“We don’t know what you’ll be getting into but we do know that it could be dangerous over there and that means...”

”Hey guys, whatcha doing? You guys reading what I’m saying right now! What’s happening? Whut? Mission briefing behind me? Woooooooow!

“Ah shit, Lady Deadpool...” groaned Clint

”Argh guys, let me come, let me come!” shrieked the female merc with a mouth, bouncing on her toes with fingers laced together and a cheesy grin painted on her lips.

“For fucks sake” spat Ross

“Hey, reading people, tell them I can go, pwetti pweeeeeeze!”

“Ah come on dad, let her come” cooed Betty “at least she’s indestructible”

”Almost indestructible but sure, argh I’m nearly on a team!”

“Urgh fine, don’t fuck this up Deadpool” relented Ross.

”That’s LADY Deadpool mister! And thank you very much!”

Ross sighed before lighting a cigar and looking over his assembled team.
‘They might JUST manage this’ thought Ross as he puffed on his cigar

”OMG, I have the same hair as Captain America! I’m one of the cool guys mum!”

Ross sighed again.
‘Maybe’

122113132112132211111211211121122.content:
"And so, I'm in space, right? Nothing to do, almost giving up...so I bbbhHUUUARRPPP...Fall on the leader ship and I watched the damn thing crash down!"

Carol Danvers flung the crushed soda can in the air with a meaty arm, a blast of energy shooting from her hands and hitting the can, rocketing it towards a pile of pizza boxes on the floor. The blonde smirked, letting her gloved hands rest on her gut, and collapse back onto the groaning couch.

"Well, wasn't that an interestin' story, ladies? Hell, she even belched only twice."

Jessica, the spider one, snorted from the kitchen, a couple of claps came from the ladies in the living room, all sharing a good laugh and a few teases. Making the short haired blonde grow pink in her chubby cheeks.

"Laugh it up, guys. Besides, if our Drew over there doesn't get stuck somewhere, I'll lose my bet."

Carol blew a finger gun to Natasha, who in return, groaned with a slight smirk showing up.

Drew waddled over to Carol's couch, the ever so growing ass of her brushed against a few furniture, but didn't stop her as she finally took a seat in the crater next to the blonde. Letting the tray of burgers rest on her gut, Carol reaching over to grab some, wasn't until the fifth burger until Jess slapped her hand.

-----------------------------------------------

"I did NOT!" Bobbi Morse erupted into a giggle fit, tipping the beer can into her lips and letting it fall and roll off her breast.


"Look, it was me, Sharon Carter, and Natasha, and I just so happen to offer burritos an-"

"Боже мой, I didn't fart! That was my suit! I told you this, moron."

An array of laughs came from everyone in the room, body's wobbling and jiggling as the motion caused fat to quiver.

"Okay, okay." The redhead spoke, "Drew and Danvers over there, remember when she got stuck between one little Hydra door, Jessie?" The Russian teased.

"And then it took Carol to pull her out?" Jennifer exclaimed, the once ripped, green, shulk, was cracking open a beer can with a sausage like finger, guzzling it down and letting a burp slip out.

"In my case!" Jess' arm was thrown up, her wings flopping about. "Hydra always had bad maintenance, I mean, have you've seen Viper, lately! The green wanker is huge!" Her head was thrown back and she started laughing, everyone else joining in.

"Alright, ladies. I forget I still have responsibilities." Said Danvers, lifting her self up with ease from the couch, brushing off any crumbs on her skin tight uniform, and letting them roll down her rolls.

"Space doesn't save it's self, y'know? And this girl is still.....BHURRRHUNGRY." Carol grinned, the burp scent causing everyone in the room to pinch there nose, playfully throwing their trash at the massive blonde as she waddled away.

"Hey, Danvers, catch!" A burger threw across the room, and into Carol's mouth. "Thamks, dhrew." And off the Captain goes.

Everyone turned to Jessica when Carol left, even Jessica. The British spider biting into her burger with confusion, until her brows were burrowed.

"So, how long has it been." Bobbi snickered. "Think about a couple name yet?"

"Heyyyyy....I don't know what your talkin', about." Drew squinted.

"You, Carol, and maybe seeing each other. " Grinned Jones.

"Wh-"

"OH, COME ON." Groans left everyone's mouths, throwing pillows at the fat ass, and overall fat spider. "You two been friends for years, share a couch, go out way too much, and we see how you look at her ass." Natasha said.

Jessica was definitely took back from her friends thoughts, first she started stammering, until she grew frustrated and continue eating her burger.

"Well, ladies, think we found out power couple." Announce the shulk.

"Oh, fuck off."

------------------------------------------------------------

Jennifer rubbed her gut absentmindedly, letting her green hands fondle, grope, and smack her middle.

Practically every girl doing the same thing, some sleeping off the alcohol, some the food. A mixture of both, as burps left mouths, and costumes and outfits were tossed to the side, along with the empty wrappers and cans.

"Well, good morning te-"

"BHURRP."

Steve Rogers walked into the mess of sleeping fatasses, and simply walked out.

This girl's night? Pretty successful.

choices: The following weeks, Jess' routines of binging and laying around effects her.
Her best friend, Carol Danvers is back from earth and wants to see Jess!
The Avengers hold up an annual party at the mansion, Drew was obviously invited.
1243.content:
Jessica panted as she tried to get herself off the floor, eyeing the rubble and Hydra henchman's limp bodies around her. Her breathing was shaky, head pounding, nothing was feeling right at all. Finally up to her feet, the yellow sparks of venom blasts erupting from her tips, raising her arm to a certain silhouette, covered from the smoke that trailed from a nearby crash.

“Watch yourself, Drew.” She said, stepping out from the smoke, clad in green leather, and dark green hair. Viper, raising a gun like weapon towards the spider, wrapping her finger around the trigger.

“I said, watch yourself.” Viper demanded, as she pulled the trigger.
--------------

Drew woke up with a groan, after her fight with Viper and the rest of Hydra, she immediately returned to her apartment. The fight must've drained her, as Jess woke up with empty wrappers and bags all around her. Shifting her body, she sat up on her couch, letting the empty Oreo container slide off her shirt, with 'Avengers' written across her chest. “Christ..” She muttered, looking down to see the food baby that poke out from under her shirt, placing a hand on the soft bump where her abs were supposed to be. Knowing it'll go away eventually, Drew forced herself up, stepping over the mess her binge left behind, making her way straight to her fridge.

It was almost empty, which she wasn't suprising at all. Reaching in, Jess grabbed hold of the last beer can from her supply. Popping it open, she raised the can to her lips and started downing it. Her alcohol immunity did nothing, meaning she could drink gallons upon gallons of beer, wine, whatever had alcohol in it.

She sighed, wiping her lips when a bare arm and crushing the can in her hands, barely making the trash can as she tossed it. Walking back, her stomach began groaning, almost bubbling, stopping in her tracks, Drew clutched at her noisy stomach. “What..did.. Viper do to me.” She mumbled, before cocking her head to the side to let a deep, rumbly beer belch escape from her lips.

“..BHUUUUURPPPP!!”

“Just gas I hope.” She sighed,t hat was a relief, at least in her own point of view, she thought. Drew snorted a bit, giving a pat to her gut. Wincing a bit as her stomach was stiffed and bloated from her latest consumption.

Finally returning to take a seat on her couch, sinking into it, a hand resting on her gut, rubbing it softly as her free hand pulled out her phone. A growl disturbed the peace, Jess already knowing her metabolism went through everything she's ate all day, and started wanting seconds.

“All right, all right, I'll order some pizza.” Drew huffed, sounding defeated, dialing up the nearest restaurant.

“Can I order three large meat lovers? Yes, you heard that correctly.”
1243.title: Caught in venomous hunger.

12432.content:
"Seriously, Jess, are you sure you're okay?" she asked. "You look terrible."

"Thanks," Jess replied, taking a deep swig of her milkshake.

Carol Danvers, more widely known as the mighty Captain Marvel, could always be trusted to be frank and upfront, mostly owing to her background in the Air Force, a former editor for the Daily Bugle, and as an Avenger. It was a quality that one would either deeply appreciate or be irked by, with really no in-between. For Jessica Drew, it was currently a small price to pay for being able to see her best friend again after her three-month stint in space with the Guardians of the Galaxy.

"Sorry," Carol said. "Still, Hydra's no joke, and you usually recover faster."

The two had met for lunch at their favorite burger place within walking distance of their respective apartments.

"The important thing is that I stopped whatever it is they were planning," Jessica said with a shrug. "At least for a while." She hungrily reached for her burger and took a generous, famished bite.

It'd been about three days since Jessica's rough-and-tumble brawl through Viper's facility. She'd spent the intervening time laying low and recovering — which also involved more visits to this particular establishment than she'd perhaps care to admit.

"You think they'll be back?" Carol asked.

*MMF* "Probably," Jessica said through a mouthful of beef. "Viper's in the wind, and she's probably regrouping as we speak." Jessica took another chomp from her and moaned. "I love this burger, it's so delicious..."

Carol gave her friend an incredulous look. "That's your third burger today."

"So?" Jessica said, washing her meal down with a draught of milkshake. "Girl's gotta eat."

A meal like this normally would've left Jessica feeling stuffed to the brim. But, much like she found herself feeling after consuming three large meat lover's pizzas on top of God knows what else, Jessica didn't feel "full" so much as "not as unbearably hungry."

"Well..." Carol suddenly became bashful. "I, uh, didn't want to say anything, but..."

Ever since that night after Hydra, Jessica's appetite had surged to unparalleled heights. At this point, Jessica couldn't actually remember the last time she felt satisfied. As she finished her burger, she strongly considered ordering a fourth, despite the round little food belly bulging from her core.

Which brought up the issue that had been tugging Carol's mind since reuniting with her best friend:

"You're getting kinda... pudgy."

It wasn't as though Jessica had put on a ton of weight. She just seemed a little softer overall, with less muscle tone and a bit more roundness to her overall figure. Carol estimated Jessica had put on about 10 or 15 pounds, with her belly in particular having taken a generous portion of the gain, not quite being contained by Jessica's top. Carol figured it was really only noticeable to her since they hadn't seen each other in so long. What Carol didn't know was that just a few days ago, Jessica had been as fit and built as ever, and eating far less gluttonously than she was right now. Perhaps 10 or 15 pounds gained over three months would be understandable, but three days was a completely different story.

Even still, Jessica was indignant nonetheless.

"My potentially gaining weight has nothing to do with me still being hungry," Jessica said. "Besides..."
12432.title: Catching Up with Carol

choices: Jessica and Carol end up ordering several more helpings before leaving
Before the two can finish, a super villain appears!
As they continue eating, a familiar face shows up.
124321.content:
"...you're looking kinda pudgy yourself."

Carol was taken aback somewhat. She open and closed her mouth a few times. "...No I'm not." She said.

The denial was weak. Jessica knew it and in all honestly, Carol knew it. She gained a little. Her stint with the Guardians of the Galaxy had left her exposed to all kinds of dishes from the stars that she'd never dreamed of. Some of them had been good. Others, not so much. But she'd never know until she'd tried them. Three months later and this was the result.

Now, she wasn't fat by any means, just softer. Her pants were a little more snug than they used to be and her hard cut physique had softened ever so slightly. One could hardly noticed and given Carol's level of strength, it most certainly hadn't effected her physical performance. Yet, if you had known her before her recent acquisition of adipose, like Jessica, you'd would have seen the differences in the Captain.

"If you say so." Jessica shrugged, smiling a little in victory before taking another generous bite of her burger.

Carol gave a defeated huff before doing the same and digging into her own food with gusto. She wasn't sure why, but she suddenly had this small gnawing in her stomach. It was probably nothing, she assured herself. She'd just missed the taste of classic Earth cuisine.
124321.title: No room to talk

choices: ... Jessica and Carol's hunger returns with a vengeance.
... Jessica has a run-in with Cindy Moon, who starts feeling peckish.
1243211.content:
The conversation surrounding Jessica and Carol's respective "potential" weight gains was dropped shortly thereafter. Neither of them was ready to acknowledge the flabby starter guts they were growing, nor were they going to point them out to the other, so there was no reason to continue along that thread. There was a little voice in the back of Jessica's head that was concerned how Carol had noticed any sort of change, but that voice was easily drowned out by the deluge of delectable desserts Jessica began devouring.

And what a deluge it was. While Jessica didn't end up ordering that fourth burger after all, it had less to do with her hunger being sated so much as her cravings skewing more sweet than savory. Finishing her milkshake left her feeling like she wanted another, which got her thinking about getting some ice cream, and y'know, a brownie or two would go great with all of that, plus this restaurant had a deal where you could get a free cookie if you got a combo, and ooh, it'd been a while since she's had a slice of pie from this place...

Dessert was a veritable feast in and of itself with an order like that, and Jessica would've eaten all of it by herself had it not been for one factor: Carol Danvers.

Carol, for her part, wasn't as hungry as Jessica. And though she hadn't gained a lot of weight, she did still need to get back in shape. Even still, three months was a long time to be away from home, and the pie here was really good. Surely, a slice couldn't hurt. And, ooh, that ice cream looks really good, and, hey, what's a better combo with pie than a scoop of vanilla? That brownie might be pushing it, but it looks really tasty. Maybe just a bite. Or two...

And so on and so forth.

The two friends barely exchanged a word as they ate, other than Carol occasionally asking if she could try something. Their bellies grew fuller and rounder, stretching to accommodate the sheer volume of their desire, until at last, the dishes had ended and their cravings had waned. Jessica and Carol hugged each other goodbye, careful to make room for their engorged and sensitive midriffs, before heading back to their respective homes, their thoughts drifting to the pleasures of the meal they just had.

***

Later that night...
1243211.title: ... And Making Room For Dessert

choices: A few days later and pigging out is becoming routine for both Jessica and Carol
12432111.content:
As Jessica lounged on her couch, gently nursing her relatively stuffed gut with her hand, her mind drifted back to her and Carol's time at the restaurant.

As much as she hated to admit, Carol had had a point: she was getting pudgy. Jessica had never really pigged out before. Too many things going on in life what with HYDRA, S.H.I.E.l.D., the Avengers, you name it. Honestly, the tightrope that was her life had given her little in the way of...letting go? Relaxing? It was an odd sensation, freeing in a way.

"...But I can't keep doing this." Jessica said to herself, as if stating out loud would have some effect. She prodded her stomach with a finger, feeling its taunt surface. "I was recovering, I was taking a break. If keep doing this, I might as well start calling myself Pig-Woman..."

Then it hit her. Like a ton of bricks. Jessica other hand flew to her belly as it gave an audible rumble before clenching! Jessica gasped at the pain. It felt like her stomach was trying to tear into itself. Like...like...like she was still hungry?! But that wasn't possible, she'd eaten a small feast fit for a family earlier. So why would she be feeling like this?

It was that moment that it came to her. She'd eaten a lot of desserts. Yes, she had also a good deal of burgers as well but maybe, she had needed more? Jessica was aware that some people experience cramps or stomachaches if they tried to substitute real food with junk if they were hungry. That had to be what happening now. It was the only that made sense to her at the moment. In reality, a small part of Jessica's mind knew that this was an excuse. She'd eaten more than enough to satisfy any hunger she may have been experiencing. Yet this more reasonable, rational part of her mind was drowned out by the larger part that simply wanted to excuse Jessica's newly developing bad habit.

So, it was not surprising when Jessica reached for her phone and quickly dialed the number to an inexpensive yet decent Chinese place that she was still open, her earlier resolve forgotten just like that.

"Hi, I'd like to order General Tso's chicken, egg foo young, and three cup basil fish, all with white rice and side of egg rolls and pork dumplings...Actually, double that...Yes, for delivery."

===(With Carol)===

Carol gave a relieved sigh as she finished up a report. All in all, she considered this a good day. She and Jess had gotten to hang out, even if that had turned into an impromptu binge. Heck, she could still taste the food on her lips. But if Carol was being honest, while the burgers, fries and the desserts had been nice, she could have really gone for a pizza. A nice, big pepperoni deep dish pizza. That sounded...delicious.

She knew she really shouldn't, but who was gonna know? Besides, it wasn't like she wasn't super strong. She'd just work it off later, like she already vowed to. Her stomach gave a small rumble in agreement and that was the push Carol needed. Before she knew it, she was ordering online.

'Extra large pepperoni, come to mama!' Carol grinned.
12432111.title: Late Night Cravings from Hell

choices: ... Jessica was sporting quite the potbelly.
124321111.content:
"Come on..." Carol grunted as she struggled to get her jeans up past her thighs. "Fit!"

Three months in space had opened Carol up to a galaxy's worth of cuisine. The mighty Avenger could always look forward to encountering a diverse and rich medley of cultures, and this latest stint had been a rather delicious example thereof. It had also made her quite homesick for the delicacies of home. Absence, after all, makes the heart grow fonder, and the fastest way to Carol's heart was through her stomach. And so, having now regained easy access to all of her hometown favorites, Carol's first week back home quickly turned into one of nigh unrestrained indulgence.

Indulgence, however, has a way of catching up with you. Carol's time with the Guardians had already left a lasting impression on her figure, and despite her promises to "work it off later," Carol really didn't intend to do anything her first week back other than get comfortable. Late-night deep dish pizza went from a one-night treat to a dinnertime staple, often joined by a few beer or a pint of ice cream -- sometimes both. Carol had even taken to ordering seconds with the rest of her food, such was the scope of her hunger. Typically, "seconds" would just mean a second pizza, but lately Carol had taken the opportunity to sample the takeout menus of the various restaurants located in the heart of NYC.

It shouldn't come as a surprise that Carol was currently having difficulty fitting into her clothes this morning. As her culinary palette expanded, so to did the softness that had accumulated around her waistline. Not a whole lot, to be sure, but enough where her wardrobe was starting to highlight the changes to her figure. For instance, when she was finally able to get her jeans buttoned up, a little sliver of belly pudge now oozed above her waistband.

"Screw it," she said, stripping off her jeans, "I'll just wear some sweats."

***

Across town, Jessica Drew was having similar issues. The primary difference was that her weight gain was far more noticeable and far more rapid than Carol's. Hell, the last time she'd met up with Cindy Moon, the hero known as Silk had mistaken her for being pregnant, and that was only two days ago! It seemed the more time passed after her encounter with Viper, the worse Jessica's appetite got. By now...
124321111.title: A few days later

choices: Cindy keeps her lips shut, for now.
12432112.content:
"Haven't I fed you enough?" Jessica sighed, placing a hand onto the bump that grew from her middle, patting it slightly as it growled in hunger. "Fine then." She responded, with a slight growl in her voice, "But you better not make me late." Great, she was talking to her self now, unless her gut growling back as her counted as a response.

---- Later -----

"She's practically our mom."

"I know."

"A big sister almost."

"I know."

"Well, anyways, have fun, chica!"

Cindy Moon sighed as she stuffed her phone into the pocket of her jacket, keeping her head up through the busy sidewalks of New York City. She was used to seeing all these people, after being in a bunker for years in her life. And being a part of the spider-verse, it all seemed stressful, but Cindy managed. There were her fellow spiders, friends, and nothing seemed to get in her way.

Except the growling that erupted from her stomach. "I did skip breakfast today." She mumbled to herself, scanning the sidewalk for any cheap, cheap and horribly unhealthy food stands on the corner.

"Bingo." She quickly made her way over towards a stand, letting the different cooked foods make their way towards her. Their seemed to be a lot of choices, there wasn't even a hint of greens anywhere, which she really didn't mind. Ordering herself a sandwich, packed with cheese, meats, condiments, and who knows what type of bread it was made of, Cindy took a large bites out of it. Letting the different flavors make their way into her body.

"Mm.." She gave a relaxed sigh, taking was last big bite as she continued her walk. "Wait." she panicked as she pulled out her phone, checking the time. "Oh, crap! Late! I'm late oh god, she'll let it slide, right?! Oh, cra--"

"Cindy? You okay, girl?" A voice called out, a familiar voice, full of snarky sarcasm and British. Jessica Drew walked out of a cafe with a coffee in her hand, wearing a red jacket and a simple T-shirt. Taking a sip, she raised a brow. "No hug?"

"Sorry, sorry!" Cindy walked up to the elder spider, giving her a quick hug, as Jessica hugged the girl back. Cindy's eyes squinted, as she looked down slightly and noticed the new belly Jess had that touched her flat middle.

Then it her like a truck, Jessica was!

"You going to finish that?" Jess asked, pointing at the sandwich. Cindy gave a quick nod, passing over the sandwich to the garbage disposal of a spider, immediately sinking her teeth into the meaty sandwich.

Cindy's head filled with thoughts and questions, as well as she grew hungry again, knowing she won't get her sandwich back. Belly bulge? Cravings? Horrible sense of fashion?

"She must be....."

132.content:
She Hulk looked around for cop. They'd probably need a forklift for this one...

"Mrs. Hulk?"

She looked down to see a swarthy guy with a white apron and a Mets cap.

"You saved my cart from that Blob guy, I reckon you earned yourself a free hot dog."

He held up a wiener with all the trimmings, swimming in ketchup and mustard.

She was about to say thanks, but no thanks, when she felt a little pang of hunger. Guess that fight had taken a little more out of her than she thought.

She took the proffered frank and chomped it down in three bites.

"Mmm..." she groaned, her mouth still half full, "Thash really good."

"Can I put your official recommendation onna cart?"

She Hulk smiled, licking her lips. "That depends. Can I have another?"

In the end she put away half a dozen more, including two while she was giving the details to the arresting officer, who didn't look impressed when a little glob of ketchup flew out of her mouth and landed on his notebook.

When she returned from lifting the unconscious mutant on to a hastily requisitioned flatbed, she just saw the hotdog guy hastily wheeling his cart away.

"Hmph" she thought, letting out a small burp, "Ingrate."

The jade giantess decided she better head back to her office. The emergency call had been a nice distraction, but those briefs weren't going to write themselves.

She cut down Broadway, not even noticing the stares as she strolled down the street. Those hotdogs had really hit the spot, even if she had gone a little overboard. She shrugged, her hulked out metabolism could handle it.

In fact, it could probably handle a few slices of that pizza, she thought, sniffing the air. Only problem, her costume didn't have any pockets, so she didn't have any money. She could order one when she got back to the office.

She picked up the pace a little. Maybe a meatlovers special. Or two.

***

The next morning...

1321.content:
Martha and Edgar Frobert were just another couple of tourists visiting the Big Apple. They were hoping to see a Broadway show, see the Statue of Liberty, see the historic spots where exterior shooting happened for "Home Alone 2", but most of all, they were hoping to see a real live superhero. Wisconsin hadn't had an honest-to-goodness superhero sighting since that time Squirrel Girl came to the Dells to ride the ducks.

"Look, Ed!" Martha cried. "Isn't that the, the, the who's that?"

"She-Hulk!" Edgar yelled back, eyes fixed on the massive green woman charging down the street. "Musta got sight of one of them Doctor Dooms and such what they've got here. Now we'll see somethin' worth seein'."

"Ain't she just goin' into a buffet?" Martha observed.

Edgar shrugged. "Must be someone worth fightin' in there. Some baddie'll come crashin' through the front window any time now, mark my words."

-------

She-Hulk was inhaling her fifteenth plate of Chinese food when she felt the tap on her shoulder. She turned to see a familiar mask looking down at her.

"Planning on leaving any of that for General Tso?" Spider-Man asked.

She-Hulk shrugged. "Hey, if he didn't want to eat it, he shouldn't have made his chicken so good. Care to join me for lunch?"

"No thanks. You might say I'm here on business."

The emerald-skinned titan glanced around the restaurant. "Don't tell me we're going to have to fight."

"Believe me, I sure hope not."

"Thank God," She-Hulk sighed, patting her swollen middle. "I don't like brawling on a full stomach. So what's the old spider-sense going off over today? Bank robbery? Arson?"

"Er--I guess you'd call it petty theft." She didn't quite know how he managed to look sheepish through the mask, but he did.

She-Hulk glanced around the room again. "Who?" When she looked back, Spider-Man's finger was point squarely at her face.

"Me?" she said indignantly.

"All right, so it's not exactly a brawl with Doctor Doom, but your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man has to stick up for local small business, too."

"Hey, I paid for this lunch, buddy."

"Yeah, and you paying once for an all-you-can-eat buffet is about as fair as me entering a rock-climbing contest. Sorry, Jen, but hulking out before you eat here is practically stealing."

"Practically," She-Hulk said. "But not legally. Anyway, I didn't... uh... exactly mean to come like this. I just smelled the sweet-and-sour on the wind, and I...er... I guess I changed without thinking about it."

She shrugged. "Anyway, I certainly can't change back now, unless you want to see me lose my lunch. Little Jen doesn't have the stomach for this much food."

"Lady, Henry the Eighth didn't have the stomach for that much food."

She-Hulk pulled out her checkbook. "Fine, so I'll pay for another meal or ten. I can afford it. Happy?"

"Just paint me yellow and call me a smiley face."

She-Hulk slid out of the booth. Oof, how much did I eat? she thought with a groan as the contents of her stomach shifted unpleasantly. She hadn't realized how stuffed she was until she had to stand up.

"Uhm, Jen..." Spider-Man said. She-Hulk looked down at the booth. The cushion where she'd been sitting had been smashed flat, the springs jutting out brokenly at odd angles. "Oops. I thought something felt a little pokey."

"Jen..."

"I know, I know," She-Hulk snapped, tearing off another check. "This is turning into one hell of an expensive lunch, you know that?"

Loki was completely baffled. His spell was supposed to make her fatter all over when she saw an ad for food. And yet, only Jen's belly had grown. It was about the size of a basketball. Everything else was the same size. He couldn't understand it. Did he cast the spell wrong?

It was around this time that Jen looked down and saw her gut. She was shocked.

"What the hell? When did this happen?" She asked. She poked her stomach in confusion. It was soft.

"Well, I'm not pregnant, so there's that." She said. "I need to sit down, think this through."

She sat down in front of her TV and turned it on. A commercial for restaurant Balthazar was on. When she saw it, she felt her stomach grow. Now it was the size of a small beach ball.

"Is that it?" The Jade Giantess asked. "It grows when I see food ads? Odd."

Through all this, Loki was watching in a combination of annoyance and intrigue. He was annoyed his spell messed up, but was also amused. Maybe this will be funnier. He decided to see how this would play out.

15.content:
"Ugh! I feel terrible!" Mary Jane grunted as the first rays of a morning tickled her eyelids, causing her to finally wake up with a mighty sneeze. "Anyone saw the number of that truck?" In reply there was only silence, save for the purring of a cat.

...A cat? MJ never had a cat, or did she? In fact, now that she thought of it, she did remember a cat - her own and only constant companion...

...Wait, that sound even more wrong - now MJ finally opened her eyes and sat up - or tried to. Her body felt too heavy and foreign for some reason, and her vision felt somewhat restricted, even half-blind and blurry...

Feeling a rush of panic coming upon her, MJ flailed around (feeling like a beached whale for some reason) until she finally found her glasses and put them on.

"What the-?" the first thing that MJ saw was her hand and arm, hugely bloated with fat, toppled with five sausage-like fingers. Her heart sinking in her chest, MJ looked at her other arm - same thing. And that was not all - her neck felt rather stiff, and her breasts... were huge, EEEEE cups, protruding forwards like a cupboard shelf, nesting comfortably on a massive gut that clearly obscured her legs.

Very, very slowly - never before had MJ felt so heavy and out of shape - the redhead stood up, feeling exhausted just by that simple action... and for good reason. She was huge. Her hands and arms were only the tip of the iceberg, as for her 5E breasts, terminating in cookie-sized niples. Everything beyond and below them was a simple masss of fat flesh - MJ basically didn't had a waistline, her stomach grew right at the torso and dropped, apron-like, around the knees.

The knees, for their part, were located in a pair of tree-trunk legs, which, just like the arms, were covered in slabs of pale skin and flesh that smoothly became cellulite on the buttocks. The buttocks, just like the backside, stretched far out and provided a sufficient counterweight for MJ's oversized gut.

Finally, the redhead's face too was filled with fat: multiple chins and jowls obscured her neck to a point where her head looked like an egg positioned on a bed of fat, with a pair of eyes that were almost slit-like in their shape (the spectacles positioned on MJ's nose didn't help any either). Really, the only thing that remained from the old Mary Jane was her shoulder-length red hair, and even that had a somewhat faded look, now that MJ took a good look at it...

Suddenly a wave of fatigue came over the redhead, as she teetered and almost fell face first onto the dressing table next to the mirror (into which she was looking for the past 5 minutes or so).

"Ms. Watson?" Still feeling weak, Mary Jane heard the sound of a door opening behind her. "Are you all right?"

154212.content:
A group of superheroes were battling the super villain team known as the Serpent Society. These heroes were Colonel America, Iron Man, Thor, the Bumblebee, Wolverine, and Spider-Man. The team were fighting off the snake themed villains and trying to protect the innocent civilians in the area, when Colonel America began barking orders.

“Alright Avengers, let’s finish these guys up before the fight gets out of hand.” the Colonel stated before slamming his shield into one of the Society’s faces.

“These guys are the Avengers?” Mary Jane questioned the groups name. The name definitely belonged to a superhero team, but these guys felt slightly off. Their was never a bumblebee superhero, or was there?

“Come on Steve, these guys are second rate, we’re the Avengers for gods-sake.” Spider-Man said nonchalantly, webbing another member up. Hearing the name Spider-Man out loud hit MJ hard, and triggered a memory. She remembered Spider-Man taking his mask off and seeing his face, and it was a familiar one.

“Peter!” Mary Jane yelled out into the battlefield. Spider-Man looked back at her, and even through the mask MJ senses confusion. Spider-Man leapt toward her on a web line and swung her up to the top of a nearby building. Spider-Man let the fat woman go, as MJ had to readjust her glasses.

“I have so many questions, such as how you know my real name, but my biggest question is why do you look so familiar.” Spider-Man asked. Upon further examination, MJ noticed differences in his suit than the one she knew. It look unfinished and the eyes were yellow instead of white.

“I think the world is really messed up Pete. I’m not supposed to be this fat, and I know we know each other.” Mary Jane asked while pulling Peter’s mask off, revealing the same face she knew would be under the mask. His face showed signs of confusion, and he ultimately...
154212.title: Avengers Assemble!

1542121.content:
Spider-Man sat down on the roof, looking over the city. MJ waddled next to him, and sat her gigantic butt down next to him. He looked at her and his eyes were full of confusion and sadness.

“I didn’t believe it when she told me, but two people having the same kind of vision, what are the odds?” Peter said, both to MJ and to himself. This made Mary Jane even more confused and she put her bloated hand on his shoulder.

“What do you mean, who else told you?” Mary Jane asked, but Peter was to lost in thoughts to even acknowledge her. Everything he knows could be wrong, and that’s a lot to take in for a person, even a superhero.

“In this other world, are we, close?” Peter asked, looking Mary Jane in the eye.

“I honestly don’t know. I think we might have been, but anything is possible at this point.” Mary Jane replied, tugging at her extremely tight shirt and then fixing her glasses.

The two were interrupted when Iron Man and the Bumblebee flew to the top of the roof. Iron Man had gold and red armor, with an arc reactor in the shape of a square that flowed green in the center of his chest. Bumblebee didn’t wear a mask, so MJ knew it was fashion designer Janet Van Dyne, and she wore a skintight blue and red jumpsuit, and she was still thin.

“Spider-Man, what happened back there? People could have gotten hurt! And who the hell is that?” Bumblebee asked, crossing her arms and shooting Parker a scowl.

“This girl is saying the same stuff that we were hearing earlier. Like scarily similar.” Peter replied while standing up. MJ decided to stay seated, not wanting to struggle to make her massive body stand up on a roof.

Iron Man looked at her and scanned her, checking her vitals and heartbeat. He than opened his helmet to reveal Tony Stark, with a massive scar across his face.

“Miss, would you please come to our facility? We need to run some tests.” Stark said, and Mary Jane nodded in agreement. Peter than helped MJ stand and swung her down to the Quinjet.

After arriving at Avengers Tower, Mary Jane was brought to a room where the Avenger who shared MJ’s story was being held. Mary Jane opened the door and the Avenger was revealed to be...
1542121.title: True Love Is Eternal

15421212.content:
Mary Jane opened the door and the Avenger was revealed to be Kitty Pryde, who MJ didn’t think was an Avenger. Kitty Pryde always belonged on the X-Men’s roster, and MJ didn’t think that Kitty had ever even been an Avenger.

Another thing to note about Kitty Pryde was that like MJ and Felicia, Kitty has also been fattened up, and she did not look happy about it. The X-Woman looked to be around five hundred and fifty pounds in weight, with her gut being her biggest feature. She looked like a human beanbag chair, with her gut taking up her entire lap when she was sitting. Her butt was also very big, as were her breasts. Her face was also very round, with three chins and massive cheeks. Kitty wore a much larger version of her classic costume. Kitty looked up at MJ.

“Hey, I know you. You’re Spider-Man’s wife, aren’t you? I thought you were a supermodel. But maybe I’m really crazy.” Kitty sulked into her large seat, as a large creaking noise emanated throughout the room. Mary Jane sat down across from her, her jeans straining as she sat.

“I don’t think you’re crazy. I remember a different world where we are both thin, I am a supermodel and have a relationship with Spider-Man, and you are a member of the X-Men.” Mary Jane replied, while adjusting her glasses once again. Kitty practically leapt out of her seat, much faster than any woman her size should be able to.

“You remember that I’m an X-Men too? Thank God! I’m not crazy!” Kitty cheered as a glow of excitement radiated from her. She was dancing across the room, with her entire body jiggling and wobbling as the whole room shook. In the excitement MJ got up and hugged, as the two morbidly obese women started cheering, with more than one button flying off of MJ’s tight shirt.

Kitty and MJ sat back down, extremely tired and sweaty, clearly their new bodies weren’t used too that much physical activity.

“Do you remember how the world changed? How did it get so messed up?” Mary Jane asked, once again fixing her glasses and struggling to hold her shirt together. Kitty took a sip of water from a bottle and thought about the question briefly.

“Well it’s a long story, but it boils down to...
15421212.title: Shadowfat

154212122.content:
“Well it’s a long story, but it boils down to this guy from the far future called Kang. He goes through timelines and conquers the people of different time periods. He’s tried to take over our time before, but the Avengers were always there to stop him. The last time they fought, Kang brought a whole army with him, so the Avengers asked for help. The X-Men, Fantastic Four, even the Defenders were called in. But Kang transported the Hulk and him somewhere, and than reality changed.” Kitty explained, reaching over to a plate of nachos and sloppily eating one.

Mary Jane sat back in her seat, as another memory came to her. She remembered Peter swinging off to battle an army from the future, and how nervous that made her feel. MJ reaches for a nacho and ate it, with cheese subsequently falling into her cleavage.

“You’re right. I remember Pete going off to fight him. So we can assume that Kang messed with time somehow, and now all of reality is different.” MJ said while still chewing on a nacho.

“Yes, and no one remembers except for us, at least that I know of.” Kitty said, but as she said that the door to the room opened.

Tony Stark walked in, and without his armor MJ noticed that he was missing his legs, now relying on robotics to walk. Stark had a look of disbelief on his face, but he also knew, deep down that the fat girls were right.

“When you said the name Kang, it triggered a memory from the battle. You guys weren’t lying. I believe Kang and this Hulk creature were transported to the past, and did something to change the future.” Tony said, now leaning on a wall as the two women continued to eat.

“So we need to go back in time and stop them from changing the past. And everything will go back to normal.” Mary Jane said, with Kitty nodding in agreement.

“It’s not that simple. Colonel America claims that the people of this changed reality are what we should be thinking about, what’s done is done.” Tony replied, still thinking as Kitty and MJ sank in their seats. They had no desire of being stuck hugely fat for the rest of their lives.

“But what Colonel America doesn’t remember won’t hurt him. Come on, I know a guy who can help us go back in time. I just hope the doctor is in a good mood.” Tony continued as Kitty and MJ jumped from their seats and followed Tony to the door, as Mary Jane wondered who this doctor was...
154212122.title: Time Travel Ruins Everything

1542121221.content:
MJ, Kitty, and Tony took a Quinjet out of Avengers Tower, and flew only to the other side of the city. They landed their jet by in a parking lot and exited the jet, as Tony was now suited up in his armor and MJ and Kitty waddled behind him. They were walking down the dark street, as it was pitch black night. They approached a house with an odd window that seemed to be emanating a glow. Tony went to knock on the door, but the three were instantaneously transported inside, and were face to face with the Sorcerer Supreme.

Doctor Strange was practically the exact same in this timeline than the one Kitty and MJ remembered, and Strange looked at both of them with confusion. The eye necklace that dangled from his neck, opened and flowed purple. It than quickly closed as Strange chuckled.

“You two are definitely not from around here.” Strange said, as MJ and Kitty nodded in agreement, causing the fat on their faces to shake.

“And you wish to put the world back the way it was. Excellent, I will transport the three of you two the past immediately.” Strange said before doing weird hand motions, as sparks flew everywhere. Just as he was really getting going, a shield was flung at Strange, and ricocheted off him and hit Iron Man, before flying back to Colonel America.

“What happened to your world is a tragedy. But I cannot let you destroy this world.” Colonel America said, as the rest of the Avengers gathered around Colonel America, including Spider-Man. Stark got back up and fired up his repulsors.

“Strange finish the portal! I’ll deal with my team.” Stark said before blasting Thor and Wolverine with his lasers, as he flew and slammed into Spider-Man and Colonel America. Steve grabbed Stark and started hitting him, as Thor quickly recovered and went after Stark as well. Bumblebee flew toward Kitty and MJ and started blasting her stings, but Kitty grabbed MJ and phased the blasts through them, before swatting Bumblebee.

Strange got the portal ready, and went to go join Iron Man. Strange handed MJ a scroll, as he fired up a light magic sword.

“When you’ve fixed everything, read that incantation to be sent to the present. Good luck girls.” Strange said before swinging his sword at Wolverine. Kitty jumped into the portal, but MJ was blocked by Spider-Man.

“Peter, you know I’m right. I have to fix the world. It’s my responsibility.” Mary Jane said, as she got closer to Peter...

1553.title: Someone Else.

15531.content: Our heroine's story begins at…
15531.title: Yes, I want both.

155311.content:
Credit to Iwfan for the idea of the Superheroine's Repast, the name of which has been tweaked to be gender neutral. It's also being treated as an interdimensional nexus to avoid plot holes between this story and The Fat-tastic Four.

***


"Oof!" Carol groaned, pushing away her plate and leaning in her chair.

"You said," replied Jessica, following suit.

The two Avengers were having lunch at a new restaurant that opened: The Superhero's Repast. Customers who dressed up as a superhero received a 20% discount on all food. Actual superheroes ate for free. Intrigued by the promises of the restaurant, Carol Danvers and Jessica Drew—in their respective identities of Captain Marvel and Spider-Woman—decided to have lunch there today. The result? Two very stuffed superheroines.

"I might have gone a bit overboard with the fried chicken," Carol said, burping.

Jessica chuckled. "A little?" she teased, pointing at her friend's swollen belly.

Carol cocked an eyebrow. "Oh, like you're one to talk," Carol replied, eying Jessica's own food baby.

Jessica smiled, placing a gloved hand over the food-filled bulge. "What can I say? I do love deep-dish pizza."

Spider-Man walked up to there table. Or, rather, a waiter dressed as Spider-Man. "Will that be all, ladies?" he asked, pulling out a notepad.

Carol stifled another burp. "Ohhh… I don't think I can eat another bite."

Jessica nodded in agreement. Just as the two made to leave, the waiter played his trump card.

"Can I tempt you with dessert?"

Carol and Jessica stopped. Normally, the two would have politely declined and left. They would also, normally, not stuff themselves, and yet here they were, midriffs burgeoning with food. The two heroes looked at each other, then sat back down.

"What do you have?" asked Jessica, desire dripping from every word.

"Anything for our Avengers," the waiter replied.

Jessica and Carol looked at one another, then smiled.

"We'll have chocolate cake. And keep it coming," Carol requested.

The waiter nodded, and returned a few minutes later with a cart loaded with a dozen small chocolate cakes. Setting them down on the table in a ring, the waiter asked, "Will that be all?"

Carol and Jessica licked their lips. "Yes. Thank you," they answered in unison, before digging in.

The two Avengers ate with reckless abandon, shoving bite after bite of chocolate cake into their mouths and down into their gullets. Carol soon disposed of her spoon and began to just eat by the handful. Jessica tried to stay civilized, but she, too, followed Carol's example.

Throughout the ordeal, the waiter would replace an empty plate of cake with a new one with more cake. He did this twelve times before the two motioned for him to stop. After about half of an hour, Carol and Jessica had each consumed 12 cakes. Carol moaned, loosening the sash around her hip to make room for her bloated belly.

"Jess?"

"Yeah, Carol?

"We keep eating like this, they'll need the Hulk to get us out."

Jessica laughed, a hiccup stopping the sound. "More like both of them."

Carol laughed. "Let's agree, right now,before that happens—this'll only be a monthly thing."

Jessica nodded. "Agreed. But I will miss that cake…"

Laboriously, the two friends rose from their seats. Wrapping their arms around one another for support, Carol and Jessica staggered out of the restaurant.

"Hey," Jessica said, pointing to another table. "Is that Sue?"

Carol looked to where Jessica was pointing. "I think so. And I think I see Jen, too."

"And Medusa and Crystal are there, too!"

"They seem… different, though. I can't quite place my finger on it."

Shrugging, the two continued on.

"Wait… isn't Sue in space?"
155311.title: Lunch With A Friend.

choices: There's something strange about this restaurant…
1553111.content:
For the first week or so, Carol and Jessica did keep to their promise. Strangely, they had been unable to lose all of the weight from their last sojourn into the Superhero's Repast. It wasn't much—just five pounds, give or take—but considering the energy required of being an Avenger, it was quite odd. Then again, it had been a quiet week.

The strangest part was that Carol and Jessica decided to break their agreement at the same time. Their cravings finally got the better of them, and so they both set out to dine at the Superhero's Repast without telling the other. Sure enough, Captain Marvel and Spider-Woman found each other, face-to-face, standing at the entrance of the restaurant.

"You, too?" Carol asked.

Jessica shrugged, smiling sheepishly. "I just wanted some cake."

Carol returned. "Let's not go overboard this time, though, okay?"

"Agreed."

And with that, the two walked into the restaurant, knowing full well that they would only add another broken promise to the list.

They did start with a cake. It was a chocolate cake—one for each of them—with chocolate frosting and chocolate buttercream. It was also a very large, five-layer cake, meant more for a large wedding than a superheroine. It made no difference. Their bellies desired cake, and they desired a lot of cake. The two dug in with a voracity never before experienced by either of them. The first layer left them full. The second layer left them stuffed. Bellies began bulging after the first few bites of the third layer. The two began to slow down in their eating, barely trudging on through their cakes.

"I don't think I can eat another bite," Carol said in between bites. "But it's so good."

"I feel you," replied Jessica, cramming another spoonful into her mouth. "Part of me wants to stop, but the other part could eat this cake all day…"

An idea suddenly crossed Carol's minding, causing her to smile. "Bet I can finish mine before you finish yours."

Jessica looked at Carol, grabbed her spoon, and licked her lips. "Bring it."

And, with renewed gusto and vigor, the two Avengers resumed eating their cakes. In the end, it was Jessica who finished first, collapsing back in her seat triumphantly. "Victory!" she exclaimed, pleased with herself.

Carol finished the last of her cake and loosened her sash. "Beginner's luck," she replied, sarcastically but bemusedly.

The Spider-Man waiter from last week walked up to their table. "Will that be all for today?"

Carol and Jessica were about to leave when, oddly enough, their stomachs rumbled hungrily. Carol looked at Jessica and smirked.

"Round two?"

Jessica sat back down. "You're on."

Not one of them noticed that the cakes were already on the table.
1553111.title: Bending The Rules A Bit.

choices: Meanwhile, our heroines continue to glut themselves.
After a week of eating at the Repast, Carol and Jessica notice something amiss…
15531111.content:
The two men watched Carol and Jessica from behind a window, getting a view that almost made it seem that they were standing right in front of the table. Which, in a certain sense, they were, but not in the traditional three-dimensional sense. The room the two men occupied had been constructed inside of a pocket dimension, allowing them to watch the two Avengers from a close distance but not be in-sync enough with the rest of the universe to cause an obstruction or be detected. Behind them, the sounds of chefs cooking could be heard—pots and pans clamoring together, foods and oils sizzling on ovens, orders being volleyed from chef to chef.

"They're making good progress," the suited man said to his seated companion.

The seated man folded his hands together. "Yes, they are," he replied casually.

"Especially Captain Marvel—she has an appetite fit for four men."

"I wouldn't discount Spider-Woman just yet," the seated man observed. "She's showing a very gluttonous side of herself that has yet to be fully unlocked."

The suited man tilted his head, observing on Jessica with greater scrutiny. "She certainly has gusto. But I believe the Captain shows greater promise."

"I suppose it doesn't matter in the long run. Both of them will be sporting potbellies by the end of the month."

"No, I suppose it doesn't. But it certainly makes this more fun."

The seated man smiled. "A wager, then. By the end of this month, Spider-Woman will have fattened up the most."

"While I say Captain Marvel will be sporting more pounds."

"$200,000?"

"I don't believe we deserve a prize."

"Then what do you propose?"

The suited man smiled. "If I win, the Captain gets a cake made by you."

"And if I win?"

"Then Spider-Woman gets a cake baked by me."

The seated man stuck out his hand. "Then it's settled."

The suited man shook it. "Perhaps we should check on that other universal cluster at this point?"

"Let's," the seated man said, pushing a button on his chair.

The view changed. Where once was a scene of a Captain Marvel and a Spider-Woman feasting competitively on cake inside the restaurant now showed a Susan Richards standing outside the entrance of the Superheroes' Repast. She wore a large sunhat, concealing aviators, a Spider-Man T-shirt, and black jeans. In her hand, she held a bowl of shaved ice. The difference between this Susan Richards and the Susan Richards from last week, though, was that this one had already put on some weight, most of it centering in a potbelly that was almost completely concealed by her shirt.

"A gaining superheroine," the seated man stated. "My favorite."

"I do hope the other Susan from last week returns, though," the suited man said. "She seemed like she would make for a very fat Invisible Woman."

The seated man nodded. "But this Susan seems to have more potential. And, better still…"

A rumbling sound resonated through the room. Susan looked down at her belly, giving it a rub.

"… She's hungry."
15531111.title: A Thickening Plot.

choices: Not a few minutes later, a dinosaur is attacking the city!
Or do you want to do something else?
155311111.content:
Their second cakes went much the same as their firsts. This time, though, Carol was the first to finish.

"Like I said," she gloated, "beginner's luck."

Jessica smiled. "You do realize, of course, that we are now tied, right?"

Carol smirked. "Two out of three?"

"Start the clock."

The fact that cakes kept appearing on the table completely escaped the notice of both superheroines. They were too consumed in their competition to pay attention to the minutia. To them, there was only cake that needed eating.

It was during the sixth round that the nature of the contest changed. The score was 2-3, with Jessica in the lead. Carol, desperate to not be outdone, crammed the final slice of her sixth cake into her mouth, chewing it for a bit than swallowing it, and then immediately began her seventh cake. Jessica followed suit. No words were exchanged, but, from then on, it was an unspoken agreement that the contest had become a battle of who could eat the most cake.

Carol began to slow down towards the end. Ten cakes left her quite full and very bloated. With a groan, Carol reached for her eleventh cake, her only volition being the delicious nature of the cake. Slowly spooning off a mouthful, Carol took a bite, moaning blissfully as the cake's gentle but rich flavor flooded her taste buds. It was enough to make her ignore the pain in her very bloated stomach, which looked to be in its final trimester, bulging against the fabric of her costume. However, halfway through the cake, it soon became too much to bear, and Carol finally pushed back her chair, coming in at 10.5 cakes eaten.

Jessica, though, was an eating machine. Upon seeing that Carol had slowed down, she became relentless, increasing her score to 12, 13, 14… all the way to 16 cakes. While she felt like she was going to explode, Jessica was determined to eat one more dish—Carol's unfinished cake. Reaching over the table, Jessica pulled the plate towards herself, grabbed her spoon, and dug in.

Perhaps it was a bit juvenile, but Jessica wanted to make a show of eating the cake, to further emphasize the fact that Carol lost. Her spoonfuls were long and drawn out, and she never broke eye contact with Carol, who sat in her seat, massaging her bloated belly, eyebrow cocked in a bemused expression.

"Hitting a bit below the belt, aren't we, Jess?"

"I'm sorry? I can't hear you over the sound of my victory," Jessica teased, eating another spoonful.

It took a few minutes, but, eventually, Jessica finished the cake. With a mighty belch, Jessica leaned back in her chair. Her belly formed a large, burgeoning dome on her otherwise slender form, stretching the red-and-yellow fabric of her costume to the limit.

"That was rather unladylike," Carol said sardonically.

"You're just mad because I won, and you lost."

"I let you win."

"Sixteen-and-a-half cakes beg to disagree with you," Jess responded, patting her belly.

At that moment, the gravity of what they had done dawn on the two of them.

"Sixteen-and-a-half…" Jess whispered in shock.

"Ten-and-a-half cakes!?" Carol exclaimed. "Holy #@$%! Whose bright idea was this?"

"Wasn't it yours?"

"And you let me go through with it!?"

Jessica shrugged. "It was good cake."

"… Well, yeah, that's true."

The Spider-Man waiter walked up to their table. "Anything else today, ladies?"

"NO!" Carol and Jess shouted together in horror, startling the waiter.

"Sorry," Jessica said. "No, we're fine. The food was wonderful."

"Then, on behalf of the Superhero's Repast, I thank you for coming here this fine afternoon," the waiter said, bowing. And with that, he left.

Awkwardly, Carol and Jessica rose from their seats, using one another to support each other as they walked to the exit.

"I guess we went a bit overboard after all, huh?" Carol remarked.

"I will never get over how that waiter dresses up as Peter," Jessica replied.

Carol chuckled. "It is a bit weird, isn't it?"

Upon exiting the restaurant, Carol and Jessica collapsed on the brick perimeter of a tree near the Repast.

"This is going to come back to haunt us; I just know it."
155311111.title: They Went Overboard.

However, this is an interactive story, and there needs to be multiple choices as to how the story of Black Widow's weight gain begins. After all, throughout the different Marvel comic storylines, Black Widow has gone through different phases, switching between teaming up with different Marvel heroes like Iron Man and Captain America, to being a part of S.H.I.E.L.D and the Avengers, even to the point where she worked solo as an adventurer.

Though, if you decide to delete this entry, I'm not going to stop you. Now then, shall we go with fiery red-haired femme fatale from Russia? Or shall we choose another Marvel superheroine?

Actually, there was another method to Black Widow's weight gain.
