After all, it could be interesting as to how Natalia Romanova to adapt to her new size, since she's all too familiar with having an athletic and lithe body. So tell me, how exactly does our femme fatale get so big in the first place, hmm?
1553321.title: Black Widow

15533211.content:
The room was dark, all aside from one lone light bulb hanging from the ceiling. Three armed guards were surrounding the exit, with all their guns pointed strait at the chair at the center of the room, or more accurately, the deadly assassin tied down to the chair. She had blood red, long, strait hair, wore a tight black cat-suit with a red hourglass on the belt. She was fit, but still extremely beautiful with large breasts and a toned butt. Her weapons, including two pistols and her wrist mounted gadgets were laid across the table at the far end of the room. Natasha Romanoff did not enjoy being caught.

Known across the world as the Black Widow, Natasha was an Avenger and a current agent of SHIELD. She was assigned to an undercover job at a supposed Hydra science facility, as a member of the janitorial department. Unfortunately her adventures with the Avengers conveniently happening whenever her cover was gone drew suspicion. One raid and investigation later, and she was promptly tied to a chair.

Natasha did not like being caught. And her least favorite part was the waiting. An interrogation can go both ways, and she usually spun it in her favor. But waiting for the guy to come to her was so tedious Natasha felt the need to break out and kill everyone anyway. But she knew Nick and even Steve would be pissed. So she sat and waited.

The door swung open and two people walked in. One was the commander in chief, General Kowalski, a mean looking man who intimidated anyone he came across, besides Natasha. The other was a scientist that Natasha did not recognize. They both walked over to her, the scientist clearly nervous.

“Ms. Romanoff, or do you prefer Black Widow? Did you think you wouldn’t get caught?” Kowalski asked, as Natasha smirked.

“I just didn’t think it would be you who caught me, considering how little work you actually do around here.” Natasha replied, and the general surprisingly smiled instead of getting angry. He motioned toward the scientist, and the scientist quickly whipped out a large needle full of a blue substance and stabbed Natasha with it, and then he injected the substance into her.

Natasha began struggling, as she felt her suit tightening. She felt herself getting larger and larger, as her stomach grew into a muffin too. She also felt the muscles begin to gradually disappear, and be replaced by fat. By the end of the growth, Natasha now weighed five hundred and sixty pounds, a far cry from the one hundred and thirty one pounds she weighed but five minutes ago.

Natasha was absolutely massive, with an hourglass like shape, though not to discredit her extremely big gut. Her gut was pushed back by her belt, but it was bursting past it both over and under the belt. Her thighs were massive, and were pressed together at all times. Her massive butt was overflowing the chair, as tears in the seems began to form in her suit. Her already large breasts were now bigger than her head, and practically were completely showing despite her suit. Natasha no longer possessed a neck, instead having three chins and full cheeks.

“What did you do to me!?” Natasha screamed, horrified at her new massive body General Kowalski began to laugh, covering the creaking noise of the chair, until it snapped.

Natasha was free from her binds, but in a new body and outgunned. Normally this would be easily, but can the new fat Black Widow defeat the guards?
15533211.title: Getting Caught Has Huge Consequences

155332111.content:
Natasha grabbed a couple pieces from the destroyed chair, and threw them at the guards guns, knocking them out of their hands. Natasha punched the scientist square in the face. Though she would never admit it, it felt very good to punch with all of that new weight behind her. Her entire body jiggled when she threw the punch, her boobs almost falling out completely.

Natasha then waddled back to the table which her gear was on, and grabbed a smoke pellet. She dropped, as the room filled with smoke. Natasha grabbed her gas mask from her utility belt and put it on as she grabbed the barely conscious scientist while the guards and Kowalski were coughing up a storm.

“What the hell did you do to me!? How do I change back? How do I get my body back?” Natasha yelled. She was so angry her jowls were visibly shaking. The scientist looked at her and laughed.

“Please, why would I ever destroy such a perfect creation like you turned out to be? You will be stuck like this for the rest of your life.” The scientist said, before laughing hysterically. Natasha punched him again.

“I’m just going to work off the weight. It may take a little while, but you’ve been nothing except a minor inconvenience.” Natasha said, as the scientist began laughing again.

“You physically can’t work off the weight. Your body may be slow and heavy and fat, but it doesn’t think it’s anything over your original weight. Your body will shut down if you attempt weight loss. If anything, you’re better off gaining weight.” The scientist said before continuing to laugh.

Natasha punched him yet again, and then knocked him out. She than attempted to stand up, but found it very difficult due to her huge weight. Before she could get her footing, she was tackled by two men, and she landed with a loud bang. Natasha managed to kick one of the guards off, but the other remained. He attempted choking her, but couldn’t get past her neck fat. Natasha threw him off.

All of this left Natasha very tired. She was sweating profusely, and was panting like a dog. She felt as if she was going to pass out, and the last guard held his rifle right to her head.

“Well, *huh* I never *huh* thought I would *die* as a *ugh* massive fat ass.” Natasha said through broken breath, as the man turned the safety off. Right when he was about to pull the trigger, the wall to their right busted down, and Natasha was face to face with her backup.

Natasha hugged Clint like hadn't seen him in years which was weird because she just saw him before she got the mission. Clint had never seen Natasha this emotional so wait few more minutes before making his next move.

Before he could explain anymore more Hydra came to take them out. Clint shoot explosive arrow at them which lead to a onslaught of Black widow and Hawkeye killing about 5000 agents. The Facility only had 8000 agents. So by the time they got to the Shield rescue helicopter most agents were dead.

choices: Story 1: To Big Bertha, With Love
Interesting ideas, but let's see what other ideas there are for Gwenpool...
15533222232.content:
Ah, so you decided to go with Ms. Gwen Poole, hmm? Well, why not. After all, she's been receiving quite a bit of attention recently in Marvel Comics. Now then, here are some ideas for as to how Gwenpool packs on the pounds.

Story #1: To Big Bertha, With Love
Wanting to try out a new line of work besides being a mercenary for hire, Gwenpool tries her hand at joining the Great Lakes Avengers. After all, one of her favorite superheroine characters was none other than Ashley Crawford (who had now legally changed her name to "Bertha Crawford"), better known as the remarkably obese female superhero "Big Bertha". However, over time, Gwenpool began to develop affectionate feelings toward the now plus-sized superheroine, willing to do whatever it takes to win Big Bertha's heart. But when she finds out that Bertha happens to be attracted to women with some meat and adipose on their bones, will Gwen Poole be willing to pack on the pounds to gain her idol's affection?

Story #2: All Fat, No Play
Working the beat as a mercenary for hire, Gwenpool has recently accepted a contract to steal a magical artifact from a Haitian cult that enhances the wearer's strength and durability when worn. However, little does she know, that the artifact also happens to fatten up the wearer, especially if they are female. Can Gwenpool find a way to return to normal size, or will become accustomed to her newfound girth?

Well, what do you think?
15533222232.title: Gwenpool

choices: Meanwhile, Gwenpool had just arrived in Detroit, looking for the GLA.
However, just as Deadpool was about to leave, he runs into Gwenpool.
155332222321.content:
"You're Fired."

"WHAAAAAT?!" The Great Lakes Avengers members Good Boy, Big Bertha, Doorman, Flat-Man, and Mr. Immortal exclaimed in unison, reacting to the awfully blunt but terrible news coming from the Regenerating Degenerate himself, Deadpool. After all, they just got back from defeating an immensely blobby Doctor Nod and his rotund Bod Squad, who planned on selling an experimental pill supplement that allowed its user to alter their weight at will for approximately 24 hours, which was created from some of Big Bertha's Mutant genes and Mutant Growth Hormones. Suffice to say, they basically had to give the horrifically transformed Doctor Nod a heart attack to stop him from destroying the rest of Detroit.

"What do you mean "We're Fired"?" Flat-Man asked, greatly confused as to how this transpired in the first place. Of course, knowing Deadpool, he was always somewhat a major pain in the ass for most individuals in the superhero community, hence why his moniker was "The Merc With A Mouth", where he casually flapped his irritating gums as he--

"HEY!! ...I know where you live, Vocal."

...Well excuse me, "Wade", but I'm trying to write a goddamn story here. In other words: NO. BREAKING. THE. FOURTH. WALL! Especially from you casually backlashing me, Mr. Merc With A Mouth.

"...Fine! Don't blame me when your views on Writing.com start divebombing."

*Ahem* Anyway... Knowing Deadpool, he was always somewhat a major pain in the ass for most individuals in the superhero community, hence why his moniker was "The Merc With A Mouth", where he casually flapped his irritating gums as he bluntly explained, "The Great Lakes Avengers. You can drop the "Avengers" part. You're off the team. Finished. Turns out your legal claim to the name doesn't hold up in court."

From there, Deadpool raised his arms a little in a "Don't shoot me" gesture whilst he continued speaking and said, "But Hey! Don't shoot the messenger! Or do. I don't care. I'm immune to bullets." "So soon, though? We were just getting started..." Mr. Immortal replied, feeling quite disappointed from such a revelation, especially since they just defeated Doctor Nod and the Bod Squad hours ago. Although he could sometimes be a bit of a jackass at times, Deadpool somewhat emphasized with the now disbanded Great Lakes Avengers, as he spoke toward them and answered, "Hey, it wasn't easy for me to come here and tell you guys this. I had to promise to clean up Hulk's room for a month!"

And yet, despite Deadpool's wisecracks, Big Bertha and the other members of the GLA remained silent, taking in what Wade Wilson just told them, as well as coming to terms with the disbanding of the Great Lakes Avengers, as Deadpool spoke once more and said, "*sigh* ...Look, what are you gonna do? Its not personal or anything. People just...don't like you, that's all.Maybe we'll try this again in a few years. Who knows?"

And almost like a drop of the hat, Deadpool's tone switched from empathetic to snarky and chipper in nanoseconds, as he spoke toward Big Bertha and the others as he said, "Anyway, in the meantime, I'm off to have multiple adventures a month! Smell ya later!" And just like that, Deadpool exited out of the room and casually proceeded toward the exit, all whilst humming the song "Shoop" by Salt 'n Pepa. In turn, this left with Big Bertha, Flat-Man, and the rest of the Great Lakes Avengers all pondering the same question: "Now that they're no longer Avengers, what was going to happen to them next?"
155332222321.title: Joining What's Left Of The Great Lakes Avengers

choices: Eventually, Gwenpool arrives at the GLA headquarters.
Gwenpool reaches the GLA headquarters, where she heads inside to join the team.
1553322223211.content:
Meanwhile, just approximately 3 blocks away, a rather, um... "unique" individual was gleefully trotting her way towards the Stark Holdings Assembly and Manufacturing plant, which happened to be functioning as the current headquarters for the Great Lakes Avengers, casually swinging her arms freely to and fro, all whilst listening and humming to "Ignorance" by Paramore on her iPhone 8.

This individual, was none other than Gwendolyn Poole, from Earth-TRN565.

"But you can just call me "Gwenpool"."

...Well, yes. Better known by her trademark moniker, "The Unbelievable Gwenpool", or simply "Gwenpool" for short. Now, many in the Marvel Universe, whether they be superhero, villain, or civilian, would most likely think that Gwenpool was simply just a female pink and white knockoff of Deadpool.

"But hey! As they say in Transformers: "I'm more than meets the eye!" :)"

...Anyway, like Gwenpool herself said: "There was more to her than meets the eye". In reality, she was never originally from the Marvel Universe at all. Apparently, she is from another Earth--

"Earth-TRN565, to be precise...I think."

Thank you, Gwenpool. *ahem* Anyway, as I was saying... Apparently, she originated from another Earth, where the Marvel Universe and it's numerous array of characters only existed in comic books. And yet, through a set of bizarre circumstances, she was able to transport herself into the main Marvel Universe, Earth-616. During her stay, Gwendolyn took up her iconic alias, "Gwenpool". And yet, despite not having any actual superpowers--

"Umm... Excuse me, can we get back to the story here, Mr. Vocal?"

...Well, we have to do a little recap on a bit of your history first, Ms. Gwenpool. After all, there might be some people here who aren't familiar with you.

"...Hmm! Fair enough, I suppose."

...Well, anyway, getting back on topic... Despite not having any actual superpowers such as Super Strength or Flight, Gwenpool's vast extensive knowledge of the Marvel Universe has allowed her to perform some impressive feats, such as taking down Black Cat's criminal empire, stopping Thor from attacking her, and even going toe-to-toe with MODOK Superior and his Mercenary Organization Dedicated Only to Killing.

"So yeah, I've got a damn good resume for someone who doesn't have superpowers like Miles Morales or Amadeus Cho. Hell, I was even taught by Batroc The Leaper at one point!"

Of course, like Deadpool, Gwenpool mostly resorted to more... "violent" means when it came to fighting criminals and other super-powered individuals, using lethal weapons to take down any enemies. However, due to such lethal force, this made her inadvertently butt heads with a handful of heroes, including Miles Morales AKA Spider-Man, and the group of fellow young superheroes, the Champions, which caused her to be kicked out of the group as a whole.

"Thanks, Vocal. But I'll take it from here. Anyway, a few days after Miles, Kamala Khan, and the others kicked me out of the Champions, Laura Kinney AKA X-23 AKA The All-New Wolverine, wanted to invite me to join, drum roll please... THE AVENGERS!! Isn't that awesome?! Basically, she said that I could join any of the Avengers teams of my choosing. And you guessed it, I decided to join the Great Lakes Avengers here in Detroit!"

But, was there any particular reason why you decided to join the GLA, Gwenpool? You do realize that they're not as popular as Iron Man or Spider-Man, right?

"Well, duh! I'm well-aware that they're not as popular as those two. But hey, I'm pretty popular right now, so maybe it'll rub off onto them! Now, if you'll excuse me, Vocal: I've got an Avengers team to join!"
1553322223211.title: Receiving An Unexpected Visitor...Sort Of

choices: Being cautious, Good Boy looked through the door's peephole & sees Gwenpool.
Despite Big Bertha's warning, Good Boy opens the door and sees Gwenpool.
15533222232111.content:
Eventually, after wandering around the city of Detroit, taking in the sights as well as interacting with some of the locals, Gwenpool had finally arrived at the abandoned Stark Holdings Assembly and Manufacturing plant facility. Obviously a little too excited from finally joining the superhero equivalent of the big leagues, Gwenpool inhaled and exhaled a few deep breaths whilst she thought, "Calm down, Gwen. It's no big deal."

"No big deal?! YOU'RE JOINING THE FREAKING AVENGERS!!" Her inner thoughts exclaimed, which didn't exactly with settling down the butterflies in her stomach. Of course, Gwenpool eventually regained her casual composure and said to herself, " *sigh* Alright, girl. Here goes nothing." From there, Gwenpool approached the main entrance to the facility, with a duffle bag full of her usual weapons of choice slung over her left shoulder. Once she was through the front entrance and inside the factory interior, Gwenpool noticed that the place felt a little...vacant? No, more like "almost empty" would be the right context.

So, in an attempt to see if this was the right address and if the place was truly abandoned, Gwenpool spoke aloud and said, "Hello? Is anyone here? Is this the headquarters of the Great Lakes Avengers? Hellooooo?" Of course, the only thing that responded back was the echoes of her voice bouncing around the large interior, causing her to shrug a little as she spoke to herself and said, "That's...weird. Why isn't there anybody here?"

"Maybe they got possessed and turned into Deadites like in Evil Dead." Her inner thoughts remarked, which made Gwenpool roll her eyes in a "whatever" gesture. Fortunately, after a few minutes of wandering around the spacious derelict factory interior, she looked up and noticed some lights coming out of a lit room upstairs on the 2nd floor. Upon discovering this, Gwenpool couldn't help but display a hopeful smirk on her masked face as she thought, "Aha! I knew this place wasn't abandoned." From there, shortly after discovering that there were potential signs of civilization inside the manufacturing plant, Gwenpool casually ascended up flight of stairs until she was on the same floor as the lit room.

Once she was just outside the room, she slowly approached the window pane, peeking inside to see none other than the Great Lakes Avengers! Mr. Immortal, Flatman, Doorman, Goodness Silva AKA Good Boy, and last but not least, Bertha Crawford AKA "Big Bertha". Back on Earth-TRN565, Gwenpool had always considered Big Bertha as her favorite hero and idol, as well as having a, um... "crush" on the plus-sized superheroine. And yet, there they were, The Great Lakes Avengers, the obscure underdogs of the Marvel Universe, sitting at the circular table, conversing about...something, with their Defense Attorney, a woman named Connie Ferrari.

However, despite being unable to read lips, Gwenpool could easily tell that by judging from the looks on each of their faces, something in the blonde heroine's gut told her that things weren't exactly looking... "positive" for the Great Lakes Avengers as a whole. In fact, they look like they just absolutely lost a big battle against a lesser-known supervillain. "Damn. They look so bummed out. What the hell happened?" Gwenpool thought to herself, wondering if now was a good time to come back at a later date or not.

"Aww! Come on, Gwen! You didn't just traveled across a quarter to 1/3rd of the country only to have second thoughts! You wanted to join the GLA? Then get your leotard-clad ass in there right now!" Her inner thoughts assertively exclaimed, which forced Gwenpool to do as her inner thoughts demanded as she retorted, "Alright, alright! Jeez, my inner thoughts be such a pain." From there, still wanting to join the Great Lakes Avengers, Gwenpool casually trotted over toward the double mahogany doors, then administered a few firm knocks on the doors, which snapped Connie Ferrari and the Great Lakes Avengers out of their conversation, as they all instinctively turned their heads towards the source of the noise.

"Hmm... Wonder who that could be?" Good Boy asked, as she stood up from her seat at the table and began to approach the double doors. However, Big Bertha, still wearing the yellow one-piece swimsuit when she fought against Doctor Nod and his morbidly obese Bod Squad, soon stood up from her chair, placing a somewhat plump but firm hand on Goodness's shoulder as she said, "Hold on a sec, Goodness! It might be Dick Snerd behind those doors." Obviously, Bertha knew that there was a bit of a possibility that Councilman Dick Snerd, who also happens to be the vigilante turned supervillain known as "Nein Rouge", might have returned hellbent on revenge against the GLA for what happened to him when they interrogated him for evidence of his criminal activities.
15533222232111.title: Bad News, And More Bad News

choices: Taking Doorman's words for granted, Goodness opened the door for Gwenpool.
Being a little paranoid, Good Boy cautiously opened the door for Gwenpool.
155332222321111.content:
Of course, knowing that there was a chance that Councilman Snerd might be just outside their door with possibly a dozen goons to back him up, Goodness Silva heeded Big Bertha's potential warning, as she slowly and cautiously approached the double doors, making sure not to physically announce their presence to Snerd or whoever was behind the doors. From there, Goodness slowly crept up to the door, and peeked through the door's peephole.

However, instead of seeing Councilman Snerd and a dozen of his cronies waiting outside their door, the bluenette girl saw quite an... "unusual" and unexpected visitor, who looked like a pink and white female version of Deadpool, carrying a fully loaded duffle bag. "...Well, Goodness? Who is it?" Flatman asked, as he and the others were a bit tense, where Good Boy then spoke toward them and answered, "Actually, guys... It's not Snerd and his thugs."

In response to Goodness's words, Flatman, Connie Ferrari, and the rest of the Great Lakes Avengers (...Okay, Ex-Avengers) exhaled a sigh of relief from such a revelation. However, Mr. Immortal then spoke up and said, "Alright, but...who the hell's at the door then?" From there, Goodness looked through the peephole once again, just as Gwenpool began knocking on the door a few times as she said, "Helloooo? Anybody home? I'm here to join the Great Lakes Avengers!" A short moment or two later, Goodness peered away from the peephole, looking back at Flatman and the others as she explained, "...Well, um... This might sound weird, guys, but... She looks a little like Deadpool, only her costume's white and pink. Why? Does that sound familiar?"

"A white and pink female Deadpool..." Doorman thought to himself, recollecting his thoughts about who and where he's met this person before. However, after a short moment or two, Doorman eventually recognized who Goodness Silva was describing, where he then spoke toward his fellow Ex-Avengers and said, "Hold on for a moment, guys." From there, Doorman began to press his hands against a nearby wall, peeling open a Darkforce portal to traverse through, just as Flatman and the rest of the group noticed what he was doing, prompting Big Bertha to speak toward him, where she placed her somewhat plump hands on her plus-sized hips and asked, "And where do you think you're going, DeMarr?" "Me? I'm going to personally see who's at our doorstep, Bertha. After all, from what Goodness here described our visitor, she might be someone I am familiar with." Doorman answered, as he then entered through the Darkforce portal he created, which led him just outside the GLA's apartment, only a few yards above Gwenpool's current position.

Fortunately, Doorman easily recognized who their visitor was, as he then spoke aloud and said, "...Gwenpool? Is that you?" In response to what Doorman had just said, Gwenpool quickly looked up whilst pulling out and aiming her handguns upwards, only to lower them upon recognizing DeMarr Davis AKA Doorman. Then, she casually waved a friendly hand at Doorman, greeting the Darkforce user as she said, "Oh hey, Doorman! Long time, no see!"

From there, Doorman dismounted himself from the self-made Darkforce portal with relative ease, where he then landed just a few feet away from Gwenpool, as he then spoke toward her and replied, "Yeah, it kinda has been a long time, GP. Haven't seen you since we beat up that Ghost Rider knockoff, Vengeance, six months ago. So... How's life treating you?" Of course, looking back at the adventures she has endured over the past six months, one would say that she went through a lot of sh*t. So, in response to Doorman's question, Gwenpool rubbed the back of her masked head a little and answered, "...Well, you could say a lot of sh*t went down that I got involved with, "D-Man". I mean, I tried joining up with the Champions, buuuut... It wasn't exactly my cup of Joe, if you know what I mean."

"*chuckle* Well, it sounds like you were certainly keeping yourself busy. So, what brings you here all the way to Detroit, Michigan, GP?" Doorman asked, calling Gwenpool by the initials "GP", along with asking why she was here in Detroit in the first place. "Oh, that's easy, D-Man: I'm here to join you and Great Lakes Avengers! ...Why? You got some villain problems that need to be sorted out?" Gwenpool answered, pounding her right gloved fist into her left gloved hand a few times upon mentioning said "villain problems" with a sense of eager anticipation.

"F*ck! She doesn't know that me and the GLA just got fired!" Doorman thought to himself, realizing that Gwenpool might have not gotten the memo regarding the now disbanded Great Lakes Avengers. So, hoping that he didn't have to be the one to tell her the truth, Doorman cleared his voice a little and replied, "Oh, um... Yeah, we kinda have some "villain problems" that we're kinda dealing with before you got here, GP. Its just that it's a little more...complicated than we previously thought. Anyway, I'll let the others know you're okay to enter. Just give me a minute."

From there, Gwenpool watched as Doorman became intangible, allowing him to seamlessly phase through the double doors with ease. Once he fully phased through the doors, Doorman spoke toward his superpowered peers, reassuring them as he explained, "Don't worry, guys. She's a friend of mine. Definitely doesn't work for that a$$hole Snerd."

info.description:
I love DC and all, but WG interactives with Marvel women aere a sad minority. Here's to hoping this ails that.

Ground rules:

Do not graphically describe sex or nudity.They can be in the story but don't get too into detail.

Swearing is allowed, but keep in mind the characters.

I'm not expecting total in-character writing, but please, PLEASE keep a semblance of their personality.

Please be priginal with your gains, none of this 100000 pounds curse crap.

No immobility.

I reserve the write to delete shitty chapters.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask.
